Customer service is our number one priority and I am happy our staff was able to make your stay memorable.  We look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: Stayed here with my boyfriend for the holidays. Had a great time. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Not too close to Disney but not too far. House keeping was friendly and our room was cleaned very efficiently.

We had a wonderful experience at Hotel 414!  I decided to take my kids to Disney for Spring Break.  I started looking at hotel/motels about 2 weeks ahead of time.  I am super nervous about staying in hotel/motels because I am a bit of a germ-a-phobe and am leery of bed-bugs, etc.  I chose Hotel 414 because of the positive reviews and the photographs of the rooms.  Upon arrival, we spoke with the hotel manager, Ayesha.  She was very nice and helpful.  I was able to park on the hotel property, within view of my room, at no additional charge.  The room itself was immaculate, everything looked new, and smelled fresh.  I love the wood floors...they make the room look clean and appealing.  The hotel provided a hairdryer, small refrigerator, microwave, iron/ironing board in the room.

I’ve stayed here at the 414 Hotel a number of times for business and every time was great! I never have any issues booking my room and they always accommodate me. Rooms are always clean and smell fresh! It’s a small private hotel, easy parking right next to your door. I really hate dealing with elevators, lobbies and far away parking (with extra fees) I love how when I arrive, I park, check-in, and I’m at my door all in less than 5 minutes. Definitely RECOMMEND!!!!!

Stayed here with my kids on a mini vacation to Disneyland. I was hesitant at first since I usually just stay at Disney resorts when we come,but I’m very glad I found this place. Ayesha the Manager went above and beyond to make sure we where comfortable!

To be honest, I am kind of a hotel snob. I always book the upgraded rooms at the fancy hotels and spend way more money than I should because I'm worried the cheaper places won't be as nice, clean, and comfortable. Turns out, I'm totally wrong. This place had pretty good reviews and the rate was ridiculously reasonable, so we decided to give it a shot. Glad we did, because this place is perfect!!!   The rooms are super clean, have no carpet (woohoo!), have nice furniture, a mini fridge, and a microwave. I haven't seen a hotel shower that white in ages. I also like that their bath products are in dispensers rather than those mini bottles. It makes it so much easier to use, and it saves tons of plastic waste! This place has everything you need to be comfortable for a trip to

We stay here anytime we are in Anaheim going to Disneyland. We really appreciate the caring/competent staff and management.  The rooms are always clean and also roomy. We enjoy the invigorating walk to Disneyland which only takes me and my husband 15 minutes. We love walking. We also like that there are several good fast food places to eat and the close Neighborhood Walmart for any extras we may need.

Very clean rooms, nice staff, and a good price. We will definitely return again.  The hotel is a very close walk to Disneyland. Has a tv, microwave, mini fridge, fan, pool, and wifi. Rooms include everything you would need for a nice nights stay.
Manager Response: Dear Katie, I sincerely appreciate you taking time to let our future guests know about the Hotel. Our number one goal is to make every stay a good one. Your comments make us happy that we were able to meet our goal. We hope to see you on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: Pros: Good price for the location, a short walk to Disneyland (or take the local bus), very clean, friendly service.  Cons: The walls are thin, and you can literally hear the details of conversations in adjacent rooms, and God help you if there is a crying baby or someone decides to watch television late into the night. I stuffed toilet paper into my ears and covered my head with a pillow and got a little bit of sleep.  Also, although the room was seemingly very clean and the whole property was well cared for, there were MOUSE TURDS IN OUR BED near our feet on both mornings we stayed here, even after we made sure the maid changed the sheets. When we brought this to the manager's attention she was apologetic and insisted they'd never seen this before and would take care of it,
Manager Response: Dear Chuck 80442, I sincerely appreciate your feedback. I want to personally apologize for the inconvenience you experienced with your bedding. We employee a pest control service and this truly is not something we have seen. We understand that our reputation depends on providing a clean hotel for all our guests and do all that we can to make sure that is the case. Please be assured we have thoroughly re-checked and 'spring cleaned' your room so that future guests will not have the same experience.  We also understand that some guests are more sensitive to sounds when trying to sleep, so we now keep ear plugs at the front desk at no cost. Thank you again for taking time to help us make Hotel 414 Anaheim better.

Summary Heading: nice rooms and wonderful staff, but.......
Summary: I stayed in room 120, which is ground floor.  The rooms are very clean, the bed is nice (memory foam), bathroom is nice ( although it take for ever to get hot water to shower) and the staff was wonderful. Why then 3 stars? You needed ear plugs to be able to sleep. You hear everything. I thought, because it was an old building and built in California, the walls etc would be thick. Well I have never experience such a noise from neighbors. That made sleeping a challenge. I had to put on the air-co the whole night and earplugs. That is why I give it 3 stars. Maybe other people don't mind it, but I did.
Manager Response: Dear Edward, I appreciate you taking time to give us your valuable opinion and help us make the hotel a good choice for our future guests. Per your recommendation, we are looking into how to better insulate our rooms.  In the meantime, we have ordered ear plugs and are available (free) at the front desk. Thank you again for your time.

Summary: This is a generic motel that has had some trendy upgrades. Yes, the hardwood-esque floors are nice, but all the basics are missing. Linens and towels are cheap and scratchy, bulk shampoo dispensers, no great amenities. The pool area is like a trashy backyard, the rooms are LOUD (traffic, fireworks, every sound the neighbor makes), there is no free shuttle to the park, and no real restaurants anywhere within a safe walking distance. Disneyland is also about a 20 minute walk along a busy, dusty road. We checked out early because we were so disappointed. Switched to a hotel right across from the park entrance for an extra $10 a night, which was less than we spent on shuttle transportation while at the 414.
Manager Response: Dear GatoTaco2, Thank you for taking time to give suggestions so that we can continue to improve. We do try to provide a clean and comfortable experience for all our guests. Families love staying with us because we provide a great value while they visit Southern California, especially considering the cost to visit amusement parks.  I will definitely look into upgrading our towels and sheets.  We try to do our part for the environment by using dispensers for soap and shampoo versus plastic bottles.  We also try to put our most recent photographs on our TripAdvisor listing so guests can see how well we maintain our small property. Our location is indeed a 20 minute walk, but the majority of our guests prefer Uber/Lyft since it costs less than what the shuttle would cost.  I sincerely appreciate your feedback.

Summary Heading: Clean and a great place to rest after a long day at Disney
Summary: So, I was searching and searching hotels to stay at while in Anaheim and this one popped up. It had great reviews so I figured I'd give it a shot.  Now, first off, it's a motel, so you do hear noise from people parking their car and walking by since the bed is close to the front door (I could also hear some noise from the other rooms) but if you are only using this hotel to sleep in between Disney visits, then it's perfect.   It's close enough to walk to Disney (It's on a highway, but it was safe enough) and seconds away from a Starbucks and convenience store.   There's no bells or whistles, but honestly, I didn't need any of that.  The staff was super friendly and even upgraded me to a king sized bed!  I'll definitely stay here again next time I visit.

Summary Heading: Very clean, decent budget hotel a step up from the chains
Summary: Vibe: This is a renovated drive-in motel. Feels more fresh and modern than the motels used to be in the area. It is across from a Disney cast (staff) lot and borders a neighborhood. Gas station, Starbucks and the slowest Taco Bell in the universe are very close by. Room: Clean, has everything you'd expect including a fridge and a hairdryer. We were there strictly for a Disneyland trip so didn't spend much time in the room. I appreciate the hard floors rather than carpet because it's cleaner and reduces risks of creatures that shall not be named here. We saw no sign of any problems, everything worked great, the shower was really nice and the beds were hard but comfy for me at least. I think the beds were too hard for one of our party. Nearby businesses: DISNEYLAND! It's a good

Hotel 414 is an excellent hotel.  The room was SO CLEAN AND UPDATED. I loved the wood floors, the wooden blinds and the overall modern look.  The bathroom was beautiful and the walk-in shower was great.  The refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and coffee/tea was nice to have for our stay.  The woman at the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful.  A shuttle to Disneyland picked us up right in front of the hotel, we didn’t wait very long for the shuttle after we bought all day passes for $5 each from the front desk.  There is a cute pool area and many large blue ceramic planters with lovely plants on the property.  Nearby you will find a Starbucks, a Taco Bell and gas station.  I would gladly stay here again!  Two snaps up!  😀

I had an excellent experience during my 2 week stay at Hotel 414. The staff and management team were extremely nice and welcoming. The rooms were very clean and newly renovated with hard wood flooring, a fridge and microwave, tv, walk in shower and more! A short walk to Disneyland, restaurants and a variety of fast food places. There is a pool located here as well for those hot Cali days. I would highly recommend staying here!

Good value motel. They have done good renovations on the rooms. No carpets in the rooms, all laminate flooring. Redone bathrooms with showers, comfortable beds. It is 20 minute walk to the main gate at Disney which is convenient. No available breakfast at the hotel.  There is a pool but the cleaning of the pool chairs and pool area were not good. It was all dusty and not possible to use the pool chairs. Also the wifi had very slow speeds overall.

Summary Heading: Trendy hotel close to Disneyland with free parking
Summary: Stayed here for about 2 weeks and was very impressed with the entire experience. The staff/management went above and beyond to make sure our stay was enjoyable. The rooms had modern appliances including hard wood floors, modern shower, fridge/freezer, nearby ice machine and free parking. We would walk around the corner to watch the Disneyland fireworks nightly. Felt very safe and at home for a great price. I would highly recommend staying here.

There's a lot of inexpensive hotels around Disney. However, they're always a roll of the dice. This is an older motel, but they have done some solid renovations on the rooms. No carpets in the rooms, all laminate flooring. Redone bathrooms with showers, comfortable beds. The room was basic, but I was not there to lounge around the hotel. I was there to sleep. It was an 18 minute walk from the hotel to the main gate at Disney. That's pretty convenient.   The only issues I had were minor... their wifi has a good connection, signal wise, but very slow speeds overall. If I had to do more work while I was there, it could have become an issue. THere was also some construction noise in the mornings. That will end in time, I would think.   Staff were excellent, both for front desk and

Summary Heading: Best service I’ve ever had in the USA, no exaggeration.
Summary: Couldn’t commend and recommend the staff here higher. They were so lovely and accommodating, and really helped up out when we had to change our dates staying as we were stuck in the NY blizzard for a few days.   Room was absolutely great, lots of space, fantastic shower water pressure. Easy walk to Disneyland.   Would recommend bringing your own shampoo/conditioner/body wash unless you’re not fussy. Hairdryer was weak. Shower/bath could’ve been scrubbed more.  Will 100% be back next time I go to Disney and will recommend to anyone going; singles, couples, families or friends.

Super clean rooms, powerful shower heads, microwave, refrigerator, free ice, free parking, 15 min walk to Disneyland (my 6 yr old son made the walk both times with no complaints) and Ayesha is soooo nice and professional.  This is definitely where we are staying next time we visit and we'll be recommending to others.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Personal Service and Fresh Air as Well as Air Conditioning
Summary: It was great to stay in a hotel where I could open a window and breathe the air, instead of air conditioning and room fresheners. Room was spotless, beds super comfortable, strong shower jet and the location was great - walk to Disneyland and supermarkets, or a shuttle to Disneyland if you prefer. Personal care and attention - Ayesha even organised an Uber for me to go shopping on my last day. Thank you for a great finish to my USA adventure.

As a Fitness Manager at Crunch Franchise my job is ultimately customer service, I was impressed with how Clean and Curtious  the staff was with my Family, “Hotel 414” Truly lives up to their reputation!  Thank you for being Such Wonderful Hosts: Clean Rooms  Good TV channels And THE BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE👍🏼  Blessings🙏🏻

Summary Heading: Place to sleep when visiting Disney
Summary: So we needed a place for our three days visit at Disneyland. We ended up finding this place.  It is not a bad place to stay and the family that runs it, does a goes job. Friendly, good customer service, can’t say anything bad about that. Rooms are nicely renovated and have a nice feel. Bathrooms are modern and clean. Beds are comfortable and the room we had was quiet. The layout of the hotel is standard motel style, over two floors.  The part that I was a but disappointed by was that it is not exactly in walking distance of the park when you have little kids. It can be done if you are a backpacker, but most people will find a 20 minute walk from park entrance to the hotel a bit much.  This now brings us to a second problem: the price. There are hotels right across the road of

Room was very clean and comfortable, conveniently close to Disney only a 15 minute walk away and there are plenty of food places located nearby as well. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, would definitely stay here again.

My stay at Hotel 414 was EXCELLENT! Located very close to main attractions in Anaheim and Orange County (Disneyland 1 mile) A free shuttle or a $5.80 Uber/Lyft ride is what I used. Starbucks next door practically!  Extremely clean, safe, quiet. Staff was very helpful. Not to affect the rating at all but one key point; " if you have a disability such as Vertigo or MS, there is no elevator and you must request a first floor unit in advance." There are only 2 floors and there are 15 concrete steps to climb. I made it, but it was difficult, my fault though for not planning in advance.

Summary Heading: Has potential, but kind of crusty
Summary: This 2 storey older motel is independently owned and was (poorly) renovated within the last couple of years.   Pros:  - the lady who works front desk is as good as they get when it comes to customer service. I hope the owner appreciates her. She’s cheery. She helped us buy DL tickets and and offered some helpful tips.   - it’s exactly a 15 min walk to DL’s west gate - there is a Starbucks VERY close and a Walmart within 5 minutes drive - you can watch the Disney fireworks from the parking lot. (For those who considered this a negative, think about where you’re vacationing). - it felt like a safe area - cost was reasonable compared to the hotels right in and beside DL - cleaners did a good job daily - wifi was good - shower was hot and had lots of pressure   Cons: - the rooms:

We were very happy with our stay - the room was spotless and staff were friendly and helpful. Short walking distance to Disney or a $5 Uber ride. Swimming pool was a bit chilly but refreshing. Highly highly recommend!!

We are locals who go down to Disney on occasion and spend a long weekend. We booked a busy weekend of the half marathon, but a family matter came up last minute and we had to change our booking at the last minute from a 3 night stay to a 1 night stay.  Nalini, was incredibly understanding and helpful. I figured we would have to eat a huge part of the reservation, but she was able to minimize that even though I booked through a 3rd party.  The room and location are great. Very clean as others have mentioned. We've stayed at many of the hotels and this is by far the best of this class at Disney.  But the personal service is what I appreciated the most. We will return.

Summary Heading: GREAT Place! SAVE $$$ Easy walk to Disneyland
Summary: The staff is EXCELLENT! Very CLEAN & nice size rooms. Plenty of room to move around. FREE parking & GREAT rates compared to other places in the area.. Easy walk to Disneyland.  On the way you'll pass a Taco Bell, McDonald's, & gas station for a quick bite to eat.  I HIGHLY recommend this place

Summary Heading: One night stay was very good
Summary: The hotel is a bit of a minimalist place. No alarm clock on the bedside table, no breakfast, no little bottles and bars of soap and lotion, not even a bible, but what it does have is a nice clean room, comfy bed, with liquid soap by the sink and shampoo and body wash in the updated shower. Coffee to get you going in the morning and a shuttle to Disneyland. The young people nowadays don't use clocks, just cell phones and there are lots of plugs all over the place to recharge them and any electronic device you bring. It's an updated 2 story nice place to spend the night.

We were not expecting much, just a room for the night after a hockey game. We were really surprised to find a very clean and well maintained hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. The only downside is a little bit of road noise, but thats me beeing very picky. It was absolutely no big deal. I will definately come back if I’m in the area again!

Summary Heading: Great place within walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: I was very happy with this location and enjoyed being able to walk to Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure.  The staff let me keep my car parked there on the day I checked out so I could enjoy the park until it closed and then walk back and take my car to leave.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The bathroom was nice and updated just didn't really care for the hook the toilet paper hang on but it was okay.

Summary Heading: Pleasant front desk, clean and cute little place
Summary: We had a great time in this cute little place . Young man greeted us with a big smile when we entered the lobby .  Check-in was very easy and less than 2 mins if we didn't have bunch of questions and he politely helped us find places .  When we entered room smell was fresh and one of the cleanest room we stayed in state in low budget . The room is very simple but most of the stuff you need everyday life it's there . Love the walking shower and soap , shampoo Despenser. Ayesha is very sweet and kind always ready to help . She always greeted with a smile and asked how was everything.  Close to Disney and many restaurants . At night there are homeless people when we were coming to the hotel but you can see many homeless people even near Disney . Afterall experience was great and

I was very impressed with this hotel. The front staff were very nice, maids that I never seen did an excellent job of cleaning and stocking. The room was very spacious, loved the large shower, had mini fridge and microwave. Very clean and great location. Minutes away from Disney entrance and variety of food locations. Reasonably priced.

The people at the hotel were very kind accommodating when our AirBnB unexpectedly canceled on us at the last minute. They helped us find an appropriate room even though it was in the middle of the night, kindly let us have a late check out the next morning, moved us to a bigger room the next day (we were a 4-person party), and let us move all of our stuff into the new room early. The hotel rooms were relatively quiet, very clean, and comfortable. Much appreciated!

I was skeptical about staying here and I read all the reviews and booked a double room for one night.  We live in north Los Angeles County but with traffic it can be a three hour drive down and back and spend a full day in Disneyland, it’s just too much for me now.  We arrived the night before and the checkin was a breeze.  The young lady at reception was so sweet.  They do charge a 100.00 refundable deposit in case of damage to the room.  I had no problem with that because we weren’t going to damage anything.  It was refunded the next morning.  The room was clean and modern and that’s what we were looking for.  Down the street from Disneyland, it was perfect for us.  Please don’t hesitate booking here.

We had two rooms, they were clean (sparsely furnished). Largest complaint was hard mattresses - If you like hard mattresses this place is for you. The beds squeaked a little when you reposition (this woke up my daughter). Staff was friendly and location was convenient and safe.

Stayed three nights very impressed with how clean the rooms were. The front desk staff was exceptional. Great location from parks main entrance, within walking distance and had a spectacular view of the fireworks from Hotel.

My kids and I just stayed at the motel for 1 night and it was very nice and clean.  Bed was a bit too hard for me but still worth it.  It's about a 10-15 minute walk to Disney but there is also the ART shuttle that goes to Disney.

We stayed here after a long day at Disneyland and it is nice and clean. Nice people and very close to the park. Much better than driving back to San Diego after a long day. This is a small motel and very reasonably priced.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfy, friendly place to stay.
Summary: My family and I rented two rooms for two nights and we were totally impressed with how clean the rooms were and how amazing they smelt when we walked in. We loved the showers! The staff was super friendly and very helpful. I will tell people about this Hotel and will definitely stay here again when the opportunity arises.

Summary Heading: perfect value choice, walking distance to Disneyland Park
Summary: I did a ton of research to pick a hotel near Disneyland that was reasonably priced. this seemed too good to be true, so I was skeptical. but it worked out perfectly. this is not a luxury property, but it's clean, the staff is super friendly and helpful, there's free parking and it's an easy 15 minute walk to the park entrance. there's a Starbucks a block away, and plenty of restaurant choices a short drive away. it has a swimming pool too highly recommended!

Summary Heading: Amazing for such an affordable rate
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights while going to the Disney parks, and it was totally worth it. Very clean! Although there isn't a tub, the shower does have a small window to crack open so the bathroom and bedroom don't get steamy. The air conditioner works wonderfully and there is a good TV, microwave, and fridge, but my only complaint is how firm the mattresses were. Overall, that didn't matter much because we'd get back from the parks so exhausted that sleep came quickly.

I was impressed with the new furnished/renovated rooms.  I highly recommend this spot. Über rides to and from the hotel to Disneyland was $5-$6. Ayesha the hotel manager was very attentive and friendly. I have no complaints and would recommend to families as this is well-priced and a great 'find' amongst all the other hotels. Taco Bell, Starbucks and a service station is just a 2 minute walk. Perfect for a quick bite!

The place was very cost effective so I was pleasantly surprised by the value. The room was large and clean. Lovely shower and bathroom. Ada compliant. Right down the street from Disney.  The check in was hassle free as was checkout. Was honestly one of our nicest stays on our trip to socal and also was best value. We'll be recommending to friends and family for sure.

I was in town for a business conference and being on a startup budget, decided to try out this hotel instead of the conference hotel which was probably 3x the rate.  It was quiet, clean, and just what I needed.  I was actually pleasantly surprised by how quiet considering that it is next door to Disneyland.  I had no disruptions at night.  Internet was good.  I was able to get work done.  Since it is kind of barebones for the business traveler, it did take me a little bit to figure out how to work the coffeemaker, TV, get the AC going, etc, but it still had everything I needed in good working order.  It was also quite spacious.  I could have held a yoga class in the room.

Very clean, incredibly nice bathroom, no weird smells, no bugs, close to Disneyland and Starbucks, staff was very nice, shower was great, comfortable beds, let us store luggage before and after check in and check out. Would highly recommend!

Summary Heading: Excellent balance of price and quality
Summary: .  Pros:  price is great.  Starbucks is a block away Clean room, polite staff Great location  Beds were comfy, shower was great.  Lots of counter space for luggage.  Microwave and fridge.  Cheap Lyft/Uber to Disneyland  Housekeeping never knocked before we left for the park. (La Quinta kept waking me up at 7am. Even on the day we were scheduled to check out.)  and the room was great when we got back.   Cons:  No free breakfast (but a microwave and fridge, so you can make your own, which I prefer anyway.)  2 star motel. No frills. Shower,  no tub. No hot tub. Pool looked good, but we didn't get a chance to use it.  Pillows weren't awesome, but they were good enough.  Sheets weren't quite square on the bed.  Only one chair in the room.   No. It's not the Grand Californian. But it

Summary Heading: A decent and budget hotel closed to the DL theme parks
Summary: We a family of 4 stayed in the hotel for 3 nights in late July in this summer. The front desk was very helpful even when we've arrived nearly at midnight in our first night. They even arranged discount tickets for us late at that night. A Taco-bell is next to the hotel and we had quite and good breakfast before our visit to the theme park every morning. We enjoyed a lot in our stay.

Summary Heading: Clean room, would I stay again...maybe not
Summary: My wife and I stayed in August 2017, the motel is very clean and the room is as pictured in their photos. The bed is comfortable and the fridge is cold. Ice machine on site too. The location is about 15 minutes walk to/from Disneyland. (US$6.00 Uber ride) about 3minutes down the road from McDonalds and Wallmart. Parking is directly outside the room. on our 2nd night, we woke at about 3am to loud banging. it was someone attempting to break into the cars parked outside the rooms. management is not 24hours and no security is on duty.  I feel that something should be done to avoid people not staying at the motel from entering. The final thing I would say is that I asked reception if they could provide me details of a rental car company close to the property and I was told to "just

This hotel is very clean and staff is friendly and very accommodating.  We didn't care about breakfast and spend most of our day at the park.  We've stayed here twice this summer when visiting Disneyland. Easy walk to park, less than 15 minutes and close to a Starbucks!

Average Basic Motel. Clean, Newly Remodeled, Tight Parking, Pool Only, No Hot Tub, No Continental Breakfast, Hidden Fee's and 1+ mile to Disneyland (Not Walking distance). I reserved our stay on Southwest Airlines.com. When reviewing the policies, fine print etc... My total was $356.04. My confirmation e-mail states and I quote "We don't charge any reservation, administration or other fees."  When I checked in the Front desk representative pulled up reservation and proceeded to CHARGE she didn't even give me the option to pay in cash or any other form of payment ,at the end of our stay. Our total stay came out to $356.04 Plus an additional CHARGE of $100.00. Not a Hold. A charge of $100.00 for an additional deposit. When I asked her why she was charging me for an additional
Manager Response: Hello Secretv2, Thank you for taking time to write about us.  I apologize for the confusion you experienced regarding the $100 refundable deposit. I do notice that your deposit was indeed refunded to you when you checked out.  Our number one goal is customer service and we are up front with what guests will pay when they arrive.  We try to make sure all our on-line booking partners display the deposit policy on all booking confirmations.  I will look into your particular booking with Southwest to make the sure policy is clear to future guests. The deposit is fully refunded upon departure if the room has not been smoked in or items are missing or damaged.  We know how hard our guests work to make a Disney vacation happen and we truly are not out to cheat our valued guests when they come to our hotel.

Summary: Pleasant hotel, clean, tidy and comparatively reasonable priced. On a major road - 20 minute walk to Disney. Pleasant staff.  Supermarket and eateries not far from hotel. Disney was disappointing-becoming old and very expensive for family - mostly suits younger children.

I had an awesome stay here I'm very fortunate that Disneyland is right around the corner the staff here are very friendly highly suggested there was plenty of parking and not to mention plenty of locations to eat this place really knows how to host

The front desk people are friendly, service is awesome, and rooms are fresh and clean.  I didn't go to Anaheim to visit Disney, but it is close to Disneyland as well.  This will be my first choice for future trips to the area!

I stayed for two nights with my 11year old son while visiting Disney and I would highly recommend staying at Hotel 414 for the following reasons: The owners were absolutely helpful and friendly, they treated us as if we were good friends. Super informative. They helped us save money with shuttles, etc. Always eager to assist!  The rooms were  immaculate, and pleasant to stay in. (The bathroom was roomy!) There is a pool to cool down in while on a break from Disney. Very important in July. There is a shuttle that is a 5 minute drive to Disney, cheap fare, all day ticket.  You can also walk to Disney, 12 minutes. (That is at a casual walking pace. One street.)  2 minute walking distance to Starbucks for a quick bite or some java. They open early, close late.  Good rates, worth the

Very clean hotel with great service...my girlfriend and I stayed here for a few nights and it had everything we needed. The rooms were very clean and Disneyland was right down the street. Hopefully Ayesha is there to help you out, she is the best!!

I stayed couple nights in this hotel with my granddaughter and was pleasantly surprised of everything in that hotel!Staff was awesome,helpful and extremely nice!Room was updated,everything was new and crispy clean! I was impressed with a wood floors! No dust ,no allergy!Hotel is located with walking distance to  plenty restaurants,grocery store,gas station,Starbucks and Disneyland.Very convenient!Surprisingly it was quiet and we could sleep in. We felt like we were at home:safe and taken care off! Ayesha,hotel manager,was such nice,welcoming person,always ready to help!Honestly I thought she was the owner of the hotel because  of the way how she was taking cared of us and the business!I definitely will stay there again and would recommend this little Paradise to my friends and

The staff was friendly, the Disneyland park was a 10 minute or less walk, the pool was regularly cleaned. Overall a great experience. I'm certain I'll be a repeat customer. Also the pictures are accurate. Be aware, however, that there are a lot of people using the wifi. It may be buggy sometimes.

I want to start off by saying that I had such a good experience with this Hotel that it prompted me to write this review the day after, which for me, is today. My fiance and I were looking for a good deal on a place to stay the night before we went to California Adventure, we were able to get a room at Hotel 414 on very short notice and for a reasonable price. I expected to be disappointed when we arrived, but I wasn't. Ayesha at the front desk was very friendly and was expecting us because we checked in online from my phone. She got us checked in very quickly, and was very accommodating when I asked for walking directions later. The room itself was a pleasant surprise, the TV had a great selection, the bed was clean, and the A/C unit made the room very comfortable. The bathroom

My daughters and I stayed here for 2 nights as part of our California vacation. When I first called and made the reservation Nalina was very knowledgeable and helpful.  Upon arrival they are very friendly at check-in and the room was clean. The hard wood floors are a real treat! The shower was amazing with great water pressure.  The beds are decent with a comfortable nights rest. On the second day though we came back from Disneyland and only one of the beds were made and fresh towels were not left after taking the used, aside from that we had a nice stay and the price is great! The only drawbacks to location were the fireworks that go off at night, they are so loud in the room that it made it hard to miss every 15 min that goes on for 2+ hours. Starbucks is only 1.5 blocks away

Hotel is excellent. We were there with our family for 4 days and its a great location close to Disney and lots of entertainment and restaurants. Room is surprisingly bigger than other hotels and was very clean. Staff was great in taking care of us and overall was a great place to stay

I did a lot of research on hotels/motels in the area and I just cannot see paying more than $150 a night to basically lay your head on a pillow each night.  All I want out of a room is for it to have the basic necessities, comfortable bed, TV, hot shower with adequate water, look and smell clean, and be quiet when I'm sleeping.  Hotel 414 is all this and more.  The outside is small and not all that impressive looking but inside the luxuries await with clean updated rooms, wood floors, beautiful bathroom and shower with great pressure, hair dryer, iron and ironing board, and comfortable beds.  We only used the ART shuttle to Disneyland, which picks up in front of the motel, one day as I preferred the convenience of using Lyft.  The shuttle comes every 20-30 minutes but doesn't

Hi my me and my wife want to give this hotel five stars I visited last weekend and all I can say is good things Ayesha was very nice and helpful !!!! very nice my hotel it was always nice and clean really close to Disneyland I would definitely come back you can see the fireworks from outside your hotel there is a Starbucks at Taco Bell at a Chevron and it's also affordable 😊👍🏽

So much wrong with this hotel. While the reviews seem amazing look closer at them as it appears the only good ones are from people with zero history of reviews, meaning it appears the owners are writing the reviews themselves.  While the rooms are clean, the beds are beyond terrible. Bed springs poke through the mattress and every time you move the bed squeaks. You will absolutely not be able to sleep here. Room furnishings are cheap and overall room design lacks common sense. Poor location of a small tv and bad use of space overall. Everything is cheap accept what they charge you to stay in this overpriced low budget hotel. Location is NOT within walking distance to Disneyland unless you like walking over freeways, homeless people, druggies and walking and walking and walking.
Manager Response: Dear Trish, I appreciate your comments regarding our hotel, I have to point out that our 100% non-smoking property policy as well as the deposit upon arrival policy is on every booking confirmation.  We are a small hotel, which is one of the things our guests love about us.  Our number one goal is to provide a good value with excellent customer service to families while they visit Anaheim.  We offer guests a shuttle service for a small fee and many families use Ride Share options if they have small children.  Being so close to Disneyland, our guests love that they can see, and hear, the fireworks right from our parking lot. I will definitely take a look at the beds you mentioned.  Our guests' reviews show that our reputation is extremely important to us and we appreciate your input.

Summary Heading: Clean, not luxury, but not bad
Summary: Don't go to bed before 10:00pm because Disney fireworks sound like they are being shot off in the parking lot.  Small lot by the way so not a place to chose if you are towing anything.  No place to turn around and no back way out.  Room fine except only chair was a desk chair.  Not a lot of bang for the buck.

Got to the hotel and was greeted by a pleasant front desk gentleman.  He was quick and nice to deal with.   We were given our keys and directed to our room.   The outside of the building is simple looks more like a motel then a hotel,  but when you open up the door to your room it's decorated nicely more like an upscale modern lux hotel.  I particularly liked the wooden floors it was nice to be able to walk on floors you knew where clean verses carpets that who know when the last time was steam cleaned.   The bathroom was clean the shower was great and had great pressure.   Now comes the interesting part.  I sat on the bed and it was the hardest bed I have ever felt,  so I was not looking forward to crawling into bed that night.  But when I did let me tell you!!! I never slept

there is a saying in life that " you get what you pay for ".  In this very rare case you get a lot more than what you pay for. Very clean room, walking distance to Disneyland and plenty of places to eat.  the 414 will always be my first choice whenever I go back.

So, I stayed last weekend, at first I was a bit worried that I was going to stay at a random low service hotel due to its great price, since I live 6 hours away, but NO I was very, very wrong. I got there to check in and the receptionist was very friendly and kind, she even gave me a choice to stay on the first or second floor. FYI the upper floor is very quiet. I got the two keys and went to my room, very tidy and nice, love the design; especially the wooden floors. The next day I left for Disneyland and when I came back the shuttle left my family and I infront of the hotel. I was very pleased for their service and I enjoyed my stay!!!

Friendly owners and cleaning staff.  Very comfortable & clean.  We were going to rent a second room and the owners offered to move us to the suite for just a small upcharge.  Very accommodating.  Would return.

This hotel is one of the best around the area. The location is perfect for us. Starbucks, Taco Bell and Chevron are next to the hotel. Lots of fast foods and restos as well ( 3 to 5 mins walk ). 7/11 is only 3 mins away only from us and lastly, its very close to Disneyland. Theres a shuttle bus for Disney every 20 mins next door. PERFECTO!!! Now talking about the hotel itself. This hotel is way better than those ones that are known around the area. Reviews do tell the truth. The room is super big ( very spacious ) super clean and modern ( looks like new renovated ). The water power is to die for. I love taking a shower with that much water pouring down on me. Feels like a waterfalls. To sum it up, its one of the best private owned hotel i've ever stayed in. Not to mention the

" Clean , quite and incredible staff " Only 15 mins walking to Disneyland and shuttle service also available near this hotel or many uber drivers are there.This is a lovely place that anybody enjoy their vacation. Very clean and nice housekeepers. Bed is little firm but we felt asleep like babies . We wouldn't pick any other hotel other than this little gem when we are going to Disneyland .

Very nice, clean and tidy Hotel. We will be going back there again to stay.and would recommend this hotel at any time.My family and I had a nice time. For your convenience, there is a Starbucks close by. And free parking. It is a real gem for families visiting  Disneyland.

This hotel is a bit of hike from Disneyland, but totally worth it for the tastefully designed space, which appears to have been recently remodeled with excellent design choices: laminate floors, walk-in tile shower (with great water pressure!), solid surface countertop and modern fixtures. Kudos to the designer!   The bed seemed a bit hard on first try, but in the end slept soundly with no aches or pains in the morning, and the AC provided a nice white noise background for a solid night's sleep.   Very friendly staff. Overall a great experience!

Comfortable, clean room, with free unlimited wifi. Only 15 min walk from Disneyland. It's also close to Subway Restaurant, McDonalds & Walmart. The management/staff were very friendly and helpful. They ensured we had a great stay. I would definitely stay here again. Highly recommended!

Fantastic little motel with wonderful and friendly owner Ayesha (who had lots of tips for the local area)! Rescued our holiday last minute from our initial hotel which was undergoing major building works. Rooms clean and finished to a great standard. Modern, clean and minimalistic but well furnished with microwave, fridge, coffee maker, lovely desk and chair, tv and good quality wifi! Wonderful hotel right near Disneyland!

I picked this place over my usual place Stanford inn and suites because of the reviews and location to Disney that was walking distance, although the lady was very friendly, the place was not all that, it seemed to be a shady area at night, homeless people at the corner store/ Starbucks, asking for money every night when we came back, other than the upgrades that were nice, I thought it was weird that there was no carpet, I quickly found out why, if you move the bed for any reason they claim you scratched it and keep your 100.00 deposit....SCAM!!!! And the maid took the 10.00 tip and didn't make one of the beds claiming it was moved and she would be charged if she made it, so being that I've worked in hotels I took pictures before and after, and what did I find? Filth underneath
Manager Response: Dear Anna, I appreciate you taking time to write about your stay.  We are indeed located near some residences as well as some local coffee shops.  I have to mention that  when you mention that your deposit was not returned.  We ask that guests not move the furnishings in the room for safety reasons.  I have to point out that even though your room was completely rearranged, your deposit was fully refunded.   I can provide another copy of your folio if you would like. Your folio and email confirmation made during the booking will also show our 72-hour cancellation policy, which is standard at most hotels here in Anaheim.  The amount you were charged was only for the nights you actually stayed. Our goal is to provide an excellent value and great customer service for families when they visit Disneyland, and as most of our reviews show, our guests appreciate our honesty and efforts.

Summary Heading: the best motel I ever stayed in!
Summary: Only 15 minutes walk from Disneyland, attentive and nice staff, from the reception who gave us useful tips to maids who were very friendly and professional. Rooms clean, modern design, fresh, brand new furniture ...it felt good coming back after a long day out in the parks with always replenished clean towels and coffee.. We could have simple bfast itn our room and even dinner with a microwave and  a fridge it is quite convenient.Walk in shower,  clean wooden floors, no smelly carpets and curtains like we usually see in other more expensive motels. Excellent value for money, I am definitely going to stay here again.

Summary Heading: Clean, Quiet, Perfect for Disney Visit
Summary: This hotel is only a 4 minute shuttle ride* away from Disneyland. It is perfectly clean and the management is kind and attentive. We got an end room and found it to be very, very quiet. I don't usually sleep well in hotels, but I slept quite well here--good beds, good A/C, quiet room. The pool is clean, though it doesn't seem to be heated (no problem on a hot day!). The parking is adequate, too--no microscopic spots, and one for each unit, as far as I could tell. Parking is free, too, which is a plus! There is no breakfast provided here, but the Starbucks on the corner (across from Hotel Menage) has everything you need (egg dishes, yogurt, pastries, drinks . . .) and tables, too. We've tried several area hotels but will always stay here in the future--so glad we found it!  With

My wife and I took a trip to Disney for our 1 year anniversary and stayed at Hotel 414. It looks like a standard motel from the outside, but the room was well-kept, aesthetically pleasing, and great for the price and location (15 minute walk to Disney). Above and beyond that, the staff is excellent. Very friendly, and they made an effort to make our anniversary special which was unexpected and much appreciated. I rarely write reviews, much less for hotels, but I feel compelled to help these guys out in any way I can. If you're looking for a cheap spot to stay outside of Disney, this is the one.

Friendly staff and mostly clean room. Most disappointing aspect was the noisy air conditioning unit in the room. That said, we were so tired that we crashed out anyway! Big plus was its proximity to Disneyland and the moderate price for the room. Would stay again.

Very comfortable,clean room.  Bathroom had a walk-in shower rather than tub.  Staff is very helpful.  I chose this hotel because of the non-carpeted floors and was happy I did. ART shuttle to Disneyland stops outside, but going to the park it's more convenient to walk over to catch another line at the Hotel Menage.  Coming back shuttle leaves you right at the 414 - make sure you catch the correct shuttle number.

Summary Heading: The nicest motel I've ever been to
Summary: This place is so legit. The outside is nice and the lobby is clean. The woman at the front desk was friendly and checking in was a breeze. The room is amazing. It looks so new. And it's huge. I showed my BF pictures and he said it looked like an apartment. The bathroom was so amazing- I would love if my bathroom at home looked like that. I ended up having the room to myself because my BF had to cut our trip short for a business trip. There was so much space for one person I could have done cartwheels in the room. It's also really close to Disneyland and I was able to take a Lyft there and back for about $5-8 each way. I would definitely stay here again.

No carpet room, wich is great for people with respiratory problems.  Excellent location nearby good restaurants. We sent a lot of packages to the hotel and everything was fine. I would like to thank Ayesha for the excellent service. The room is very clean. Free wi-fi.

The staff are friendly and the rooms are super clean and so comfortable... with large fridge for storing your drinks and food. Great place to stay with family. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone needing a stop over for the fun parks.

I was planning to stay 5 nights, but about an hour after I arrived, I had to leave for a family emergency. Management was very kind and understanding. They charged me for the first night, but gave me my money back for the next 4 nights that I had booked. The management even contacted me a couple of days later to check up on me!

We stayed here for two nights on a trip to Disneyland, and I was very skeptical at first. For such a good price, and a great location there had to be something wrong. But no! This was one of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed in. Comfortable beds and friendly staff. This is by no means a fancy resort but with all the money we saved we splurged at Disney. You can walk to the park, although I wouldn't recommend it with little kids. Uber was $5. Thank you!

Staff was very nice. I think it's family owned because I could hear kids screaming in the back room while I checked in. Our room was nice except it was next to a persons home that played Mexican music the whole time during the stay. It's not too far of a walk to Disneyland  but it's a dangerous walk. We had to cross 2 freeway entrances with 2 kids. Then walk on a tiny sidewalk next to cars going 55 mph gripping our children's hands tightly so they wouldn't fall off the sidewalk onto the road. We also passed a few homeless people that were sitting next to the hotel.

This is a very clean, functional hotel very close to main Disney, in fact, so close you can see the fireworks from the bathroom window! The owners are very friendly, the beds are comfortable. All in all , great value.

It's tough to think a motel can be a 5 star joint, but Hotel 414 really did a great job with their renovations. Obviously it's not the same as staying at the Disneyland Hotel, but if you're looking for an inexpensive and VERY CLEAN place to stay on your Disney trip, this is totally the place. There is a shuttle that can take you to Disney, but we just paid $6 for a Lyft (it's a 5 minute ride and they'll drop you right at the gates). The shower and water pressure are amazing, and the room has plenty of space for all your bags. The only thing that can be a little annoying (and I get that this is out of the hotel's control), is that we could hear our neighbors through the window - one was shouting and screaming about something early in the morning. It didn't wake me up, but it woke

Summary Heading: Not what I thought after staying here, but not too bad......actually 2.5 rating.....
Summary: After reading a ton of reviews and looking for a great lower price, we ended up at the Hotel 414.  I was super excited because it had the number two rating so I thought it would be a really good hotel. It's not that it isn't a good hotel, it's just not what I expected for a number two hotel on trip advisor.   It is a bit off the beaten path. It's on Ball Street quite a few blocks away from the Disneyland area.  In fact, it seems to be the last hotel around that whole area and then you get into the city so you are kind of isolated compared to staying around the Disney area.    The hotel itself is a motel style and has no elevator and only two floors. It has two sets of stairs to get up and down from the second floor and a small parking lot.  If you are driving a big car, good
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer, Thank you so much for taking time to share your experience with our future guests. I am happy that you found our hotel to be a great value for the Disneyland area. We strive to make the hotel a quiet, comfortable and affordable place to stay after a long day at the Park. Our customer service, as you experienced yourself, sets us apart from the larger hotels. I think you said it best when you point out that we are indeed a small, clean and affordable hotel ideal for families visiting Anaheim.

Summary: Overall, we had a good stay at this hotel.  Pros: Staff is very friendly. This is a nice choice if you're headed to Disneyland on a budget. The distance to Disneyland is walkable, although there are shuttle options close by. The rooms have a modern feel to them. We loved the clear glass shower and the shower head was really nice!  Cons: Unattractive neighborhood just behind the parking lot wall. This is a modernized motel, essentially, so services are limited. I personally didn't find the bed to be that comfortable (to be fair, I was having back/shoulder issues anyway).  Not 100% sure we would stay here again, but it's definitely a good option if budget is your main concern when visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Tera, Thank you for sharing your experience.  I am sincerely happy to hear your appreciated the value, cleanliness and our newly remodeled rooms. We are located near a residential neighborhood in Anaheim, but please be assured it is a very safe area. We strive to provide a comfortable stay for all our guests, so I apologize you did not find our beds comfortable. It is definitely one area we are trying to improve.

Summary: Location is good just 15 mins walk to Disney Park .Starbuck just right at the couner. Also,i like most of the hotel was the room ！big space can allow us open two big suitcase.After a tired day in park the hot shower helped us so relax and love the comfy bed ！！ I feel like we at home. The staff are so nice there . Really worth to stay there

The place is very clean and the staff are very welcoming specially the front desk people  The rooms are well equipped and very clean  The hotel is easily accessible from all Anaheim areas I really enjoyed my short stay there

Great stay literally minutes from Disneyland, did a late check around 1am. I was greeted by the male owner I believe. Very friendly and informational on routes to get my family to Disneyland, he even gave me a map. First impression on walking I noticed how clean the room was. Shout out to the housekeeping crew.. Y'all do an amazing job.   The visual of the room was modern and comforting, like I was staying at a family members house.. very welcoming  During the next day the room was turned down and the room was replenish while we were out at Disney. Fresh towels, bathroom and bedroom cleaned. Shout out to the crew again for Keeping it flossy.   Free coffee, free fridge use, free wifi, free microwave.   Favorite part of the stay was the rain shower head in the bathroom. Dope.

Summary Heading: Our Go To Place in Anaheim
Summary: We used to stay at the Sheridan for our Disneyland trips until it closed. A couple years ago I began researching a new place to stay for my husband's Disneyland birthday trip. I spent a couple hours calling hotels/motels asking questions and decided on Hotel 414, then Knight's Inn. We were glad we found a new place to stay when in Anaheim.   We were there this week Tuesday and Wednesday nights. Funny how those birthdays keep popping up. In November we met a couple at the hotel from Sweden and are still in touch with them and planning to meet again at Hotel 414. So this week I noticed the beautiful flowers planted out front and totally enjoyed them. We also want to thank the management for making us feel right at home. They are terrific!

Summary Heading: A great stay at a well run small hotel!!
Summary: Stayed two nights at the Hotel 414 Anaheim Feb. 18-19.  This  hotel is located in Anaheim on Ball Rd.  If you  choose to walk it is about a fifteen minute  walk to Disneyland.  Or, you could take a shuttle (ART) Anaheim Resort Transportation.  Cost is $5.50 for adult  pass that can be purchased at a neighboring hotel  The Ménage. Once you have the pass you catch the shuttle from The Menage.  The shuttle comes every 20 minutes.  On your return be sure and get on bus number 10 at Disneyland. You will be the first stop on the return and it is just about right in front of the  Hotel 414. Very convenient.  Now a bit about the service at the 414.  It was absolutely top notch.  We arrived late.  We asked what was still open in the area where we could get dinner.  The  owner/manager not

Summary Heading: Best price and amazingly clean room
Summary: I loved the hotel experience here. The staff and the neatness in the place is great. Close to everything you want to see in Anaheim. Disney is around the corner it's walking distance too. I will definitely choose this hotel again in my next visit.

I once heard a famous marketer say "all hotel rooms are the same when you close your eyes".  That's true, however, you do have to open them eventually and face the decision you've made.  It's those moments that define rather or not you've made the right decision when choosing the right hotel or not.  Thankfully, we have reviews made by people who care to help us make decisions ahead of time before they become those we regret.  I'm so glad I took the time to read what others had to say about Hotel 414.  I felt some may even be too good to be true until we decided to stay here for our 20-year anniversary and trip to Disneyland this week.  We had a reservation for a more well-known brand but were worried about the cost.  I started looking for more affordable solutions and found

This hotel was by far one of the best places we have stayed. Very clean, quiet and close to Disney. A shuttle stops right out front. There is a good view of the fireworks from Disney. The staff has been absolutely amazing and very sweet. Will definitely be back!

Summary Heading: Cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in
Summary: I renovate hotels for a living, and unfortunately that means I stay in hotels we do not renovate. Hotel 414 is the cleanest hotel I have every been in.  The only draw back, which is huge for me, is the wall are not well insulated.  I go to bed early (9p) because I am up before 6a, and a light sleeper.  The room next to me or somewhere close had a newborn.  Babies really do wake and cry every 2-3 hours...

Summary Heading: Clean friendly and close to Disney.
Summary: I found this hotel a good value. Check in was smooth and very friendly. I saw the front desk lady personally deliver a toothbrush to my neighbors room. The bed was comfortable good pillows no noise. The shower was perfect good pressure everything new clean updated.

Location next to Disneyland Is awesome.  The rooms were completely refurbished, laminate flooring new paint new furniture everything was done really really nice. They did a very nice job and I was very impressed about how clean it was.   The reception for check in was easy, the gentleman who helped us, who I assumed it was the owner, it was very nice and very helpful with information about the area. The price was right for a quick one night stand that I wouldn't be in the room very long.   The only downside was at the room had a funny smell to it, that I got used to. But I would definitely recommend this place.

Perfect for what we wanted.  Very clean rooms, friendly staff and good location for Disney.    Management did a fantastic job of looking after us, giving us tips and pointers and making our stay just perfect.

I stayed here with my fiance for a weekend in Disneyland and the place is fantastic, especially for the price. Close walk to Disneyland, and the room was perfectly clean. The hotel is close to the road, but the room was quiet enough that the traffic did not affect our sleep. Great place!

Summary Heading: Excellent value if you want to save your money for Disneyland instead of spending it on a place to sleep!
Summary: Hotel 414's rooms were recently remodeled in a "modern" style, and our room was sparkling clean and smelled fresh. Very simple furnishings, but comfortable and quiet. Ayesha at the front desk is sweet and helpful. We preferred to save our money to spend elsewhere and this was a great choice for us - and it only takes about 15-20 minutes to walk to the Disneyland main gate. Two cautions: The pool is not heated (though our kids insisted on trying out the freezing water on a winter's day, and had a good time doing so), and the bathroom has no tub so might be tough for kids too young to take showers. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and will be back.

The person at the front counter was nice, you can definitely hear the fireworks at night coming from Disneyland, the room was a bit small but sufficient for 1-2 night stay, the room was clean, overall a good place to sleep.

The staff is outstanding, the rooms are clean, updated and quiet.   The price is great and you won't get a better deal than this for these great rooms.  Not a large hotel that has strict time in and out, they work with you with a smile.  Leave your car and enjoy Disneyland the day you check out, no problem they will work with you.  Save $20 plus to park at Disneyland  A boutique Hotel that will make you smile

Stayed here with my wife and daughter, and the room was very clean and nice! We were very close to Disney. Showers were great, and the management and staff were very nice and knowledgeable!  Not typical of the location, we were woken up during the middle of the night because the couple downstairs decided to attempt to see which could yell louder and hurt each other more. The management apologized profusely, and all in all handled the situation very well!  Loved the stay, would stay here again!

Great place.  This hotel was less pricy than most in the area, which normally is a warning sign to me (i.e. cheaper = worse quality), but we were pleasantly surprised to find it wasn't.  It's a comfortable walking distance to the park.  It's clean and newly renovated.  We met the owners and they were kind and helpful, and dedicated to making this hotel worth staying in.  We had an issue with our TV and they were very responsive and fixed it immediately (even though a TV isn't really an emergency or anything).  100% satisfied!!!

As a regular traveler to Disneyland, I enjoy staying at hotels that are comfortable, convenient and offer a value over mainstream hotel chains.  After all, you don't spend much time in your room when visiting Disneyland, so spending $400 a night or more seems silly.   For the past five years, I have stayed at the Ayers Hotel Anaheim, over by the Honda Center. It's a fantastic property. You can read my review elsewhere here on TripAdvisor. This year, I wanted to stay some place different and liked the reviews I read for the Knights Inn, now known as Hotel 414.  Hotel 414 caught my eye because of the great reviews it was getting, the look of the rooms and the location to Disneyland as well as  the existence of a Starbucks very close by. Additionally the easy access to the ART

Summary Heading: The stay is Sugar Sprinkle on our Disneyland trip!
Summary: The location is excellent. Front desk staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. The room is very clean and has more than what we could asked for a short stay near Disneyland. The hotel allows us to park for free on the day of check-out which is a great bonus. We are very pleased with the stay and would be more than happy to recommend this place to anyone!

Summary Heading: Nice, Clean and Close to attractions!!
Summary: A nice clean hotel, that provides good value for money and is close to the nearby attractions like Disneyland. The hotel was going through some rebranding and new systems being added that delayed checkin but I am sure these small issues will be resolved shortly. The hotel staff were all very courteous, they also provide a small discount on Disneyland tickets which saves around $5 per ticket to the park.

My fiance and I stayed at this motel for 3 nights solely to visit Disneyland.   Starting with the positives, the motel is clean and newly renovated, and the shower was hot and had great water pressure.  The staff were friendly although we didnt feel that they were overly knowledgable or they just didn't give you extra information  unless really prompted.   Location was OK - you can walk to the front gate of Disneyland in 15-20 minutes. We didn't try the shuttle and used Uber's instead as they arrive in a few minutes. Starbucks is also a few doors down, great for breakfast.  As for the negatives, we found the beds were very hard and uncomfortable. The room was also very noisy. The walls are thin and we were on the bottom floor and could hear every footstep above us which meant we

My girlfriend and I stayed for two nights for my birthday while visiting Disneyland and it couldn't have been a better stay. Between the cleanliness of the room and the hospitality of the staff we really enjoyed this hotel.

We loved this hotel. The staff was very nice. After a long journey it was a little oasis for us. Unfortunately, I do not know the name of the lady who greeted us on the evening of November 11 2016, but I would like to thank her once again for her kindness. The hotel location is super, close to Disneyland, but in addition, grocery stores, restaurants, gas station and easily accessible. Thank you once more.

Summary Heading: Best affordable accomodation near Disneyland ever
Summary: During this year's road trip we spent a few nights in Anaheim and were so happy to have found the Knight's Inn. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The shuttle to Disneyland and buying the tickets directly at the hotel was very convenient. Most of all the reception was so warm and welcoming and the girl at the reception was extremely nice and helpful. And all that at a very affordable rate. We'll definitely be back at our next visit.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disneyland!
Summary: This motel had a great rate for the Avengers Marathon weekend and also received some wonderful reviews on TripAdvisor and I was not disappointed!  Our late-night check-in was handled by a very competent, friendly Concierge and our room, while basic, was clean and modern.  There is an Anaheim Resort Transportation spot right outside the hotel but if you don't mind a 15 minute walk to the parks, it's very do-able and well-lit, even at night.  Getting to the Disneyland Hotel/Downtown Disney was a little trickier as you had to go through the Park Security Line, but all in all, very convenient and just what was needed!

For starters this is a motel (previously under the name of Knights Inn). It is a great location if you are going to the parks and I can't complain too much about the room as it was newly renovated and the shower is the best part (great water pressure for a state with a drought problem). My family visited because we were running in one of the Disneyland marathons so not much partying going on for us. Can't say the same for the staff. There was an empty beer can left in our bathroom. When approaching management about the concern, they came collected the can and explained that they have a mini-fridge in the back for their staff stocked with beer and drinks and the new maintenance person they hired probably took it from there, drank it, and left it when picking up our linens. Our
Manager Response: Dear Lilodashort1, we take pride in our reputation with our guests and are constantly working to make every stay a good one. I'm so sorry to hear we did not live up the expectation we always aim for. Please be assured, we do not provide beer or any type of alcoholic beverages to our staff, ever. I think there may have been a communication error because we also do not have a maintenance person on staff since we are so small. I personally checked the security footage of your interaction with the manager on duty regarding your request to split the bill and it can be heard that someone in your group said 'its okay' and that your group would sort out the bill amongst yourselves since the bill was paid when you checked in. If you would like, I can adjust that concern directly with you and split the charges. Please contact us and we will take care of it for you immediately. Our guests' security and comfort is our number one priority and we don't take it lightly.

Summary: Expedia mixed up our reservation on a night where most hotels were booked and sent us here.  I was a little worried about the 2-star class. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at this motel (not hotel). It has been completely remodeled with all new furniture and is super clean. The staff is friendly and helpful.  The walk to Disneyland is a bit long but they have a public shuttle that picks up out front for $5 per adult and &2 for children.  Excellent value.

This low key motel is super for visitors to the Anaheim area who wish to explore the main attractions without blowing the budget. For fellow Kiwis it is similar to many motels in New Zealand. The managers are lovely  and go out of their way to assist. The website really reflects what the property is about.

Very Clean and modern hotel, basic yes , but friendly modern and safe, about 15 - 20 mins or a quick uber away from Disneyland , ill definitely return to here. Staff are very friendly and the rooms are quiet.

This place was great.  Very clean and cute.  The staff allowed us to park in the hotel lot before check in to go to Disneyland, and then to leave our car the next day after we'd checked out.  Highly recommend!

My son and I were so pleased with this hotel. Staff was helpful, informative, and friendly. Our room was clean and perfect for a place to relax after a long day in the parks. Nice shower with plenty of hot water, shampoo, and body wash. How thoughtful to have shower dispensers for this and the soap to wash your hands with. No gross, gooey soap on the bathroom countertop! The beds were comfortable with plenty of pillows and the A/C cooled the room nicely. The walk to Disneyland was 15 minutes at an easy pace. My son and I felt safe walking to and from the parks. We would stay here in a heartbeat again!

We stayed only one night at this hotel. It was clean, modern and comfortable. The lady at the front desk even allowed us to park in the car park well before check in so we could go to Disneyland. Recommended, would stay there again!

We really enjoyed our stay.  Front desk people were friendly. Love the laminate flooring versus carpet. As long as they upkeep the cleanliness, I will stay here again. Like that it has free parking and walking distance to Disneyland.  The only thing I didn't like was that the bed was squeaky.

Summary Heading: Great location for Disneyland and good money value
Summary: A nice place with a great location. just a 10 min. Walk from Disneyland. 1 min walk to gas station with starbucks and small market. All you need. Room is big and comfy. Nothing too fancy but good value for money. Big and easy parking space.

You will be very comfortable staying here. The rates are affordable and very close to Disneyland. The staff is very friendly and parking is free. I love the hardwood floors and plenty of outlets to plug in all your devices.

We stayed here for one week starting October 11th. Room was clean and well appointed. Hardwood floors and Bathroom decent size and good shower. Staff were awesome and helpful with every detail. Two negatives... unheated pool was FREEZING and slightly sketchy neighborhood. We took Lyft  daily to Disney as walk was a long 20 minutes across the freeway. Decided to spend less than half of other hotels and stay here. We really only slept here when we weren't running around one of the parks. Literally 1/2 the cost of the hotel we originally booked.

Had a pleasant stay at this hotel. The lady we met during checkin, Aisya, was very friendly and helpful. Room was new and clean. Starbucks was just around the corner. Only thing is it wasn't as close as it said it was (ie walking distance) to Disneyland. Otherwise it was a very pleasant stay! ☺️

At first I was kinda scared but when I got there the room was actually clean and nice. Love the hard floors. Great customer service. Our card reader wasn't working but they fixed it the next morning. Parking is free! Parking was so close to our room. It's kinda far if you walk it to Disney and it's about a 5 min drive. Would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Clean, modern, simple hotel near Disneyland
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Knights Inn for two nights while visiting Disneyland.  Our room was a good size, clean and with modern decor.  The shower room was clean and spacious.  We felt that the hotel offered great value for money given how close it is to Disneyland.  There is a Starbucks nearby, which was ideal for breakfast.  The hotel offers free parking, which was ideal, although we noticed when returning to the hotel one evening, we took the final space.  I'm not sure what we would have done if there had been one extra car parked there.  Surprisingly, the hotel charges (and then later refunds) a security deposit to your credit card (rather than just an authorisation hold which is common).  For international visitors, the refund amount (in your currency) will be less than

Summary Heading: Really friendly and helpful owners, good location
Summary: The hotel were helpful assisting us with questions before our stay, and we're happy to let us leave our car and luggage for the full day before checking in so that we could enjoy the day at Disney.   The managers / owners (?) were really friendly and gave great service.   The room was clean,spacious and modern with more facilities (fridge, coffee maker and microwave) than some 4 star hotels we stayed in on our trip.   It was a 15-20 min walk to Disney which was really convenient and there is a shuttle  bus which stops outside.   I would happily recommend this hotel to family and friends

We booked three rooms - for our kids and their kids.  The rooms were spotless, comfortable and roomy and very reasonably priced.  Our daughter is sensitive to mold and mildew - none of that here; the laminate flooring was a big plus.  The staff was courteous and helpful and the location amazing . . . just a few minutes from Disneyland.  It was quicker to walk than drive and park!  We will stay with you again!

Locations 10 minutes to disneyland parks and close to food outlets! Rooms were spotless! Service was beyond amazing, gave us a room early so we could enjoy the parks and had a lovely conversation whilst waiting for transport. Don't let the stars fool you. They were beyond amazing and would book here again in a heartbeat!

Firstly even prior to checking in I was impressed with this hotels attention to detail. We corresponded by email on several occasions and every response was prompt and answered our queries. When we arrived (quite late in the evening) we were greeted by Aeysia and made to feel so welcome. That was how the rest of our stay continued. This is a relatively recently renovated hotel and the surrounding area usa little lacklustre, but that should not detract from the benefits to staying here. About 10 minute walk away is a Walmart where all grocery supplies can be found and a huge laundrymat. Disney is a prompt 10 minute walk away, directly around the corner from the hotel is a Starbucks and Taco Bell.  The hotel is exceptionally clean. Our room had ample space, twin beds(very

If you´re going to Disneyland, this is a great choice... Close to parks (less than 10 min walk)... great price, close to a Starbucks (on the way to Disney), clean room, no carpet (thank god), all new furniture, wonderful front desk (helpful and kind), all good... see you next year for sure

Summary Heading: Great hotel, service, location and price - Disneyland within walking distance
Summary: Everything about this hotel is perfect, and it's a true travel bargain. Check-in was fast and easy, and Ayesha is possible the nicest and most helpful manager I've ever met.  The rooms are sparkling clean, have been recently renovated and include a refrigerator, microwave, flat-screen TV and free wi-fi. The hotel sells slightly discounted Disneyland tickets  Disneyland is an easy 15 minute walk.  You can also take the #10 ART bus which stops directly in front of the hotel.  (Be aware that the buses and the Disney terminal offer little signage or maps, and the drivers often give wrong info to passengers.)

Location was a 20 min walk to the entrance to Disneyland. Also walking distance to McDonald's,  Burger King & other restaurants. As there is no washing facilities on site it's a 10 min walk to laundromat.  Room was spacious enough for us. We loved the pool which is very deep at one end. Staff were accommodating and friendly. Car parking was no problem. There is no avoiding the fireworks every nite at approximately 9.30pm from Disney. Very loud but great to watch. Sets off car alarms. Room had a fridge which was handy. Beds were the only downside for us. They were just too hard. You do need a car to venture out to Knotts Berry etc.

Summary Heading: Economical, clean, great view of fireworks
Summary: We've stayed here a few times. It's always clean and staff is friendly.  Close to Disneyland, close to freeway, and was to find.  Check prices because they fluctuate frequently.  We'll stay here again.  Attached is a pic of Disney's pumpkin tree in Frontier Land. 😊

We stayed 3 nights and it was excellent.  We booked the hotel for a great price, the showers were wonderful, the beds were comfortable and everything was very clean.  Disneyland was only a 10 minute walk and Walmart was so handy to the hotel as well.  The staff at reception went out of their way to help.  Upon checking out we asked if they could call us a cab, there was a 20 minutes delay so the man gave us a lift to the Greyhound Bus Terminal.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and if I could give more than 5 stars I would.  Thank you for making our stay at Disneyland fantastic :)

We spend 2 day at the hotel and we were very happy, everything was very clean, and in excellent conditions, very quite at night, and the services was impeccable, definitely recommended.Perfect spot to stay if you go to the Disney parks.

We went to Anahiem Stadium for a ball game from here and were able to walk to and from Disneyland. VERY convenient. The Inn is priced very well.  The rooms were super clean with a nice little pool for recreation. The staff were very knowlegable and helpful with area questions and needs. I would recommend this to all.  Len G Alberta, Canada

The motel is an affordable option in Anaheim, with an easy walk to Disneyland. We arrived in the morning and were given an early check- in so were able to have a shower and freshen up before heading out to the parks. The room was clean with comfortable beds. The managers were very helpful, giving us advice about bus routes and even driving us down to the bus stop when we departed.

We stayed at Knights Inn, Anaheim this week so we could visit Disneyland. We stayed for 2 nights and it was great. All 3 rooms in our group were modern and recently renovated. The staff were very friendly and helpful and it was incredibly close to Disneyland. I would definitely stay here again.

It was amazing! The girl at the front desk I believe her names is Aisha was super kind. I usually order tons of things on Amazon while traveling and I received every single one of them without paying any extra charges (which is very good). The place is very clean and the beds are very comfy. There was no delay checking in and out and the staff was very nice to me ( usually that doesn't happens at 1130pm ). It is very close to Disney although it is very far away from Universal so you might need to rent a car.  I will definitely stay there again and I totally recommend it.
