Room was very comfortable - very friendly staff. I was very pleased with my stay.Easy access to freeway. Very quiet at night could not hear any noise from outside. The rooms looked recently renovated with Hard wood floors and new fixtures in the Bathroom. Had shampoo, body wash and soap dispensers mounted on wall instead of small bottles

My college-aged daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights (Sept 11-14) and had a very good experience.  The room we were in had been remodeled and it was cleaned thoroughly every day we were there.  The rate on this property was significantly lower than anything else this close to Disney so I was very hesitant to book it until I read other reviews. The reviews said good value and decent motel, and I echo those comments.  It is close enough to Disney that we walked to the park every day, stopping at the Starbucks a block away for breakfast.  Parking is free.  The woman who manages the hotel is very pleasant and never seems to sleep--she's always around if you need anything.  The only downside for us was the internet was rather slow.  But, we came for a vacation, so not having a

My stay was perfect from start to finish. I think the person (very nice lady) who was working the front desk might be the friendlist, most helpful, and truly the best example of customer service I have ever encountered from anyone who works in the hotel/motel business. Absolutely on top of things at all times, and when I asked about  extending my stay one more day, and she gave me the total of what it would cost, I was happy with the $$ amount and when I went down to the lobby to pay for another day she actually told me she could give the room to me for less than what I had expected to pay. She didnt have to tell me that, I was fine paying the original price quoted to me, and wouldnt have made a fuss anyways. Instead she made sure to tell me right away that the room would be

Summary Heading: Not A Bad Stay Overall. Possible Stay Again.
Summary: Had gotten a good deal online to stay here as the "normal" hotel was booked. Was a bit apprehensive as the name of the hotel made me feel like we would be staying at a jousting dinner show room. But surprisingly it was not a corny as first thought!  The room was BIG. It had a real comfortable bed with nice clean linens. Bathroom was big and clean as well. The staff was pleasant. The hotel is VERY close to front gate of Disneyland. So that was helpful. The pool was lacking luster and there was nowhere else to relax other than inside the room.   The overall grounds look wasn't very appealing. So therefor 4 out of 5.

We really enjoyed spending the night here. We booked it online last minute based on what we saw on the websites pictures (which can be scary) but what we saw is what we got! We were totally blown away with the modern updates this hotel has. The bathrooms are something out of a showroom and the hard wood floors are always a plus. A mounted flat panel on the wall and large 'mini' fridge was great too. The only 'complain' I would say are the pillows and parking. Pillows could have been better, a little flat, or having 4 per bed would have been nice. The parking was very tight, and we had a small car, but on the bright side there is enough parking for the amount of rooms there. Don't be deterred by the location of the hotel, it isn't the best, the surrounding neighborhood looks

Super cute and modern rooms. Must have been newly renovated. Doesn't appear like much from the outside, but the rooms were very clean and updated. Liked that it didn't have dingy carpet and a gross old comforter.

Summary Heading: Fantastic place and even better Management !
Summary: We felt at home as soon as we arrived! We had a very warm welcome from the excellent team who run the place. We mentioned we needed to eat and we were offered a ride to a place a couple miles away. That was great but then he offered to pick us up! Our room was spacious and very comfortable for our needs. The beds were great and the bathroom was spot on. Wi-Fi was fast enough for us. The location was what attracted us to the property and that did not disappoint! It was 10-15 min walk to the gates of Disneyland which was a breeze as our 5yr old managed it no problem(even on the way home after 15hrs). We really had a great time at the Knights Inn. We would like to thank all the staff for a great stay!

We stayed at this hotel over 3 nights for our Disneyland trip. The first night was interesting. Once we entered the room, it was decent. We ended up getting an accessibility friendly room. We didn't mind cause we'd only be in the room for showers and sleep. However, we noticed some bugs on the wall. Ants and maybe a few flies. I went straight to the front desk to let them know and to hopefully switch rooms. They switched our room without hesitation. They told us that they had people doing maintenance, painting, cleaning, fixing, etc, and they probably left the door open which let in the bugs. The second room was just as nice as the first but without the bugs. So all in all, i was satisfied with the experience. clean room, clean bathroom, a/c. what more do you need for showers

This was the last leg of a 4 week Route 66 trip, finishing with four nights in LA. Knights Inn was chosen for its location and it didn't disappoint. Our room was spacious and clean with a modern shower, fridge and microwave, and a very comfortable bed. The staff were friendly and helpful. Free parking is plentiful and there's a local bus service (ACT) which stops outside the motel that takes you to Disneyland, the local mall, downtown Anaheim plus lots more places - and it runs until after midnight which meant we didn't need to use the car every day. Breakfast isn't included but that's not a problem as there's a Starbucks next door plus plenty of other eating places within minutes. We didn't use the pool but others were enjoying it during our stay. And as a bonus you get a

This hotel was great value for money. It is a budget accommodation but has been renovated to have a modern feel and feels lovely and clean. There is a shuttle that can take you to Disneyland on the next block, however we easily walked to and from Disneyland from this hotel, which took about 15-20 minutes. It took only a couple of minutes to walk to Walmart and there is also a Starbucks two minutes away on the way to Disneyland, so the location is perfect.

Summary Heading: Best hotel to stay for a Disneyland Visit
Summary: Among the options when visiting Disneyland, this has to be one of the top choices: 15 minutes walking Distance to Disneyland entry; nice modern rooms; free parking; good prices. Though they don't offer breakfast, a Starbucks is close-by.

This small hotel is perfect for the amount you pay. He prices are mostly far lower than the hotels a little more close to Disney but it is just a 15 minutes walk. If you do not want to walk, there is a ART bus shuttle stop at the hotel which costs 5 Dollars a day for unlimited trips to and from Disney. Or you pay per ride for just 3$ a ride per person. Rooms are modern and clean, staff is super friendly and also a room change after one night, which we requested, was no problem. Would use this hotel next time again!

Really loved this little hotel. Room was super clean and spacious. Bed was a good size and comfy. AC was great and TV had a good selection of channels. It has a small fridge, a coffee maker and a microwave too.  The people who run it are lovely. There is a pool and pool area which we used almost every day which is fab.  We didn't have a car so walked to Disney. It takes 10 - 15 minutes depending on how fast you're feeling :) It's great though as there are loads of cafes/restaurants on the walk there (Taco Bell, Mimis, Panera and McD's to name a few). Also if you walk back and get to around Taco Bell for 9.30pm you get an even better view of the fireworks than you do from Disney!  Anaheim itself is pretty nice. If you turn right out of the hotel instead of left for Disney there's

I wasn't sure what I was expecting out of this place. Family of 3 doing a last minute getaway and went on TripAdvisor for some reviews and this place was ranked #2. I didn't have  an issue with customer service, he was polite and answered any questions I had. The room overall... very spacious we had a non smoking room with a king size bed. Bed is not that comfortable... when I turned on the ac on..it had a hint smell of smoke. Nothing too crazy. Bathroom was clean and overall place was quiet. My husband and I already knew we would drive and pay the $18 for parking at Disneyland... it was about a 7 min drive from the hotel. That's pretty close.. if you are trying to walk.. that's probably a good distance.. would I stay again?.. I would probably look around first before I made a

My daughter and I needed a safe and close hotel after a long Disneyland day. This hotel was both and much more. The value was good and the friendliness of the front desk was excellent. Our room was modern and clean and I was thankful for all the small appliances which were refridge, micro, coffee pot, and hair dryer.  The mattress was firm and pillows were soft.  It was a surprise to me how nice the room really was and is stay and recommend it to anyone.

Nice little hotel. The rooms are modern and fresh. The staff is friendly. Cute little pool. It very close to Disney @9:30 pm you will know you are close as the fireworks will rock the joint. Microwave, refrigerators, coffee maker, iron and ironing board. Air conditioner works well. In general, very nice for the money!!!!

Very nice hotel clean and modern friendly staff easy to find small swimming pool but good location if going to Disney and reasonably priced would stay again and would recommend to others. A little loud during the fireworks at Disney I wasn't expecting that but could see the fireworks from parking lot !

Summary Heading: Great price for a great hotel
Summary: My husband and I booked this room a few weeks before our visit on Expedia and we got a great rate. The room was very clean and comfortable, the bathroom was quit large and the air conditioner worked great. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful, from providing extra towels to tips on how to navigate through the Disney Parks on very busy days.  The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk to the parks. I could see why this place got such great reviews and we will be back for sure. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the Anaheim area. Do not be taken back by the outside because the inside is nicely updated and you will not regret it.

This hotel was great. The beds were very comfortable, and the staff was very kind. Great hospitality! From the outside it looks dingy so it was a pleasant surprise when we opened our room and seen it was very clean, and obviously renovated, and modern. There was a fridge, microwave, and coffee pot which was very convenient. The only reason I'm giving 4 stars and not 5 is because the sign outside advertises Disneyland shuttle, but you actually have to catch a bus outside that's $5 per person so we just opted to pay to park at Disney. Also, I know it's a tourist area but the room was over $170 after tax for 1 night. In my opinion it's definitely overpriced, but overall I was very satisfied.

Knights inn Anaheim was our first stop on our 3 week trip to USA . We had booked 2 rooms our checkin was very quick and easy done by a very friendly receptionist. Nice rooms cozy and homely The manager was very accommodating and friendly . Walking distance to Disneyland about 15 to 20 min walk. Would definitely recommend knights inn .

I came to Anaheim for spend three days in Disneyland, totaling four days spent at the hotel.  My original booking was for three nights but I decided a few weeks before my trip to add a night so I could spend an extra full day in the parks.  I was going to be doing two odd things to this hotel when I got there.  I was arriving way before the 2PM check in at 9:30 in the morning from my early morning flight and I was hoping my extra night booked would still be in the same room.  And the excellent front desk staff was able to accommodate both these weird things.  When I arrived early, my room was not ready and I didn't expect it to be, but I was allowed to keep my bags at the hotel in their locked laundry room while I went to Disneyland to spend some time before check in.  When I

Summary Heading: Stay was ok, surprised that this is one of the top places to stay
Summary: In the area since we see my son's doctor out of state and saw this location had such a high rating and was affordable.  Upon arriving, it looks like a nicer-than-most motel.  The staff is nice and some of the pros was the free parking, fridge in the room and hardwood floors but it stops there.  The walls are thin and you could hear every time someone closed or opened their door.  The bed was uncomfortable and I was sore the next day because of it.  This location is close to Disneyland however and despite this was STILL cheaper than most other hotels in both Anaheim and LA.  If you're strapped for cash but don't want to stay somewhere seedy or dirty, I would recommend this place.
Manager Response: Dear Jeniece, I am so sorry that we could not make your stay as enjoyable as we always strive to. We did recently renovate the entire property to be more than an 'average' motel and we work hard to provide guests with an affordable, clean and convenient option while they visit Southern California. I am glad we were able to provide that for you. The beds are definitely an area we find guests have such varying opinions.  Thank you for taking time to tell us about your stay and help us make our Inn just a little better for our future guests!

Summary: Found via hotels.com. Close enough, 1/2 mile to Disneyland. Rooms decent, like the wood floors, microwave & refrigerator. Responsive desk service. Rooms good size for family of four. Few conveniences located in walking distance 👍👍 👍👍

My family and I stayed here for 5 days. The rooms were simply set up. The hotel was great. We all slept comfortably. Staff was nice. We would definitely stay here again. Thanks Knights Inn hopefully we see you next year.

We were in California visiting our son, not Disneyland, but needed an affordable room, as we stayed for 5 nights. The queen sized beds were comfortable, and staff gladly provided extra pillows and towels. Very clean! Easy free parking. Small pool, but was clean. Large refrigerator and microwave, coffee maker and hairdryer. The shower was great! Good pressure and clean. Bring your own toiletries! They only provide soap in dispensers on the wall. We purchased a toaster at a Walmart nearby, bagels, cream cheese, and fruit, and made "breakfast" in our room. We were on the bottom floor and could hear people above us, but I brought my white-noise machine to block out the noise and was glad I did. Get a second floor room if you can. Would highly recommend for a basic, comfortable room

We stayed 3 nights. The hotel it's 15 mins walking from Disneyland which it's perfect. We arrived some hours before the check in and the owner was kind enough to let us get the key and park the car there (parking it's free). The room was very nice and clean  (no filthy carpet) with microwave, coffee machine, fridge, hair drier and tv. We didn't use the pool area but it look very clean. We also purchased the tickets for the park directly at the hotel since they offer discounts.

We visited  the Knights Inn July 12-14 for a Disneyland trip(family of 4).We checked in late in the afternoon maybe 5pm. Check in took about 15 min. The rooms are really clean and spacious. Everything seems new and updated in the rooms. They have laminate? wood floors that look really nice! Better than a dirty carpet. They had a big size desk that my family used as our charging station for phones, iPads and laptops. They have a great sized fridge that came in handy since we had brought a lot of snacks and food to save some money and everything fit in the fridge. They have a microwave that we used quite often. Beds were comfortable. Bathroom was clean. This place met all of our basic needs. We decided to walk to Disneyland and it took about 20 min and with kids I would not

Summary Heading: Comfortable, simple, and convenient.  Very friendly and helpful staff.
Summary: We checked in at about 9:30 at night.  The staff were very helpful.  Easy free parking.  The room was simple and very clean.  It reminded me of an Ikea display.  The internet was adequate (netflix on the iPad worked but was a bit slow).  So easy to get to Disneyland without paying the premium to stay right across the road.  Starbucks was not even a block away and it is on the walk to Disneyland.  Very enjoyable.  We only used the room for sleeping and showering, but it met our needs and more.

The staff was accommodating and very friendly. They helped us locate some transportation to our destination. The rooms were beautiful, comfortable and perfect for what we needed. Everything was very clean.  Our family and friends went to Disneyland and needed a place to stay overnight.  Thank you!

Summary Heading: Great place at a decent price!
Summary: Stayed with them this last weekend to hit up Disneyland and California Adventures. During booking I messed up the dates, but called to change them and it was very promptly fixed and had no problems. The room was closer to Disney than I had thought it was requiring only about a 10-15 minute walk with lights (Although it felt like a million miles walking back after walking through Disney for 12+ hours.... but that is no fault of theirs.). They also have the Anaheim Resort Transportation (ART) shuttle stop right outside if you choose not to walk. There is also a Mimi's cafe along the walk to Disney, so that made breakfast easy. The room was super clean and the pillows and beds were comfortable. They offer cheaper Disney tickets at the counter, but not as cheap as parksavers.com,

Stayed here for two nights whilst visiting Disneyland. The hotel was at a great price and we were very happy with the room, very comfy and sparklingly clean. Think they must of been recently renovated. We parked at Disneyland on the first day to make the most of our time there, but the next day we walked and it was really easy to do so. Free parking, big bed, clean and walkable to Disney what else do you need. Will visit other locations if get the chance on our future travels.

I priced many motels for our Disneyland trip and decided on this one because of the good reviews and cheap price compared to many other motels in the area. Carpets in motels are sketchy, so we like the hardwood floors. The only downers are the dinky parking lot and no free breakfast, but McDonalds is right down the street and Ihop is across from D-land. There was a guy making balloon characters for children and my son chose Mickey. The motel is a 5 minute drive, so that was convenient. Overall, great motel for the money.

This place has zero carpet, which makes it a lot cleaner then most places.  This motel was a pleasant surprise. It has updated amenities and extremely clean.  I would recommend this place to anyone.  There wasn't a lot of parking, but there are also not a lot of rooms either.  I am not a fan of West Ball Rd and would prefer to be on the other side near South Harbor Blvd, West Katella Ave, etc, but all that matters is a nice, clean, and well kept motel and Knights Inn Anaheim is just that!

Summary Heading: Great Place for the Price -- Even if not going to D'Land
Summary: This is a safe, clean, comfortable hotel.  Great location.  Perfectly fine for the price.  It appears new.  The beds are comfortable.  The furnishings are adequate.  The lighting adequate.  The room is well equipped with a mini-fridge and a microwave and a coffee maker and a hair dryer.  Everything from the sheets to the tub, toilet etc. was very clean.  Love the wood laminate floors instead of carpeting.  And the room was quiet.  No excess outside noise.  Free Wi-Fi.  Personable front desk,  We only spent two nights there for a basketball tournament.  I kinda wonder how it will hold-up over time.  For example,  I had to put a towel in the fridge to absorb a significant puddle of water.  I am guessing that the refrigerator was turned off after the last guest left to save energy

Summary Heading: Great place to stay close to Disney
Summary: Great place to stay! Very clean, updated rooms and wonderful staff. The front desk us incredibly helpful. We will stay here every time we visit Disneyland.  Price is great for quality of service and room. Rooms are large with microwave,  refrigerator and coffee maker. Within walking distance to Starbucks and Taco Bell for inexpensive breakfast, lunch or snack after day at Disneyland. If you decide to take the ART shuttle you are the first to be dropped off after your day at Disney. Love, love,  love this motel!

The rooms here are very comfortable. I really appreciated the nice condition of the room. I would say that I was a little worried when we pulled up. The building does not do justice to the quality of the room. But I would much rather have a nice room than fancy lobby!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, clean, great location, nice staff.
Summary: We booked here at the last minute due to our first hotel being a dump and bad experience.  Thank goodness this hotel had availability! I loved the wooden floors.  You could tell this hotel was remodelled and updated which was really nice. They gave us a wheelchair accessible room (we didn't need) and it was nice. My only suggestion was to add a 2nd nightstand and light on side of bed like most hotel rooms have. I'm assuming that was not there for wheelchair accessible. Friendly staff and good experience.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Knights Inn. Room was comfortable and clean and the customer service was fantastic. The staff were very helpful and nice. Was affordable and I'd recommend staying there to those wanting to rest your head after Disney :)

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a reasonable price!
Summary: Our stay at the Knights Inn was pleasant for the two nights that we stayed here. We had a king sized bed which was comfortable & the room had all the necessary amenities (blow dryer, iron/ironing board, fridge, microwave, wifi, cable tv). The water temperature & pressure in the shower was awesome & the air conditioning unit was not excessively noisy! The only complaints I would have about this hotel is that you can hear the noise & voices of adjacent rooms almost too clearly, and the towels were a bit too small for an average sized adult. Overall, a recommendable hotel!

We only spent one night here, but loved our stay. Everything was new and very clean. Both the woman and man we interacted with at the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel was quiet and relaxing with great access to the shuttle to/from Disneyland. Even though we didn't check-in until the normal check-in time, the hotel allowed us to park in their parking lot early in the morning to take the shuttle to Disneyland...no extra charge! Great place to stay. I'd recommend it to anyone and would definitely stay again.

The room was nice and simple. I loved the hardwood floors. Hotel carpet always make me gross out. This floor was clean. The room was spacious and elegant, yet simple. It did not have a table to sit down at like most hotel rooms, but that wasn't a show stopper for us. We spent most of our time at Disneyland and crashed here at night. We'd definitely stay here again if the opportunity presents. Front desk clerk/manager was helpful. We were initially booked into a downstairs room and asked to move upstairs at checking. He was very accommodating and took care of us.

Excellent and clean service. Walking distance to parks and great pricing. Staff was very friendly, this is my second time this year and definitely coming back! The rooms are very clean and the bathrooms are very nice and clean. Excellent service all around.

We stayed down here for 6 days and 5 nights. When I say regret, I regret I didn't stay here for all 5 nights. Really clean room. The front desk help was wonderful. The walking distance was about 15 mins from Disneyland. Yes, you walk over an overpass but no big deal. Starbucks is next door. Awesome for coffee people like me, you don't need to wait in the long lines in Disneyland. Also there are numerous places to eat on the way to and back to Disneyland. The one minor thing I did find is the towels are a little small, and I'm 5 ft tall. Other than that, this place is awesome. Will use this place again in the future.

Summary Heading: It's a Hidden Gem! DON'T Tell ANYBODY!!!
Summary: Due to an unexpected cancellation at a hotel we had originally booked, my husband and I decided to try out Knights Inn and boy, are we ever glad we did! Our room was absolutely FABULOUS. I can be quite the germaphobe, so the fact that these rooms have NO carpet, appealed to me GREATLY!!!   You know what else appeals? The PRICE. In a world where it seems like every penny is being squeezed from you on vacation, Knights Inn offers extremely AFFORDABLE rates AND they offer FREE parking. That is probably one of THEE BEST things any hotel in the area can offer because many others charge anywhere from $10-$18 a day... justifying that you "save" from not having to pay for Disneyland parking, which is $20.  Checking in was easy breezy and the staff is wonderfully courteous and friendly.

Great rooms and price. Friendly staff. Parking lot is a little awkward but it's a smaller hotel. The ac was turned off by housekeeping and got extremely hot while we were at Disneyland, but other than that it was a wonderful stay. We even could see the fireworks from the parking lot. We will definitely stay again.

The staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and the bed was firm. The only reason I gave it a 4 was because the walls are thin and you can clearly hear the conversations going on in the next room. Luckily the guests next door were asleep by 10:30 PM.

Stayed here for 3 nights on my own whilst I was visiting Disneyland. It was a great hotel very clean with good wifi and only a 20 minute walk to Disneyland, or 10-15 minute walk to a local super market. The gentleman behind the counter was very friendly and helpfull with anything I needed. Definately recommended it.

Summary Heading: Very good for the price and fantastic service
Summary: Me and my husband stayed in this hotel for 7 nights for our honeymoon and had a great experience.  The staff here was extremely helpful when we needed to get a room at the last minute.  When the original hotel we had booked did not work out they were able to get us into a last minute room late at night after a long drive.  The girl at the front desk was super sweet and helpful when we showed up.  She was even able to let us see a room before we checked in or paid.  It was a huge relief to get such great service after the issues with the previous hotel and after a 12 hour drive.  The other staff we dealt with over our stay was also very friendly and extremely helpful.  The room was perfect for what we needed it for and we got it at a very low rate which was super helpful due to

I was pleasantly surprise the rooms where newly renovated. Clean, free parking. WiFi with fridge and microwave. Ray the manager is very helpful. Will come back again. Location close to Disney. They also have shuttle service to Disney.  Great price. Location and comfortable.

The staff were very friendly.  The location is good, shuttle picks up right outside for Disneyland. It quieter then expected. The rooms are clean,  recently remodled. The beds were not soft. The amenities were streamline basic. Fridge, shampoo and body wash dispensers in the bathroom. Business spartan in a good way-not alot of furniture clutter.  Everything was nice aside from the very firm bed.

Summary Heading: Fantastic place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: Best hotel experience we have had.  We are retired and vacation 365 days a year visiting all over the US.  Would we stay here again?  Absolutely without question.  The price was the lowest in the area of Disneyland.  The room was huge and recently remodeled.  Wood floors in the living areas and tile in the bathroom.  No smelly or stained carpets!  Bathroom was twice the size of most hotel bathrooms and had new fixtures.  We had two scooters that fit comfortably in the room.  The bed was the most comfortable bed we've slept in, except for our sleep number bed, in all of our travels.  The owner is on the premise.  He and the staff are always friendly and try to accommodate their customers.  If you need a room for wheelchair or scooter access, this is the place for you.  If you

I was given a room that was not cleaned! Sheets undone, used tampons in the trash, etc. When I went back to get another, I was told I couldn't and that there would be no refund. After some discussion I was finally given another room... This one had no air conditioning, tattered sheets, sunken mattress, moldy bath, hot and cold water switched around. Not to mention the "questionable people" outside my room all night. After a day at Disneyland i wanted a relaxing, clean evening. I trusted the positive reviews on this place, but now i believe them to be completely fabricated.This place is unclean, unsafe, uncomfortable. Especially if you're looking for a nice Disney vacation, DO NOT STAY HERE!!! I would give zero stars, but that's not an option unfortunately.

Summary Heading: Great Value and super friendly staff
Summary: We stayed here for 3 days during a trip to Disneyland back in April. It was a short 15 minute walk to the park. The friendly staff helped us out with our park-hopper passes which we purchased at the front desk. The rooms were clean and modern and the bed was very comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed here as a couple visiting Disneyland, and it suited our needs perfectly. To be honest we weren't here often, as we "Disney it up" open to close, but this inn provided a comfortable bed to crash in and a powerful, hot shower in the morning. We walked to the parks every morning and walked back to the hotel each night, so we can't speak for the shuttle. I can tell you the walk took 15-20 minutes and only seemed long with sore feet after a fifteen hour day! The hotel staff was very nice and seemed very concerned with meeting our needs. We had no problems with noise or other guests, and I would definitely recommend this hotel to families. If you're not looking for a resort, this is the place to stay. Affordable, clean, and comfortable. Can't say enough good things!

We are used to stay in high-rated hotels when traveling for business or pleasure. Knights Inn is not the chain that you usually associate with 5-star accommodation. So, we didn't expect much as we had to chose the one in Anaheim for our last-minute trip in 2015. What a nice surprise! We both believe that this particular Knights Inn deserves much higher ratings. Everything in the room feels new and fresh. We loved hardwood (pergo) floors (carpets are always suspicious), elegant cabinets and spotless clean bathrooms with nice fixtures. Management is very courteous and willing to help. We spent 3 nights there again in May 2016 and we're coming back in October to this little gem.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights during our road trip. When we walked into the room we were thrilled, they were immaculate and had obviously just been updated. Spotlessly clean with lovely modern fixtures. We arrived on my husbands birthday and had wanted to sit around the pool but there were no seats, one of our party spoke to the manager and he had soon cobbled together somewhere for us all to sit...including one of his own dinning room chairs...very very obliging. That would be my only little criticism, that there needs to be seating around the pool. I highly recommend this hotel for Disney stays as it's literally a 10 minute walk from the park, they also sell tickets to the park. Excellent hotel.

This place is the best at everything. They deserve a 10. We got a single queen bed room and it was amazing. The bathroom was very spacious and neat. It is like a studio type and we stayed there for 2 nights; it was worth it. Plus, it is a 15min walk to Disney.   The staff were people friendly and very helpful. When we checked out in our room, we went to disney and I was on the cars land line. I realized my ring was missing. I called the front desk, and they were so considerate to go look for it. Thanks to them I got back my ring.   Note to everyone: Always book at the actual hotel-call the hotel. Not some third-party sites.

We wanted something cheap to stay near Disneyland. This is the place. It's 15 minutes walk away. The room was very clean, good size with a tidy bathroom. Some good places to get a meal nearby. Pretty much perfect if you don't want to spend a fortune. After all you're at Disneyland... you just need somewhere to leave your things and rest. The staff here were great. Very helpful and friendly. I'd come back again forsure.

Quick story; I stayed in Rodeway Inn in Huntington Park the night prior. Awful dirty place, will never go there again. Anyways, I looked online for somewhere near Disney with great reviews. I was planning on staying in a 4 to 5 star hotel, but came across Knights Inn. I never had a great experience with Knights Inn until this trip. But the reviews were good and decided to give it a try. Made a phone call to reserve and was treated very well by the attendant and the price was fair. Once I arrived, I was quickly attended in the very clean attendant room and notified of all conveniences. Then from the parking lot, watched Disney's fire work show as if I were there! If you're going to Disney, they have discounted tickets available and a bus route that stops right in front of the

We stayed here for a few nights during our Disney Trip. The room was quite spacious and absolutely clean. The man (I forget his name) at the front desk was very helpful and very nice. Very good room for a pretty good price. Will stay there again.

We were looking for a good value motel for a spur-of-the-moment trip to Disneyland and were impressed with the recent reviews of Knights Inn on TripAdvisor so we called and the reception desk gave us a great price. They also took into consideration my husband's mobility issues and assured us a ground floor room. Check in was a breeze and we loved the room. Sleek, modern furniture,  wooden floors and plantation shutters on the windows give the room a clean, dust free feel. Coffee maker, fridge, microwave and air conditioner worked well. Wifi was good and shower pressure good. Disneyland is within walking distance but we chose to use the shuttle. We are Seniors and it only cost $1. Per trip. Management were very kind and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

While this inn isn't much to look at from the outside, what it offers inside was incredible! The rooms are spacious, and recently renovated in a very clean, modern style. The shower was a godsend after our days at Disneyland! The location is not in the nicest of areas, but being only a 15 minute walk to the park was extremely convenient. It was nice being able to walk back to the room for a quick shower before dinner to refresh, and didn't take too much time out of our busy day. What really made our visit special though, was the amazing service! We were greeted warmly, and while we weren't able to get into the room right away (arrived about 10am) we were able to leave our car in the lot while we checked out Downtown Disney. All three staff we interacted with over the course of

This is a great place to stay.  It's close to Disneyland and the shuttle is right out in front of the hotel, which makes it's so easy.  The place is very clean and updated. The gentleman at the front desk was very helpful and welcoming.  I really don't have anything bad to say about this place.  Stayed four nights and I would definitely stay here again.

Excellent location - easy walk to Disneyland with a Starbucks just down the way! Simple hotel, but great for the price!! VERY clean room. Comfortable bed. I would definitely recommend it, and I will be staying again.

Very nice and large room, comfortable bed. Good if you want to stay near Disneyland with a cheap prize..free park and Wi-Fi..good staff very kind.  Shuttle for Disneyland in front of the hotel. I will come back.

Very much enjoyed our 2 night stay at the Knight Inn. The gentleman behind the desk(owner?) was really welcoming and helpful. The rooms are super clean, having been refurbished only recently and were comfortable. Great shower, free parking, free Wi-Fi, bar fridge and microwave, everything you need after a long day at Disney. You can walk to the park, only about 10 mins and a about the same walk to a variety of restaurant s or take out. Only minus, the bed was a little harder than we would normally sleep on but honestly we were that exhausted by the time back from a full day at Disneyland it mattered little. Overall an great place to stay.

Summary Heading: The best hotel value in the disney area
Summary: I absolutely love coming to the Knights Inn when I stay at Disneyland. It's location is great, about a 15 minutes walk from the park but tucked away from the chaos around the corner. It also provides a view of the fireworks from the parking lot (I could even hear the music!), which I always tale advantage of to start the disney magic the night before going to the parks. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The mini fridge and coffe maker are nice additions. The beds are very comfy and the air conditioning works like a dream. The only complaint I have is a very minor one... the towels are on the smaller side, so maybe bring your own of you can. But overall this hotel has it all. Extremely friendly and accommodating staff, prime location in proximity to Disney, clean and comfy

Took a family trip and came across this hotel. Very nice rates so decided to give a shot. We arrived before check in. Staff was very friendly. Got into are room it was very clean and contemporary.. Loved the wood floors. Lots of towels. Fridge worked well. I love my drinks super cold. Beds very comfy. Lots of options on tv. All in all was very nice stay and I will for sure return when vacationing in this area.

We had a wonderful stay here! Loved the 10 minute walk to Disneyland, saving us having to pay for parking at the park. Clean room, clearly updated and perfect for us as we wanted an easy, chill place to crash between parks. The staff was wonderful, nice and friendly. Loved having a mini fridge, coffee maker, and microwave in the room. In a good area, we felt safe the whole time. Would definitely atay here again!! Thank you!

STAY HERE! My friend and I originally had reservations at another nearby hotel that was one of the nastiest places we had ever seen. We could not stay there. Since it was so late at night, we had only a few options to move to, Knights Inn being one of them. WOW! Is all I have to say. For a couple bucks more per night we stayed in a beautifully updated room that exceeded all our expectations. It was CLEAN, and decorated beautifully. The bathroom was gorgeous; something I'd like in my home! The AC was amazing (we're big on white noise/cold while sleeping and it was perfect). There were even plantation shutters on the windows! We were literally living in luxury. Not to mention you're seconds from the parks. I will stay here again and again and again!!!

Summary Heading: Above expectations, super location and staff
Summary: Great value for money.  nice renovated spacious clean rooms, wifi and parking are free (great added value) Friendly staff always provide help an advices (helped in getting the tickets, gave recommendations on how to plan our visit to the park, Prioritization strategy and helpful tips) Very close to Disney 15-20 mins walk and shuttles are also available. Highly recommended.

This hotel checked all the boxes for a quick Disneyland weekend. Just renovated a year ago, it was clean and simple. It may be "no frills" but all basic needs are provided for and beds were comfortable. It was an easy 15 min walk to the main gate entrance on S Harbor Blvd, so you can leave you car at the hotel (free parking!) and save some money.  It is a bit farther to Downtown Disney so you may want to make the short drive if you plan to visit that area. Staff were very friendly and even let us know that if we book directly thru them rather than a 3rd party site, they may be able to give a better deal. Definitely recommend as a great budget hotel!

This place is great! It's affordable, clean, and comfortable. The staff is wonderful and super kind.  I accidentally booked our stay on the wrong date and when we did not show up for registration, I was called by the front reception girl who was super sweet, but I forgot her name, I'm sorry!  Anyway, instead of being charged like any other hotel/inn because of my mistake, she simply made the changes and I was not charged any penalties or extra fees.  I didn't even have to argue my mistake.  That never happened to me before.  This place saved me so much money.  When we did finally arrive for our stay, we were greeted so warmly and we felt so welcomed.  This place a gem!  We will definitely be booking here the next time we visit Disneyland again 👍👍👍👍👍😀

We have stayed in a few - what call themselves - hotels, even boutique hotels. But we found the standards here were better!  This looks like it's been recently renovated and they've done something the U.S. Don't seem to! They've put the sink in the bathroom!! Hotels around the world do this but U.S. Make you pee then go outside to wash and back in for a towel!!  The rooms were clean, beds big and comfy and you get a fridge, microwave and coffee machine. I don't know why you can't just get a kettle in these hotels as sometimes we'd like a tea but this is America home of the 22 coffee options on the petrol stations!!   We were quite surprised to get what I presume is cable TV with catch up built in! Great for unwinding after Disney. They had tons of channels with lots of episodes

Nice room. Good place to stay if going to Disneyland. There's a shuttle bus going infront of the hotel but we walked everyday to Disneyland and back to hotel. Easy walk and also my 6 yr old son could easily walk that after a long day in the park. Small pool and the water was a bit cold but oh it was refreshing to have a little swim after a long hot day in the park. Only one minus was that the air condition was very loud. I was prepared so I used earplugs and was able to sleep well. My son slept without earplugs and wasn't bothered about the noise. He slept very well.

Summary Heading: Clean, Good Value, and Close to Disneyland
Summary: Pros: -recently updated furnishings -within walking distance (<1mile) of Disneyland -staff was helpful, courteous, and friendly -overall very good value for the price  Cons: -towels were lowest quality - typical hotel towels -fireworks are very loud. In our room we were very surprised our two kids didn't wake up. This wasn't an issue the two nights we stayed late at the parks, but it was a surprise the first night at the hotel.

Summary Heading: Very clean and staff was so helpful!
Summary: We booked a room and were slightly worried that because of the price it would not be a very high quality hotel, but we were amazed with our room! It is very clean, new, and an amazing deal for the price! The location is perfect, just a couple of blocks from Disneyland. It was also only a couple of blocks from several restaurants and a Walmart as well. We were able to walk everywhere! The staff was very kind and was not hesitant to help us with anything. I would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Katelyn,  Your glowing review makes our entire team very proud.  Thank you so much for taking the time to write about your experience at our hotel and sharing with our future guests.  Most guests really are surprised at how close we are to Disneyland and what a great value our rooms are.  We look forward to hosting you on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: Very comfortable stay at budget priced accommodations. Room is spacious and newly remodeled. Shuttle or walking is easily accomplished. Near the renovated Packing House with many dining choices. Close to I 5. Daytime desk person was extremely helpful. New, easy to operate television. Starbucks is an easy walk from the inn.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your thoughts about our hotel with our future guests! We are so honored that you chose to stay with us and we were able to deliver on our commitment to wonderful customer service, value and comfort.  Nothing makes us more proud than when we see a review from another happy guest. We look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: Went on a quick trip to Disneyland, booked Knights Inn on the drive up to Anaheim, was fortunate to have a room available being it was very last minute. Didn't want to spend a lot for the hotel, we just needed a place to rest our heads for a couple of nights. Found this hotel to be very reasonably-priced! In fact, it was so reasonable...we thought there must be something wrong with it? On the contrary...it was very clean, bed was comfortable, clean/updated bathroom, had a fridge/microwave. Ray and the staff were very nice and helpful. The hotel is 2 blocks from the Disneyland parking structure, lots of amenities around the area as well. Starbucks one block from hotel. They also sell Disneyland tickets at a discounted rate. We were very pleased with our stay and the service...we
Manager Response: Dear Terri,  Thank you for your wonderful review! I am so happy you chose to stay with us.  Many of our guests are very surprised when they actually see our rooms and realize what a great value they are getting.  I will let your review speak for itself as to the value our hotel provides, especially being located so close to Disneyland. We look forward to seeing you on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: This hotel is only a 10 minute walk from the park and if you are too tired to walk they have a 5 dollar shuttle per person per day. The showers are extremely clean and the rooms have a homey feeling. It comes with cable a fridge, free wifi, a pool and air conditioning as well as a heater. It is also in walking distance and of many restaurants. The best part was that you could easily see the fireworks from disneyland, straight from the hotel. I will definitely be coming here again!
Manager Response: Dear Kristen,  We love when our guests take time to write about their stay. We love it even more when they appreciate our efforts to make the Inn a welcoming place to rest after a long day at Disneyland. Thank you for letting our future guests know what they too can expect when they choose to stay with us. We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary Heading: Great Motel Close to the Park
Summary: My Husband, Son and I stayed here during our visit to Disneyland and would stay at this Motel again. I'm not a Motel person but for the price and because it was newly renovated it was better than I expected. It's a short bus ride away from the park and there is a Starbucks on the same block to get a latte to start the day. The rooms had queen beds and we nice and clean. We asked for a quiet, renovated room and got exactly that. I appreciate that they were able to accommodate our request.
Manager Response: Dear Janet, Thank you for taking time to write about your stay.  We went through a complete renovation last year, keeping our guests comfort at the top of our list. I am so happy the end result was something you found to be a good value. We hope our future guests also give us an opportunity to impress them.  We look forward to seeing you the next time you visit Southern California.

Summary: Our family of 4 stayed here on our trip to Disneyland.  The rooms were clean and nice.  We drove 2400 kilometers to get there, so to land in a nice place was great.  We stayed in Santa Cruz one night and the price was almost double and the hotel was horrendous.  Glad that we chose to spend our last 2 nights in California at the Knights Inn.  I will recommend to anyone.
Manager Response: Dear Karin,  Thank you for taking time to share your experience at our hotel with our future guests.  I am happy to hear we were able to provide a great value for you and your family.  I am also very glad your appreciated our entire team's efforts to provide a clean and inviting hotel. We look forward to seeing you again when you visit Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Nice Remodel work of a Vintage hotel
Summary: I grew up in Garden Grove and visit my Mother here in Anaheim and always stay here as it is very clean and has been remodeled.  I highly recommend this Hotel.  It is very comparable to a lots of 4 star hotels I have stayed in.  Good job!
Manager Response: Dear Bill_wap,  Thank you so much for noticing our efforts to make the hotel appealing to our guests! Nothing makes us prouder. We look forward to hosting you the next time you visit your Mom here in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Hidden Gem in the heart of Anaheim
Summary: Upon arrival, we were assisted by a friendly man at the front desk for check-in who attended to all our needs as quickly as possible even given the long line of other guests behind us. The rooms were extremely clean with a modern chic take. Disneyland park is about a 15 to 20 minute walk from this cozy inn and if you choose to take the shuttle service right in front instead, it'll only cost you a couple bucks. Parking is free and the Inn offers free WIFI to its guests. This was my first stay here and most definitely won't be my last. The one thing that I encourage the Inn to improve on would be the air conditioning, the AC machine was quite far from the actual beds so the room did get a little toasty at night; we ended up turning off the AC and cracking the window instead;
Manager Response: Dear Jane,  Thank you so much for taking time to write about your experience here at our little inn. I appreciate your feedback on the AC units and will definitely look into fixing or replacing them so future guests don't have the same concerns. I am happy to hear that we were able to save you some money with the free parking and WIFI.  We look forward to hosting you on your next vacation here in Southern California.

Summary Heading: Disneyland hotel that won't break your wallet!
Summary: My boyfriend and I travel to Disneyland about two times a year. This time we were on a stricter budget than usual.. We ended up choosing The Knights inn last minute a few days before our trip. When we arrived the women at the front desk was friendly and upgraded us to a king room. We purchased our Disneyland tickets here as well. You can walk to Disneyland from the hotel but we just purchased ART shuttle tickets since we walk a lot already in Disneyland. Overall I am glad we chose the Knights inn it was clean, comfortable, and not far from Disney!
Manager Response: Dear Sarah S,  I sincerely appreciated your wonderful comments about the hotel. Nothing makes everyone on our team happier than when a guest lets us know we made their vacation just a little better. We especially like when a guest notices our efforts to maintain a clean, quiet and comfortable hotel.  We look forward to seeing you next time you are in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Clean room, friendly service, great price
Summary: I was down for a short business trip, 2 nights.  Other hotels with similar or worse reviews in the area cost easily twice as much.  From my phone call to book the room, to my check out the staff was extremely friendly and welcoming.  Room was very nice, with recent updates.  TV with free on demand regular cable, nice size fridge with small freezer section, microwave, coffeepot, iron.  Nice clean bathroom with recent updates.  Great place if you are coming down for business, even better if you are going to Disneyland. You are so close to Disney the fireworks show sounded like a cannon, I got to watch the whole show from the parking lot.  I will be using this hotel again in my future travel to the area.

Summary Heading: ECONOMICAL: Clean and Simple, 15 minute walk to Disneyland.
Summary: Tried this hotel. They were very clean and have bed bug covers to protect you. They check to insure that no critters are around which is a reality of todays travel... good to have an informed hotel. The place has a microwave and small fridge with the bathroom to be used as a sink. You need to bring any items you need for eating and cooking including a can opener. Wall Mart on the left and a big Latin food store on the right a few blocks down.  The staff are very nice. Their is no balcony or laundry facilities.  The only big downer for me was no hot tub. After a long day at disney land a hot tub is a need for me I realize now. I really recommend this place as an economical place to stay when you are going to disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear FamilyEdmonton,  Thank you for your 5-star review! We take our guests' safety and comfort extremely seriously, as you noticed with our bed protectors. I'm glad you were able to stock up on some groceries at the nearby Walmart.  We hope you can stay with us next time you visit California and Anaheim.

Summary: This is my second time staying at this hotel.. I've stayed at some pretty pricey hotels, like Hyatt hotel an ménage.... But I prefer this hotel.. You feel so welcome, with the services an the personal touch they give you. The rooms are so clean an nice.. Ant the price is great... It was so convenient to ride the transit.. Plays Starbucks just a few steps away.. I will be definitely be coming back.

So I wasn't expecting much from a little motel but honestly the staff really made it warm and welcoming. Andy is the nicest guy you'll ever meet.  It's not posh like a 5 star hotel so don't go in expecting that, but for a motel... It was really,really awesome.    I'd stay again for the simple fact- you don't get customer service like that anywhere anymore.

Summary Heading: Clean modern rooms at an affordable price.
Summary: The rooms are very clean and very modern chic. Very nicely done. Showers are top notch. Staff is super helpful.  There's a gas station (almost) right next door which also includes a Starbucks for your pre-disney pick me up.   The walkable distance to the Disney parks might be a bit much for some folks (15-20 minutes and over an overpass). But we walked every day and it was fine. There's always the option of taking a shuttle, or driving to the park. Both options cost $, of course.   The rooms are open-court/parking lot facing (typical motel layout), so the street volume and noise from other guests can get a bit loud. But it's no biggy.  Highly recommended this place.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our stay, great location, friendly helpful staff
Summary: Our room was exactly what was depicted in the photos. It was very clean, modern and recently updated, the price was  extremely reasonable. We will definitely book with Knights Inn Anaheim the next time we visit Disneyland in the future. I recommend purchasing a bus pass. We walked to Disneyland  on  one day which is only 1.4 miles away. After a long day at the park the ride back to our room was very welcomed with out fighting traffic and the best part is  Knights Inn is the very first stop on the route leaving the park which drops you right in font of the property. We stayed 3 nights our room was always freshened and beds were made  upon our return. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They took the extra time to point out all restaurants and recommended other

Summary Heading: Great Hotel Location and Great Room
Summary: Room was perfect! Up to date, Clean! Parking kinda sucked but we stayed 3 days and rode the ART to Disneyland so it was no hassle. If you want to walk to Disneyland it literally took us 20 minutes. No biggie. If you want to hit a bar or anything like we did, just go to downtown Disney for that.

Summary Heading: Great location, walking distance from Disney. Good rooms and extremely friendly staff
Summary: Have stayed 2 nights at Kinghts Inn and would recommend it for anyone who wants to visit Disney theme parks. Rooms are very clean and spacious, and Disney is a short 10-15 min walk way. Staff was extremely friendly at both check in and check out.

Within easy walking distance (shuttle available) with recently remodeled rooms and incredibly friendly staff! We were lucky to have Jamie behind the desk who helped us with all of our questions regarding getting to the park and can even set up tickets through the hotel.  The room was well equipped, and mot importantly clean. It seemed like the rooms were recently renovated and felt like an upscale hotel, but was affordable. I do not think you can find another hotel that close to disneyland and be able to buy tickets while operating on a budget, and this hotel certainly does not feel "budget".

The room was clean and exactly what I expected from the pictures. It was a quick drive to Disney. The staff was very friendly when I arrived and even before arriving while I spoke to them on the phone.   The bed was not made 1 day out of the 4 days I was there.. which I didn't mind anyways..

The reception staff and people running the place were fantastic, friendly and helpful ! They made us very welcome and were supper helpful, booking us tours etc. The hotel room itself was very clean and it was a lovely place to stay. If I were to return I would stay here again for sure, and would recommend it to my friends and family.

We needed a room for our 2 day Disney trip and booked 1 night at the Knights inn.  The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.  The rooms were clean and well kept.  Parking is free and we were able to walk to and from Disneyland without any troubles.  There is a shuttle also, but we actually found it faster to just walk than to wait.  We didn't need a bunch of extras, just a place to sleep and this was exactly what we needed for a less than average price.  If you plan to spend all your time at the hotel, this isn't for you.  If you plan to actually take advantage of Disney and just need a place to crash then this is perfect.

Just stayed here for NAMM and it was such a delight. Affordable, clean, and staff was very helpful. We also went to Disneyland and the shuttle was very convenient being in front of the hotel. I will definitely stay here again for future visits!

We just returned from Anaheim.   You are close enough to Disney to walk, but we have two 4 year olds and we opted to use the ART.  Which conveniently stops outside of the hotel. It was nice to be in a smaller hotel, very quiet and rooms were spacious. Staff was friendly and helpful.   Also tip to families there is a walmart neighbourhood about a block away, the ART system has a stop there. But I would suggest walking back ( take a rolling suitcase if need be to roll your groceries back). We bought fruit, cereal, yogurt and snacks.  This was great for breakfasts and snacks at the park.

Summary Heading: Excellent location. Excellent room. Great Staff
Summary: Upon arrival, we were immediately greated by friendly and helpful staff. It had been years since we were in Anaheim and much had changed. We not only got checked in quickly and efficiently, but got all sorts of information about shuttles, Disneyland, dining, etc. The room was excellent. I think it was the cleanest room we've ever stayed in. We would definitely stay again and recommend it to others.

I stay at this location everytime we are heading to Disneyland. It's clean. Prices are good. They have all you need from bus tickets to disneyland tickets and are always so friendly. And they are every attentive. It's always wonderful staying at this location.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney, just fine if you aren't spending any real time here
Summary: We decided kinda last minute to surprise the kids with a long weekend trip to Disneyland, and since Disneyland isn't giving away it's tickets, food, souvenirs etc, we really wanted to save some $ on hotels. BUT we didn't want a nasty, dirty, buggy place. This place was definitely suitable for just sleeping and hitting up disney. I think if I had a 1/2 star rating it might be 2 1/2 stars. But here's what we got:  PROS: LOCATION!!!! This is just about as close to Disneyland as you can get without being on the resort property (which was sold out by the time we booked, and likely too much $$ anyway). In theory you could walk the 1/2 block from the hotel to Harbor street then the 2-4ish long blocks down to the entrance to Disney by the transport hub. BUT knowing how much walking we'd

I needed a room and I needed it affordable. This was the place. It was clean and recently remodeled which was perfect. It is close to all the fun stuff and the front desk was helpful, The bed was great, my only wish was if the room had one more chair or a love seat as it was hard to sit on only the bed while my husband used the desk.

Summary Heading: Perfect way to start the year
Summary: My wife and I stayed for New Years weekend for 3 nights and visited Disneyland and I must say it was awesome.  I wanted to surprise my wife with this vacation before her surgery and it was the best decision I made. I really like the option of taking the shuttle to the park easy way to save gas and it's a one time fee for round trip. They sell discounted Disney tickets as they have the schedule for the parks and map for both parks and shuttles.The room was really clean felt right at home.  The staff gave the most outstanding service I can ask for they treated us more than just a guests more like family very helpful thank you very much Andy and Nicky I will definitely come back and stay there again.

The Knights Inn was cute, small, clean and comfy. The staff was very accommodating and awesome. They made my daughter's birthday extra special.   My 9 yr old daughter and I went for her 9th birthday. The two of us stayed a total of 2 nights 3 days. We flew in early on a Thursday and enjoyed her birthday at Disneyland from open to close on the first day. (WEAR COMFY WALKING SHOES) we went 7th of January after the rush of holiday and before the rides shut down for maintenance. It was perfect timing and "slow" according to the employees. Average wait was 15-30min for attractions. We got to do 23 different attractions when they usually try to get each guest 7. We used fast passes a lot. Cast members were all extremely nice. They gave my daughter two buttons for her birthday and 1st

First time in Cali & stayed w/my daughter. We came from the East coast & arrived late about 11:30 pm (2:30 am EST) & Andy at the front desk helped us settle in w/numerous tips of where to go, how to get there & more. The convenient location gave us options to walk, ride or drive. The room was very clean & comfortably fit 4 large suitcases & more. I had sore & achy muscles from my heavy carry-on luggage which affected my quality of sleep, however, the updated bathroom had an amazing showerhead that helped to refresh & restore my energy. Would definitely stay again & recommend!

My husband and I recently came back from Anaheim and we decided to give this hotel a chance. It was amazing, the guy in the lobby who took care of us upgraded us to a King Size bed since it was our honeymoon. 20 Minute walk from Disney, 20 minute drive from a great sushi restaurant. SO MANY GREAT PLACES TO EAT AROUND THERE. They even have a shuttle that'll take you to Disney, the ticket is 5$ round-trip.    We will be staying here again in March when we come back. I recommend this hotel is you guys are looking for something close to Disney, great food, and affordable.

Very helpful staff especially for first timer traveler like our family. Good location to visit Disney via walking or bus (if you tired after walking for whole day in Disney). For the service and location it is best value for money.

We loved staying at the Knights inn. The rooms are very clean and spacious, the staff was amazing and very helpful. They give you a lot of locations to eat or hang out at if you don't know the area, and it's close to Disneyland. We would stay again!

We have stayed at a few hotels near Disneyland and this is going to be one of our favorites. Really clean rooms. Beds are firm because they are new. Shower is perfect a lot of room and just great! Nice little dispensers for soap and shampoo so if you forgot yours you definitely have enough :-) The entire staff is friendly and very helpful. Was able to find great places to eat that wouldn't have found on our own.

We loved staying at Knights Inn. We stayed there for 7 nights, and enjoyed every minute of our stay.  All of the staff were extremely nice and very helpful with every question we had to ask.  The rooms were very clean and the beds were a little more firm than we are used to but were still comfortable.  Disneyland is about 1/2 mile away.  It can be walked to but we chose to ride the shuttle. The shuttle will pick you up and drop you off right in front of the motel.  We will stay there the next time we visit Disneyland.

Clean,  modern, affordable, spacious.  Great shower.  Easy access to Disneyland and Starbucks!  Had 2 rooms and walls are insulated well.  First time we have not stayed on a Disney property and the Knight's Inn made it so easy.

Reviews online are perfect for this hotel. It's great value, all recently renovated, quality wifi and cable TV.   Rooms are spacious and really clean, the walk to Disney is around 15 minutes or a shuttle or Uber are so cheap it is another easy option.   Andy at reception was a pleasure to deal with and didn't only focus on Disney Land but gave us plenty of other things to do while in Anaheim, he went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect.   Thanks to all the crew at Knights Inn Anaheim!!

Obviously travelled here to visit Disneyland and the location was perfect, it wasn't directly across the road but it was a short walk which was nice to get your day going, however a shuttle service was also available should you not want to walk.  Upon arrival I was met with incredible care and thorough processes to check me in- I'd changed my booking online a bit! Staff were incredibly understanding and ensured everything was signed and ready to go. I was able to purchase my Disney tickets here at a slightly discounted price which is always helpful.  Room was very spacious and sparkling clean, bed gave me a great night's sleep!  All in all, will be recommending this hotel to everyone I know, purely for the staff. I was travelling alone and I certainly felt like I was welcome and

Room was great and was very clean! Heater didn't work so they gave me a portable heater. Even offered to switch me rooms.My family and I took the art shuttle to Disneyland  from the hotel takes about 10-15 minutes. I will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great place near Disneyland. ディズニーにいくならオススメ！
Summary: <プラス> 立地が良い。飲食店が周りにたくさんある。ディズニーランドの入口まで徒歩15分。 フロントスタッフの対応がよい。周辺の説明を丁寧にしてくれる。部屋が空いていたようで、無料でアップグレードしてくれた。 部屋がきれい。写真の通りの清潔さと新しさ。 ホテルの駐車場から花火が見られる。(室内にいても爆発音のように大きな音が聞こえるが。) ディズニーからのバスが目の前で停まる。1日有効で5ドルと聞いていたが 帰りに乗った際は3ドルだった。  <Pros> Good location. There are many options of restaurants. Disney Land is within 15 minutes walk.  The staff at the front desk was awesome. He gave us the map and introduced around the hotel. Our room was upgraded with no extra charge.  The room was new and clean as the pics on the website showed.  The fireworks in Disney Land can be seen at the parking lot.  The bus from Disney Land stops just in front of the hotel. I heard the bus ticket was $5/day, but actually it was $3.   <マイナス> 壁が薄いため、隣の部屋の声が少し聞こえる。広い道路沿いにあるため深夜早朝でも車の音がかなりする。立地が良いため仕方ない。  <Cons> I

Truthfully, I didn't pick this hotel as the first choice. We are looking for budgeted ones and found some from tripadvisor behind Disney. However, there are reviews mentioned about stolen staffs with no management response .. in both hotels on my list. Then I chose Knights Inn Anaheim which is cheap compared to other hotels nearby.   And we are very satisfied since the very first moment we did check-in late at night. Andy greeted us with smile and friendliness. He also said that he had practice to pronounce my very long last name .. and he could do that well. He also explained neighborhood area and suggested me several attractions.   Location here is within walking distance to Disney. But after day long with crowd, suggested you to take shuttle back to the hotel, directly from

Summary Heading: Great place for a weekend at Disneyland
Summary: Highly recommend this hotel for quick access to Disneyland and surrounding attractions. I booked this room because it was very reasonably priced and is within walking distance of the park. I was pleasantly surprised by how clean and updated the rooms are. The best feature of this hotel is by far the staff. We arrived late Friday evening and the concierge, Andy, was so incredibly helpful. He pulled out a map pointed out every great restaurant in town, and the best way to drive to each location. When I left a piece of luggage in our room after check out, they were quick to call and made sure I was able to retrieve it before leaving town. Would absolutely stay here again.

We stayed 3 nights in Knights Inn in November, 2015.  The room was very spacious. and everything was super clean.  The beds were very comfortable too.  I will definitely come back again for my next Disneyland visit.

Great staff, helpful and friendly. Room was lovely, quiet, clean and perfect for our visit to Disney. Close to the parks and shopping. Walking distance to Walmart and Disney parks. Overall, it is the staff that make it here, going out of their way to make you feel comfortable and wanted.

We had traveled for about 2 hours so when we arrived at the hotel I needed the bathroom. Our room was not ready so the lady on the front desk found me a room I could use.  When we did get to check in, Nikki was on the front desk and again she helped us as we had only booked for 2 nights and we would like a extra night. As there was a marathon one they were busy but she did her best and we got the extra night.  The rooms are  modern with what looks like new furniture and barthrooms. They are nice and clean.  It is with walking distance to dinsey about 15 mins you have to go over the freeway but it is safe. If you don't want to walk you can get the shuttle it's 5 dollars return.  Would I book again you bet.

This is a great place with wonderful staff. It is very reasonably priced and I was impressed with the cleanliness, updated decor, and superb staff. We have two little ones so we opted to get the ART bus pass to get back and forth from Disney. If we didn't have them with us, we would have been able to walk to Disney.

Summary Heading: The Hotel Manager and Front Desk Staff go above and beyond!
Summary: My boyfriend and I arrived to a smiling face behind the front desk. The young lady was super helpful and answered all our questions regarding transportation and the local amusement parks.  Andy the office manager was also so helpful and made us feel like guests in his home. Thank you guys for an awesome stay!

Summary Heading: Very clean convenient and helpful staff.  Free parking and walking distance to Disneyland!!
Summary: We have stayed here for years during our annual trip to Disneyland.  The staff has always went above and beyond for us and the location and free parking are a bonus.  The rooms have always been clean and up to date too.  We will be back !!!!

Very nice place run by nice people. Simple and clean. Exactly what we were looking for. Air con works very well and outside noise is not a problem. Nice, brand new bathroom! Didn't get a chance to use to pool, but checked it out and looks clean.

Summary Heading: Do yourself a favor and move along!!!!
Summary: DO NOT STAY HERE!  Too bad you cannot give a rating of Zero Stars....I would rather sleep in my car then ever deal with these RUDE people again! So here is the reason...We did not get our regular hotel choices because we waited too long to book prior to our trip (our fault for deciding to go last minute).  We have annual passes so we have stayed at many hotels around the area and always have had a pleasant experience. This hotel had some old reviews that were not good, but it appeared that recently they had cleaned up their act so we decided to give them a try. We arrived early after an 8 hr drive from I5 being closed and we were not allowed to check in early (which was ok at the time because not all hotels allow this- and they were going to let us leave the car if we wanted

I made the reservation kind of last minute and expected the same run down Knights Inn. This was pretty awesome and a good price. Nice remodeled rooms, clean, quiet, and very nice helpful staff. Andy, was wonderful. When we come back we will definitely stay here again!

Located at very good place, 15-20mins walk to Disneyland, 1mins walk to starbucks, fast food at the same street and a nice pizza shop. Walmart is just 10mins walk away.  You can see the disneyland fireworks at the hotel. One free parking at this 2 stories hotel. Swimming pool is there but no one use it.  Internet speed is so so, aircond is a bit noisy but all these can be compromised by the price.  No breakfast at this hotel.

Summary Heading: great location and perfect job executing hotel basics
Summary: Don't use Google maps to tell you how close this place is to Disney! It's much closer than it appears when you search it. Though the walk is not scenic and you cross some noisy highways, you can get there directly in 10-15 minutes, and there's a Starbucks right next to the hotel to keep you caffeinated and cooled on the way. (There's also a shuttle if you don't want to walk.) For the price, you get great basics: cleanliness, comfort, and fun (pool). You are not going to get jumbo bath towels, pool towels, or buffet breakfasts here, but if all you need is a place to rest your head, this is a great spot.

The hotel was great with Andy and his wife giving all the advise and helpful hints....the room was very clean and the hotel was right next to the bus stop which made it very easy to get anywhere!! Would stay again and highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants great a great rate and a fantastic room!!

We were truly happy with every aspect of this hotel. We were greeted with a warm welcome and that service continue through out our stay. From replacing a key (because I left it in the room) to giving us help with the ART system. This kind of courtesy is hard to find and nice to receive. The rooms them self were also just as nice and clean. I will recommend this place again and again.

I spent 2 weeks at this hotel and my first choice was that it's near Disneyland only 15 mins walking. However, when I went there I knew that I made the right choice. Andy and Nicki were the most friendly and helpful receptionists I have ever seen. They always helped me in reserving trips within California which was a big deal for me since it was my first time visit in US and things were different from Europe. They also had always provided me with recommendations for restaurants to try near by. Whenever I needed anything they were there for me with so much patience just to help me enjoy my staying as much as possible. Rooms were daily cleaned as well as being spacious and contain all essential stuff you may need. I would say that the only suggestion I have for them is to include

Clean room comfortable bed and clean bathroom, completely satisfied with my stay. Excellent customer service! Front desk management was very helpful. Would definitely stay again when visiting Anaheim.....

Summary Heading: Great stay, kind staff and very near disney
Summary: 15 mins walk or 3usd über to the Disney park. Ticket can be purchased at the hotel which saves the queue. There is a food court and star bucks nearby which is very convenient! Staff are very nice to offer help. Room is very clean

Staff was amazing, super nice and friendly. Check in was fast and so was check out. The other guests didn't bother me, in fact I didn't even really see them! Rooms are super nice, especially the bathrooms (the shower is wow). Only thing is, not a lot of room for eating so your bed becomes an option. Free parking was nice, and you are so close to Disneyland! So you can walk, drive, or take the bus and they are all convenient.

Knights Inn Anaheim is a wonderful place to stay if you are in the Anaheim area!! We stayed 4 nights for our trip to Disneyland, the walk to Disneyland is not bad, we have 2 kids and walked it easily, there's also SO many options for dining close by. The room was neat and clean, hardwood floors and nice beds. You can also see the fireworks from the back area of the hotel. The price is the best part!! Very affordable, especially after spending a fortune on tickets!! Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Summary Heading: Had a very nice trip, nice place to stay
Summary: The Knights Inn is a really nice place to stay.    The rooms are quiet and comfortable and appear to have been updated recently.  The staff was also really nice and accommodating.  It takes about a 20 minute brisk walk to get to Disneyland.  The only thing I wish the hotel did was a continental breakfast.

Summary Heading: Updated and Great place to stay
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights on a Disney trip, and although I was hesitant to book it, I'm so glad that I did.  The rooms have all been recently update throughout.  The carpet was nice and soft.  I was blown away by how amazing our stay was.  I highly recommend staying here again.  I got a deal on a website for a great price, but haven't been able to book again on other trips, or I would stay here again!

This was a last minute spontaneous trip to LA, was looking for something near Disney and afootdable. Originally booked 3 nights, ended up staying for 6 nights. Disney is a pleasant 15 minutes walk away and bus route just outside (but me and my fiancé who proposed in one of the rooms were more than happy to walk).   Andy was brilliant, very helpful and a joy to chat with... Very accommodating with our last minute requests and what's more, very committed to his job. He works far too hard, but he should be very proud of his level of service, our experience at the Knights Inn Anaheim has been a very touching stay. The other members of staff we met were very delightful and helpful, Nikki and Jammie. During our stay, we saw Jammie in two different occasions but we spoke as if we have

This was a great little spot to visit Disneyland.  It's a 10 to 15 minute walk and a 3 min walk to Starbucks and a minimart for any last minute snacks.  The room had a fridge, microwave and plasma TV on the wall, it was immaculate. Shower was great !! The room was simply furnished and had everything we needed. wifi was excellent and free and parking was ample.  The hosts nickki and andy were sooo helpful, they couldn't do enough for us. We would def stay here again.

Don't let the outside of this hotel fool you the rooms have all been recently remodeled and are so nice and clean.
