Staff are wonderful to work with super helpful and Andy and his wife were so accommodating to our family and happy to help with every random request we had (like a broom because my kids decided to bring the beach with them in the car)  Andy went out of his way to make sure our stay was wonderful and we appreciated his service so much! You can see the fireworks of Disney from the hotel and the hotel is right behind the Starbucks - which is amazing for every sleep deprived parent who has spent one to many days in Disney! And one other wonderful bonus of the hotel is it is directly across the street from Disney parking so you can hop on the shuttle and ride into the

Stayed here for the Disneyland Dumbo Double Dare (10K on Saturday followed by the Half Marathon on Sunday). The room was remodeled with laminate plank flooring and a nice walk-in shower. Basic room but I just needed a place to sleep since both runs started at 5:30 AM. The shower took awhile to heat up the first morning but was fine after that. Andy at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. I deducted one star because the bed was pretty firm, almost like there was no mattress. But they did upgrade me from a Queen to a King and I still managed to sleep fine. Would stay here again because of the value, no carpet, and less than 15 minute walk to the Disneyland area.

Great location- close to Disneyland, you can go on foot. Rooms clean and comfortable. Fast WiFi for free, free parking . Nice pool, you can cool there your tired body... And the most importand - VERY friendly staff ( Andy and Nicky) -they could explaine everything about the town.  Family with teenagers.

Summary Heading: Close location, renovated rooms, but firm bed
Summary: Really, you do not need the ART shuttle (which costs money) to get to Disneyland from this hotel.  It is nicely renovated hotel.  However!  Be warned, the beds are as firm as a plank of wood.  If you like insane firm beds, this is place for you.  If you are used to pillow-top style, this will be nightmare to sleep on.

I stayed for one night with my daughter, when we visited Disneyland (August 2015)  its 15min walk to the park  the rooms are completely renovated, clean  the manager and everyone in the hotel were very helpful  highly recommended!!!!

We booked online and the price was really good as it was mid week. the staff are fantastic and super helpful.  it's a 15 min walk to Disneyland which we did twice and was fine. or the shuttle passes directly outside.  Starbucks and food mart about 50 meters away. parking easy. rooms are obviously newly renovated are great, bathroom is fantastic. my two only complaints which are small. the air con is loud and the bed was too uncomfortable for both of us to sleep in I kept rolling into the middle I think it had a v to it not flat. but would recommend and would stay here again.

The room was super clean and very nicely remodeled. It Has a great modern look to it and the gentleman at the desk was super welcoming  and nice as well! I definitely recommend staying at this place especially for the low price!

My boyfriend and I stayed here 3 nights for a trip to Disneyland. The rooms are exactly as pictured, very clean and comfortable. The manager Andy (who was a fellow New Jerseyian) was beyond helpful and gave us a ton of useful information regarding the ART shuttles (which are only $5 a person and stop nearby), as well as restaurants and places to shop. It's in a good area, close to a gas station, starbucks, and other restaurants. It's also possible to walk to Disney if one wants to, and you can watch the fireworks from the parking lot too. We had a great stay and would definitely recommend it to others, and would stay here again for our next visit!

Stayed here for a week at the end of our six week vacation in the USA, the staff are very helpful, rooms are very clean and tidy, laundromat and food outlets are close by and the ART bus stops right out the front. We had a very enjoyable stay, couldn't have asked for more.

Summary Heading: Basic motel but very helpful - great choice
Summary: This was an oldwer style motel, but with very well remodelled rooms. We were put (as a family) ina corner room which was much quieter for us. The owners gave us lots of very useful information, especially aboutplaces to eat near Disneyland. We bougth two day passes and again received helpful information as well as a small discount. Disneyland was a 15 minute walk (less without children) and very easy. Walking home even late at night was easy as the roads are wide and well lit. The thing which made the differcne was the friendliness and helpulness of the staff. Would thoroughly recommend this motel.

Summary Heading: Would go there or refer someone there in a heart beat!
Summary: It was an older motel that had been upgraded.  For a budget hotel, we were very impressed!  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Rooms were good size, large walk in shower, modern furniture, fridge, microwave, TONS of outlets for all our electronics, iron and ironing board and very clean. We felt safe in the neighborhood and walked down to Subway. (before the Jared scandal!!).  The owner told us we could see the Disneyland fireworks from the parking lot as we did not go to D-land the day we checked in.  LOVED that the entire grounds were non smoking.  Not a ton of parking, but we kept our spot.  Free wifi that worked fine.  Close to Disneyland or you could walk there too.  We will stay there next time we go to Disneyland and will recommend to our friends too. The only "problem"

When making a choice that was convenient, clean and friendly, Knight's Inn exceeded our expectation!!! Staff was EXCELLENT, PROMPT and very helpful with EVERYTHING!!! We had the time of our life and they really made our stay feel like we were at home. WE would strongly recommend you stay there. The Charles Family

We loved staying here, wonderful service, room was very clean, beds were comfortable and I have a bad back, so, I have a difficult time sleeping, not here, I was able to sleep like a baby! Rooms have been nicely remodeled and decorated. The family that runs this inn are very nice, we had our youngest son fly in to meet us and he had to pick up a room key at the front desk and he too was very impressed with the service he received. When we come down for our vacations to the theme parks we will definitely stay here.

Excellent place to stay, family friendly, neat and owner is readily available and very attentive. Showed up without reservation and still received excellent customer service. Close to Disney  park and you can get your park tickets there for a discount price. Bus hopper picks up right in front on hotel building. Hotel offers free parking and WiFi. Will definitely stay here again on my next visit.

We stayed at this motel for two nights for a Disneyland trip.  I echo what others said.  Rooms are very roomy, with plenty of space for luggage. Fridge and microwave available.  Bathroom also roomy with very nice fixtures and excellent shower pressure.   Notable:  very friendly and helpful staff.  Andy gave us excellent directions, while circling on a map what we were looking for.  He also came up to our room to look at a sink at 1100pm.  Parking and wifi free, which if you've done any comparison shopping, you will know is a huge perk.  10 minute or so walk to park, but well lit and sidewalks the whole way.   Only improvements I could suggest, mattresses are VERY firm, and towels are VERY small.  Towel is size of bath mat, bathmat is size of hand towel.  But these are minor

Summary Heading: A nice place at a nice price
Summary: We stayed 4 nights: A mother and adult daughter outing. The young lady at the counter was so friendly and nice. She really made us feel welcome. She answered all our questions like it was a pleasure to do so.  When we needed help they helped us. The first thing my daughter said when we opened the door was "It's so clean!".  We took ART [Anaheim Resort Transit] to and from the park. Very slick. But one night due to a miscommunication between ART and Disneyland's park hours, many people got stranded at the park with no way to get back to their hotels. Though we were dog tired the walk back to the Knights Inn was manageable. We are very budget minded and it had the best price for what we wanted.  I'm glad we stayed there.  [One reviewer mentioned some noise from adjoining rooms. I

My daughter and I took a spur of the moment short trip to Disneyland and I wanted to stay on a budget. This motel was great. It looks older, but the outside is deceiving. Our room was spacious, clean, and nicely redone in a simple sleek style.  Hardwood floors, wooden blinds, soap and shampoo dispensers (bring conditioner), flat screen TV, free Wi-Fi. Close location to Dland, easy walkable, though we took the ART with all day pass so we could come and go easily. Starbucks and a convenience store practically next door.  I think I paid $89/night (thru aarp) -  The only negatives: walls are thin so you can hear other guests at times, towels are not soft/high quality.  Really can't beat it - for as little time as we spend in a hotel when visiting Disneyland, it was great and we'd

Summary Heading: Super clean and an excellent staff!
Summary: You know how when you're sifting thru the reviews for a place and you come to the pictures and you say "that looks nice" and you just know that they "gussied up" the place for the picture? Not here! The room was just as pictured which is to say super clean, comfy, well laid out and quite spacious! My daughters and I just recently stayed at the "Knights Inn Anaheim" while visiting Disneyland. We were very pleased with the accommodations and the excellent staff! This quiet and unassuming Inn was close to many things including a "Starbucks", a gas station, several fast food places, a grocery store and of course Disneyland itself. We stayed three nights and were very happy! We would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting the theme parks (Knotts Berry Farm is also pretty close

Summary Heading: Excellent place - well located for Disney
Summary: Very good welcome and staff cannot do enough to help, room clean and well equipped, nothing too plush but comfortable.  Fifteen minute walk into Disney past various restaurants where you can get breakfast.  Would thoroughly recommend.

Double queen room was very comfortable for 4 (2 adults, 2 teenagers). Microwave would be more useful if a couple of plates/bowls were provided, but maybe I should have thought of that! Bathroom very clean and good pressure in the shower. Easily manageable walk to Disney and many fast food options close by. Very satisfied with room and very happy with great front desk service - thank you.

he rooms are exactly like the pictures and it's only a 10min walk from Disneyland. For our first trip to L.A, Andy made our trip better than expected. He was extremely helpful and gave us tips on where to go to see the secret spots of L.A. We will definitely be back.

The room was nice, very clean but the customer service was over the top! Nikki and Andy are wonderful. They did everything they could to make us feel welcome and make sure our stay was perfect. I would definitely stay there again and left feeling like we had two new friends.

Stayed 3 days for a disneyland trip. Nice clean rooms, exactly like the pictures presented, beds are on the firm side, I liked it but it depends on your preference, decent wifi tends to disconnect every hour for some reason, parking is a tad tight though plentiful, close to food places and gasoline station, walk to Disney is around 15 mins over a bridge, shuttle to Disney right next to hotel but it's faster if you take shuttle next to menage, very hospitable staff, had air conditioning on full blast for 3 days never had issues.

I stayed here during the week of Disneyland's 60th anniversary. The staff at Knights Inn were always helpful and courteous during my stay. They even upgraded my room to a king size bed at no extra charge. My room was always kept clean and Disney is right down the street from the inn. I plan on staying here again during my next visit to Cali and would recommend.

This trip was with my son and his wife and kids. He is in the navy and will be deployed for 8 months so I wanted to give them an early Christmas gift. Our stay at Knights Inn was perfect. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The staff were very friendly and made sure we had everything we needed. I would definitely stay there again.

Another family and ours stayed at Knights Inn for four nights.  We chose the place based on the reviews, the price, and the fact that they had availability when other places we'd stayed did not.  We had an excellent experience.  First, the couple who run the place, Nicki and Andy, are extremely helpful and nice.  Andy had taken our reservation on the phone, and had carefully explained the charges and the like. Then on the drive there, we had a flat, and whenI called to let them know that we were going to be arriving pretty late,  Nicki asked, "Is anyone helping you?" as soon as I mentioned the flat. When we arrived, Andy pulled out a map and explained the ART shuttle system and routes, where we could find food, and even where the place to stand to watch the fireworks from hotel

My wife and I wanted to get to Disneyland 60 anniversary.   We tried finding reasonable pricing for a week.  With no luck at first, we were just going to do a one day trip.  At the last minute we found Knights Inn (2days $340).  The other places near Dland were going for much higher.  It's a small motel but it had been recently updated and .7 miles for the Dland entrance.    The staff (Andy) was great.  He had informed us of the little shuttle bus that drops you off right at Dland entrance for only $5 and 24 hrs.  He also give us a map with the other routes and best food spots.  The only off note I could say was, the box springs in our bed was noisey.  So getting in and out was pretty funny....Did not want our neighbors thinking anything.....LOL

We stayed one night and it was average overall.  ThereisnNo laundry or breakfast provided but Starbucks is a few steps down the road.  The hotel is located on a very busy road but road noise is not a problem.  Very friendy hosts. Average hotel overall, nothing special but nothing bad about it.

Me and my 3 friends stayed at this inn so we could go to Disneyland and for the price we payed I was not expecting it to be as nice as it was! Our 2 queen beds had silk blankets and the shower had fancy shampoo & body wash dispensers! It was also only a 10 minute walk to the Disneyland park. I was over all extremely pleased with my stay and I would absolutely go there again!

We stayed at the Knight Inn for 2 nights/3 days. Overall we picked this hotel due to location and renovated rooms. We were not disappointed at all. The price was amazing considering it is located only  half a mile from Disneyland. There was a small shuttle for $5 (daily ticket/person) that would take you to Disneyland and the stop was right outside the hotel. The manager was very kind to answer the door immediately as our first day we spend it in Disneyland and we returned back for our keys and check in after midnight. Very very friendly couple and gave us a lot of info for the parks and the area.  The room given to us was the one for handicaps and there was no bathtub which made things kind of "wet" in the bathroom after a shower but on the other hand it was extremely spacious.
Manager Response: Dear SirPetr,   Thank your for taking time to write about your stay and give special tips to our future guests. I think you summed it up with the title to your review! We are only a quick walk to Disneyland and many local grocery stores, convenient stores, coffee shops and restaurants. We hope you choose to stay with us next time you visit our area.

Summary: The room we had was nicely remodeled and very clean. Staff was helpful regarding our Disneyland trip with bus info and places to eat. On the downside... No breakfast or coffee, small bed, and a bit noisy. I would stay here again for the affordability and cleanliness.

Thought I was taking a gamble since the price was pretty cheap, turned out to be VERY, VERY nice. This place exceeded my expectations. The room was very clean and you can tell it was newly remodeled. Hardwood floors, microwave, and mini fridge were a plus!! The walk to Downtown Disney is only 10 minutes away, which isn't bad at all. Shuttle service was perfect. All in all, a great hotel, you get more than what you pay for. Will be staying here again!!
Manager Response: Dear Dpe294,   5-star reviews make us very happy! Thank you for sharing your appreciation of our value, cleanliness and proximity to Disneyland. I hope future guests can see for themselves how hard we try to make every vacation a perfect one.

Summary: Good hotel apart from noisy ice machine outside door! Location was fine, only 15min walk to Disney. Staff were helpful with tips and advice for Disney and eating in the area. The room was clean and comfortable.

My sister and I were hesitant to book because of the super low price, but went for it based on the great reviews. Best decision ever! The room was the cleanest (and cheapest) I've ever stayed at near Disneyland. The staff was super friendly and very welcoming which always makes a stay more enjoyable. The beds we had were very hard, but I can sleep anywhere when I'm tired so it wasn't a problem for me. So close to Disneyland and places to eat.  Free parking is a huge plus! I've stayed at many places close to Disneyland and never felt compelled to stay there again, but this place I'll definitely stay at again.
Manager Response: Dear Monkmom1,   Thank you for your 5-star review of our Inn. I hope our future guests see for themselves what a great value we provide for families. We recently finished upgrading our furnishings and we hope we continue to get the reviews we work hard to earn.

Summary Heading: Very friendly staff and spotless room.
Summary: This hotel has a 2 star rating and I reluctantly booked the room based on the good reviews. They were right, the place is great! Early check in was no problem, Nicki and Andy are very friendly and helpful. They gave us a map and marked the various places to eat that were close by. There is a Taco Bell, Starbuck's and a mini mart all within a 2 minute walk and a bunch of other places within a short drive. The room was absolutely spotless and I appreciate the laminate floor over carpet. The bathroom was huge, the bed comfy, it has a flat screen TV, microwave, fridge, and coffee maker. The grounds although simple were spotless as well with plenty of parking close to the rooms. This very well may be the best bargain in the Disneyland area. Book with confidence.

Knights Inn was a great hotel to stay while at Disney.  We were able to walk to and from the park with no problem and the room was clean and nice.  Starbucks was right next door and all the people helping were very pleasant.  Love the inside of the room it was done like a $300 night room minus the characters.
Manager Response: Dear Dzig222,   We love when guests give us a 5-star review because it means we were able to make their vacation a good one! I am glad you appreciated our new furnishings and bathroom renovation and the value we try so hard to provide. We know how expensive it can be to visit Southern California and we want to provide a great value for families. We hope to have you stay with us next time you are in Anaheim.

Summary: Very nice small hotel. 10 min walk to Disney and 5 min walk to shops and food. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are very nice. Small but very nice pool area! I will definitely stay here the next time i visit the area!
Manager Response: Dear Peterlovberg, Thank you for taking time to let other guests know about our little hotel. We are are very happy you chose to stay with us and we were able to make it a pleasant one. We look forward to your next visit to Anaheim and Southern California.

Summary: We spent 3 nights at Knights Inn. Andy & Nicki were really welcoming hosts. They were helpful & informative upon our arrival. Our room was much better than we had anticipated given the cost per night and close proximity to Disneyland. The room was spotless and the bed was comfortable and there was a fridge & microwave included. We also had use of a small pool which was a great extra for motel accommodation. We would definitely recommend the Knights Inn.
Manager Response: Dear Andrew, Thank you for your 5-star review of our hotel. We are happy to hear we were able to provide excellent customer service and quality rooms. We hope our future guests also appreciate our value and convenience during their vacation in Anaheim. See you next time you are in Anaheim!

Summary: My family and I stayed at this hotel while attending Disneyland 60th anniversary because it was within a reasonable walking distance to the park. We stayed for 3 nights and we really enjoyed. The staff and owner were super friendly and very attentive. The place was neat and clean. Also the bus that takes you to Disneyland stops right at the main office building and you can buy your Disneyland and bus tickets there at the hotel with a discount price. Room rates are good and not expensive like other hotels near by. My family and I will definitely come back to stay at this place in our next visit to Disney!!
Manager Response: Dear Jose,   Thank you for sharing your experience with our future guests! I am pleased we were able to provide the service, value and convenience during your stay.  We look forward to your next visit and stay at our hotel.

Summary: This was a great value for 4 nights. Newly renovated nice clean rooms. Staff was very nice and helpful. About a 20 minute walk to disneyland gate, which wasn't bad after walking all day. Room only had a shower no bathtub.
Manager Response: Dear Meagan,  Nothing makes us happier than when our guests' show their appreciation of the hotel and staff by posting a 5-star review! Thank your for choosing to stay with us. We know you have many choices and it makes us proud when guests enjoy the cleanliness, service and convenience of the hotel.

Summary: This hotel met all expectations and exceeded some. The rooms were nice, the staff friendly, and the property was well-maintained. For the price it was a great value and we will certainly stay there again. There's a Starbucks next door and plenty of restaurants between the hotel and Disney. Assuming you're looking for value close to Disneyland (and don't mind walking a little to get to the park) you won't get much better.

Loved this hotel, super clean and newly updated. In walking distance to Disney entrance, free parking so you can leave your car and catch shuttle. There are restaurants along the way, so you can enjoy a nice meal before or after your day at the park Staff is amazingly helpful and friendly. We didn't swim but pool is also available and clean. Would use this hotel again.
Manager Response: Dear MadMom62610,  5-star reviews from our guest make us so proud!  Thank you for expressing your satisfaction with the  efforts of the hotel staff.  Our housekeepers work hard to make sure our guests have a clean and fresh room during their stay.  I am also you were pleased with our recent renovations.  We hope you can visit us a again after the new furnishings arrive in July.

Summary: We chose this hotel because it was within walking distance to Disneyland.  We  arrived before check in time which was 3pm. We started our walk to see how long it would take to walk to Disneyland and it was a 15 to 20 minute walk and after the first incline the rest was flat and convenient with dining facilities for basically all three meals.  When we arrived back the room was ready; the staff were very friendly and professional and the room was clean, a nice size and basically had all the conveniences of home.    If or when I return to the Anaheim area I would select this hotel again as it is close to many attractions whether you choose to walk or drive.
Manager Response: Dear Alice,   Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your vacation! I am happy the room was clean and the staff was attentive.  We sincerely try to make every guests' stay a wonderful one. We look forward to hosting you on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: Just a few things to note about this hotel.  •	You can walk to the park but it is 15-20 walk.  •	The whole hotel has been renovated, the rooms look, smell and feel new.  •	Get park the discount tickets from the front desk… Saves $5.00 per ticket.  •	The pool is not heated and doesn’t look all that clean. But that isn’t why we stayed in this place. •	The price was great. We’ve stayed in MANY hotels in the area and this has been the best value. Besides the long walk to the park.   •	The staff was very friendly and helpful, we stayed for a week so we saw a lot of them.  •	This is a small hotel so it isn’t really busy or crowded.  •	Loved the FREE wi-fi. Almost all the hotels in the area charge for wi-fi AND parking. Knights didn’t charge for ether.  •	Would have given a 5 star but
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write about your stay at our hotel!  I am happy we were able to help you save money and time by providing discount Disneyland Passes at the hotel. We are indeed renovating our hotel and I apologize for the water being turned off during your stay.  We hope to host you and your family on your next visit to Southern California

Summary: After researching all the hotels and motels...this one was a dream come true!  Great price....newly renovated!  Very clean!  Close to everything!  Staff awesome!  Can't go wrong!  I would highly recommend!  Only complaint...the pool..
Manager Response: Dear Marti,  Thank you for the 5-star rating.  Nothing makes us more proud than when guests appreciate the efforts we put in to make every guests' vacation wonderful.  We look forward to seeing you next time you are in Southern California.

Summary: I chose this hotel due to being the most inexpensive this past weekend and it was quite nice. I like the modern upgrades & the free parking. Staff was nice.. I liked the fact that it was quiet and clean too!! Most likely will chose this hotel again!

The hotel was very nice! The shower was great, the bed was super comfortable, and the staff was awesome! The room was always clean. It is only about a mile from Disneyland and there are plenty of stores and restaurants around. Great little place to stay in Anaheim. Absolutely recommended!
Manager Response: Dear Kabrokwah,  Thank you for taking time to write about your stay and letting our future guests know about our hotel.  I am glad to hear you enjoyed our service, comfort and proximity to many restaurants and shops in the area. We look forward to hosting you on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: Knights Inn is less than a mile from Disneyland, took me about 15 minutes to walk there. ART does stop by the hotel so if you don't want to walk or drive the bus is a nice alternative (i believe its about $5.00/pp for the all day use pass)  Knights Inns, was clean, had a mini fridge and micro, which is nice, one draw back if you are a big coffee drinker is it a one cup at a time device, I will confess i bring my own pot and coffee just for cases like this :-)  there is a Starbucks very nearby  approx a 2 minute walk.   Front desk staff, Alyssa, was so sweet and answered all my questions. When i arrived there was so water (not hotels fault) the city of Anaheim was working on the water system and she was so apologetic, and gave me a couple bottles of water. I would stay here

We stayed at this hotel because of it being reasonably priced and so close to Disney. However, it exceeded our expectations. The room was updated with a modern look and hardwood floors. The bathroom was beautiful with a great shower head stream. The housekeeping was so nice and even gave us extra towels since she saw I had a large family. We were able to see Disney fireworks from our hotel. We were able to check in early, our room was not ready so they put us in a different room with no hesitation. All in all it was a great stay and we are going back next month.....will not stay anywhere else!

I have to admit, I am very very picky! I looke up picture after picture.....review after review prior to booking and travel. I chose this hotel because of updates, great reviews and price. It lived up to all my standards. VERY CLEAN! Updated bathrooms,  enough room to store luggage for my family. They do have pergo type flooring and its very nice looking. Tip: Keep sandals on so dirt doesnt stick to your bottom of your feet and you drag it to bed.(dirt happens carpet or no carpets)  Learned the hard way. Great view of fireworks show also! It was an awesome secret clean hotel of the disney strip. Customer service was amazing even during our late check in. I will will def. Be staying here again. If I had one thing I didn't like it wasnt the inn it was the fact the Anaheim resort
Manager Response: Dear Kimmirae,   Thank you for your 5-star review!  I am happy to hear you appreciated our location, amenities and customer service.  We really do work hard to make every guests' stay a wonderful one.  We look forward to hosting you on your next visit to Southern California.   Sandy

Summary: The room was very clean and it was quiet.  The front desk was veey polite. Do not expect it to be close to Disneyland though. It was nice to have mini fridge and microwave in the room. One big downfall is there were no decent restaurants close by.
Manager Response: Dear Everett,   Thank you so much for taking time to write about your stay at our Inn. I am glad we were able to provide clean and quiet accommodations for you and your family. We do have many fast food establishments within walking distance and many sit-down restaurants within a 5 minute drive or accessible by taking the ART shuttle, which stops at our Inn. Many of our guests tell us they love the numerous dining options at Downtown Disney and Anaheim Garden Walk. I will make sure future guests are aware of all the options available to them. We look forward to your next visit!  Sandy

Summary Heading: Clean, not cheap, but not expensive, quiet, convenient, CLEAN stay
Summary: I, my husband, and 5 yr old son stayed here 2 nights last Thurs/Fr. The pictures are pretty dead on. Best thing about this hotel is the cleanliness. I am a germaphobe, always cleaning person. I liked that it was a fully non-smoking hotel. No worrying about cigarette smell. It is walking distance to Disney, but may be considered a bit far at days end. If you are really trying to be thrifty make the walk, ev lil bit adds up. Drive or take a shuttle if it rains tho. There is no safe in the room, however we did leave some valuables in the room and nothing was taken. Housekeeping is great.  We asked for extra towels on our way into Disney and at the end of the day the extras were there. Traffic noise, I didn't hear any. Manager at front desk was nice. The pool is not heated and there
Manager Response: Dear Sarah,  Thank you for your 5-star review! I'm so happy that we were able to provide the type of service, value and comfort guests deserve. We are extremely proud of our housekeeping staff because we know that without them, we would not be able to provide the clean rooms that guests expect while on vacation. We also know families work hard for their vacations which is why we provide discounts on all Disneyland passes and don't charge for amenities such as parking, WIFI, or use of the safe in the office. We look forward to hosting you every time you visit Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Poor treatment of people with mobility issues - degrading would not recommend
Summary: I arrived at the hotel with an injury to my foot. I had the assistance of a mobility scooter. I was offered no help with luggage, and their pathways were narrow with high kerbs which had caused me to trip and caused further injury.  The staff were rude, dismissive and unhelpful and in relation to my injury I didn't even get a "sorry". The lady just said "file a claim" in a very cold manner, which was made in front of other guests and I found it quite derogatory, humiliating and cruel.   I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone - mobility issues or not. There is no excuse to be that mean to people. I would have given this hotel no stars if I had the option.
Manager Response: Dear Shay, Thank your for writing about our hotel. I am sorry that our recent efforts to make our hotel more ADA accessible for a truly disabled person was not to your satisfaction. I reviewed footage showing your fall and noticed that you backed the scooter over the ADA-required yellow painted curb. I also noticed that you did not let us know you had the accident until you were checking out.  We try hard to earn a 5 star on customer service rating, however, we do understand that we may not be able to make guests such as yourself pleased.

Summary: Do not expect a big hotel like accommodation but its very exquisite. The room was very clean with wooden flooring. Car park is free and if you get the ground floor, the car is just outside your room. The location is perfect, very close to Disneyland.The staff was very friendly and we enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: Dear Siva,  Thank you for your wonderful review! Nothing makes us more proud to be able to serve our guests than when we get this type of positive feedback.  We look forward to hosting you again.

Summary: My son and I arrived at the motel very tired after a 13 hour flight and immediately we were greeted in the nicest manner by Alyssa. She was always very helpful and super nice with all the endless questions we had. Nothing seemed to be a problem. Very much appreciated. The room was comfortable and this was the nicest and cleanest bathroom I ever have encountered on my travels. Thanks to the fantastic staff there...! I liked the hard bed, so no problem for me there.  Unfortunately we had very noisy and in-considerated neighbours who kept arguing a lot till late THIS IS NOT A REFLECTION ON THE MOTEL!!! However, this didn't stop us from having fun and enjoying ourselves! We enjoyed the odd swim in the pool, also very lovely after a long hot day at Disneyland! I will certainly book
Manager Response: Dear Gundula,  I am so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay! We sincerely appreciate your business!   We look forward to hosting you the next time you visit Southern California.  Sandy

Summary: We stayed here while visiting Disneyland for our son's 4th birthday. This was our first road trip with our 4 and 1 year old. The Hotel was very easy to find and parking was super convenient.  While arriving really late at about midnight I was very impressed of a warm welcome received from the front desk. The lobby was very clean and smelled like a brand new house.That alone and the warm greeting from the front desk said a lot about the Hotel and its staff. Once checked in we walked over to our room.   This just got better. Our room had hardwood floors, ascent wall and a flat screen TV mounted on the wall. We woke up the next morning and felt very rested due to the cleanness, comfort of the beds and quietness in the room. Don't get me started on the bathroom especially the
Manager Response: Thank you, Edisa-Rasim for your glowing review. We love hearing from our guests, especially when they write about how much they appreciate our efforts to make their stay pleasant.   We look forward to hosting you next time!

Summary: Very nice remodeled room and close proximity to the park! As a Disneyland annual passholder, I've stayed in many different rooms around the park and this is by far the nicest of them all! Highly recommended!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for review.  I am very happy to hear you liked our renovations.  Annual Passholders love our proximity to Disneyland.  I hope to see you on your next visit to Anaheim!

Summary: My daughter and I camel straight from a cruise first thing in the morning.  They held our bags in a secure spot as our room wasn't ready so that we could head straight to Disneyland. When we returned we were so pleased with how clean our room was. Better than the Super 8 we stayed in previously before our cruise! The bedding looked new the bathroom looked just redone. Beautiful wood slated blinds! They printed our boarding passes for our flight for us, came immediately to show me how to correctly use the air conditioning and scheduled a shuttle for us to take to the airport. And to top it off they were kind hearted. We highly recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear Tdnagy,  I am so happy you appreciated the customer service we try so hard to provide. Our guests are loving our new bathrooms and plantation shutters and I am glad you did also. We hope to see you and your friends next time you visit Anaheim.

Summary: Very convenient location - close to disneyland and shops, also services by a shuttle which is helpful.  The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was amazing and by far the best I experienced during my time in the US. The water pressure was so relaxing after a long day in disneyland.  The staff were so helpful and nothing was an issue. They all went above and beyond to ensure my stay was perfect! Would not hesitate staying here in the future
Manager Response: Hello Jane-Dube,  Thank you for 5-Star review! I am happy to hear you liked our renovations and appreciated our efforts to make your stay wonderful.  Sandy

Summary: My wife was in love with are room which was 114 the bathroom was amazing and I loved the hard wood floors very quiet beds were nice and soft slept very comfortable 5 minutes from disneyland overall very pleasing and definitely going back!
Manager Response: Dear Chris,  Thank you for taking time to write about your stay.  You were one of the first guests to see our renovations and it makes me happy to hear your loved them. Families love our proximity to Disneyland and we make sure they come back to a comfortable hotel. We look forward to your next visit!  Sandy

Summary: The room was very nice and clean! The bathroom is nice and modern, and the shower was great! We walked about 15 minutes to Disneyland with lots of options of places to eat along the way. The young lady that worked the front desk was extremely welcoming and helpful. The only downside I'd say is the room could get a bit noisy. We could hear traffic all night and even our neighbor snoring! But the room did have a fan that we turned on to drown out the noise and slept well.
Manager Response: Dear Chevan14,   Thank you for your 4-Star review.  I am happy to hear you like our new showers and Grohe shower and vanity fixtures. We try to provide modern, comfortable and convenient accommodations at a very reasonable price. We hope to see you again next time you visit Anaheim!

Summary: We just check out of room 120 for 5 night and I can tell we love this hotel, the staff is friendly, rooms are clean great location and very reasonable we will continue to stay here on our trips to Disney.

We stayed here in Feb 2015 for a week. We really enjoyed our stay. The new staff was very friendly and helpful. They had recently remodeled our room and were in the middle of remodeling the lobby. They did a great job on the room remodel. The bathroom was nicer than our home! We had plenty of towels, clean sheets, plenty of soaps for our week stay. Other than the fireworks, it was quiet.  Overall, I'd recommend this hotel as a great value,especially for those cost sensitive. You can bring cereal, oatmeal, microwavable meals and use their fridge and microwave as needed.  The ART shuttle, route 10, to Disneyland is within 25ft of the lobby, making it very close. (http://rideart.org/). We chose to walk to and from Disneyland with the exception of the last day. Its a 15 minute walk.

That weekend we were suppose to stay at this other motel that when we opened the door it did not look safe at all. My fiance and I were not going to stay there. No way. We ended up leaving that motel and found this one on one of those one night stay hotel websites. Even the staff from the other motel was horrible. They made us talk to them through a glass window. This one the girl was very very welcoming. She put us in a room that was great. Refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker. And best of all you can get to Disneyland in ten minutes or use on of their shuttles. We have an overall good experience there. And we will definitely recommend it to anyone and stay there again.

Room was in very nice shape and looks to have been recently redone with hardwood floors.  Good location with shuttle bus stopping out front to Disney and Convention Center.  Staff was great, family owned.  The only drawback was the lack of breakfast but there's a starbucks a block away.

I was looking for a clean, inexpensive place for my son and me while going to Disneyland.  I was very, very pleased to stay at the Knights Inn for four nights.  Compared to other hotels in the vicinity, it was superb value.  To be fair, it is a basic motel.  Although there is an outdoor pool, and the room had a fridge, microwave and TV, we used none of that.  We needed only a place to sleep and shower after long days at Disneyland.  The staff were very friendly, and our room was evidently recently renovated.  It was clean, very spacious and comfortable.  We walked to/from Disneyland for three straight days; with my 10-year-old, it consistently took about 18 minutes to get from our room to the entrance gates --- so, it was economical (didn't have to pay for parking) and quick (no

I booked this hotel for our New Year's Disney trip because it was a decent price and had good reviews. The location was different than our last stay (at Super 8 on Katella), but it wasn't much further, so I didn't think we'd really notice. However having to walk across the freeway overpass made it seem much longer. It didn't help that the weather was really cold when we were there and the wind was super gusty, but we really didn't like the walk. It was nice that there was a Starbucks and Taco Bell right next to the hotel. The room itself was fine, nothing special. We aren't too picky as long as it's clean. The bed was NOT comfy, but after Disneyland we were usually exhausted, so it didn't affect our sleep much. When we first arrived it was really early, around 740am, so we

Upon entering the room everything looked great however my opinion changed upon entering the bathroom. Someone else's hair was stuck to the wall and there was mold growing along the base board and window sill.  The worst though was changing the toilet paper. The toilet paper holder was coated inside with some sort of disgusting brown substance.  I notified the front desk and the holder was replaced but the hair wasn't removed for 2 days and no attempt was made to remove the mold at all.  This is extremely unhealthy for guests.  When I mentioned this to the front desk again, the response was simply thank you for your concern. I got the impression nothing was going to be done about it.  Although this place is convenient I will most likely not stay here again due to their lack of

Summary Heading: Nice, but lots of little problems
Summary: Overall, this place was as nice as I'd read in other reviews: a great location (just off I-5), clean (laminate floors), etc.  But there were some little irritations that made me rate it Average:  - At check-in, I was required to have my credit card imprinted onto a blank charge slip with no total listed. When I started using credit cards (umpteen years ago), I was told never to sign a charge slip that didn't have a total because the business could fill in any amount they wanted to. They also made a separate $50 charge to my credit card which they said would be refunded the night after I checked out.  Watch your credit card carefully if you stay here.  - In my room (120), there were no electrical outlets next to the bed.  The only available outlet in this part of the room was on
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking time to write about us.

Summary: Three of us stayed at Knights Inn Anaheim, Nov. 2014. The hotel is convenient to Disneyland, maybe a 10 minute walk. There is an ART bus stop right in front also for those who choose not to walk. My first impression of the hotel was the very friendly clerk who checked us in. She gave me lots of suggestions for getting the most out of my stay. I felt comfortable that if I had problems or questions, I would be treated well.   The fridge and microwave in the room were practical amenities. The room was basic. Clean enough, but would have benefitted from being painted. Pretty quiet.  Good value.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to review us.  We hope you come back as see us again.

Summary: We stayed at the Knight's Inn for 5 nights during BlizzCon. We received all the needed information on how to get around (ART Bus system), maps and lots of other information as well.   The staff was very nice and It was a really great experience to stay at this hotel. Free parking, wi-fi, cable TV (even some on demand programming - which was very convenient). The room was very comfortable. No issues regarding outside noises.  There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel and it is possible to walk to Disneyland in 15-20 minutes.  There are lots of dining locations and two gas stations nearby.  Loved it !
Manager Response: Dear Sebastian,  Thanks for your wonderful review and the 5 stars you gave us!  We can't express how much we appreciate when guests rave about our service and value and convenience.  We hope to see you next year when BlizzCon 2015 is in Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Perfect for a trip to Disneyland
Summary: Recently stayed here for 17 nights and my third time at this hotel.  Staff are friendly and helpful (stored my bag on day of checkout etc).  Room comforable enough and clean and included fridge and microwave, which I got great use out of as Wal-mart is just up the street.  About a 15 minute walk from Disneyland with an ART Bus Stop just outside.  Some other guests were a bit noisy but this is not the fault of the hotel itself.  Will stay here again.  Also never had an issue with the free wifi
Manager Response: Dear Matt,  Let me start by saying that we love when our guests come back to stay with us.  It's even better when we are able to provide the kind of service, value and convenience which made their previous stay great.  Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us and our future guests! We look forward to seeing you next time you are in Anaheim, California.

Summary: I stayed in Knights Inn during Blizzcon Nov 2014.  Staff was friendly, room was clean and in room was everything that was needed: TV, refrigerator, microwave etc.  Only took me to walk to Blizzcon 30min.
Manager Response: Dear Marshal,  Thank you for your wonderful review! I am happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and that we were able to provide the value, cleanliness and convenience our guests expect of us. We look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary: Very nice people who run it. And the our room was clean with wood floors. It was minimal but we didn't need much. Has a fridge and microwave and comfortable beds. It's only 15 minutes walking to disneyland only thing they don't serve breakfast . And the pool is small
Manager Response: Dear Lia,  Thank you for taking time to share your 5 star review with us.  We love when guests let us know they appreciate the value and convenience we offer to families visiting Anaheim.  We look forward to providing excellent customer service again on your next visit.

Summary Heading: Great budget option with lovely staff
Summary: We had a great stay here, the room was huge as was the bed. Room was newly refurbished with nice carpetless floors. Cable tv and coffee maker. Free wifi. They organised our Disney tickets (at a discount) and spent loads of time chatting about how best to visit. Always willing to help with any request. Close to Disneyland - could easily walk but we chose to take shuttle to save our legs - very good choice. 5-10 min walk to fast food restaurants and Walmart. Only slight issue was could here a little bit of noise from street and other rooms. Recommended budget choice for those visiting Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your 5 star review! Our goal is to make sure your vacation is unforgettable. We start by providing a clean, comfortable room during your stay.  We have been in Anaheim for over 20 years and we share our insights with our guests to ensure that they don't miss any of the highlights our beautiful city has to offer. We hope to see you again on your next visit to Southern California.

Summary: This motel was more than I expected. We were able to walk 15minutes to Disneyland and was safe to walk in this area at night. The room was big, clean and services daily. The reception lady was friendly, gave us advice and gave us everything we needed.
Manager Response: Dear Caitlin,  Thank you for taking time to tell us about your stay. We truly do appreciate when guests let us know how much they appreciated the care we take to keep the hotel clean and comfortable. We hope you choose to stay with us again when visiting Anaheim.

Summary: I was worried about what we'd find when we arrived, but we were so pleased with our stay here. Loved the 'hardwood' style flooring and wooden blinds - the whole room had a very clean feel. Also, it was spacious enough that we had no problem storing all our road trip clutter. The beds were comfy - though an extra pillow would be nice. Super close to Disney - an easy walk; we even came home in the afternoon one day to swim in the very nice, if small, pool. We didn't care if it was small though - no one else seemed to be using it. The service was excellent. And all for 1/2 the price for other hotels in the area. We would definitely recommend and come back again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am so happy to hear you were pleasantly surprised by our little property! We try extremely hard to make you feel at home starting with the warm greeting at check in.  We also know guests love to walk into a clean, refreshing room when on vacation. Thank you for writing to us! We look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Great rates,Great friendly staff,Great room size,Clean, Safe
Summary: This was a whole family affair of 3 generation...We all stayed 3 nights started on Oct 1 - 4 2014,...Had 2 rooms our children and grandchildren had a spacious 2 queen size bed room, we stayed in a spacious king size room ground floor,could not have been more pleased with the size and frig,microwave, cleanliness,comfort and air conditioning/pool "due to it being so extremely hot there" while our stay..Great location to stores,food,eateries and Starbucks!...Also walking distance to main gate for Disneyland..The senor staff member Alyssa as well as the cleaning staff very nice and helpful.... Only down fall is the parking is a bit tight.......Definitely will stay again and refer to many others!
Manager Response: Dear M T,  Nothing makes us happier than a happy guest.  I am glad you really enjoyed your stay with us. We loved having your entire family stay with us.  We try very hard to make our rooms comfortable will all the amenities of home, including the refrigerator and microwaves.  Guests also love how close we are to Starbucks and Walmart Grocery.  I do apologize for the limited parking. We do guarantee parking for one car per room. We look forward to making your next stay with us even better!

Summary Heading: Best Motel Stay for the Price!!
Summary: My husband and I wanted to stay near Disneyland in a CHEAP, CLEAN, SAFE neighborhood. We would give this Motel 3.5 stars!!Through reading the TA reviews we booked a few days here. We were so pleased how clean the room, bedding and towels. Which were  important things to us since we would spend most of the time in Disneyland. It was so nice to return to the motel in a clean air Condition room after spending several hours at Disneyland. You can see the pride in ownership here. The young lady at the front desk informed me that they would be doing some painting and caulking in the room next to mine, between the hours of 10-4pm. Of which, I didn't mind because we would be in Disneyland. Upon entering the room, there were cosmetic blemishes on the walls. Probably caused by patrons not
Manager Response: Dear Raul,  I sincerely appreciate you taking time to review our hotel.  I am so happy to hear how much you appreciated the amenities we offer. Our goal is to provide just the type of accommodations you described. We will continue working hard to make our hotel even better for your next visit.

Summary: I booked 3 nights: 9/11-9/14. My husband, Sal, and I had come by some free tickets to Disneyland that would be expiring pretty quickly. We scrambled for an inexpensive hotel that was walking distance to the Maingate.   A closure on the Grapevine would put our arrival at 1:15am, and we were so tired, all we really wanted was a bathroom and a shower. The young gal at the front desk was extremely pleasant, and had our paperwork waiting for us (I had called to let them know we'd be arriving after mid-night). Check-in was a breeze, and I'm sure she must have notice how awful we looked, because she upgraded us from a Queen to a King room.   For the first time in all my hotel stays, the room looked EXACTLY like the photos I'd seen online! Clean, furnished nicely with a lovely red

Very clean hotel, free wifi, very friendly and helpful staff to welcome you. Cheap rooms, value for money, only downside was the noise. If you are looking for somewhere quiet this is not the place. I had to wear earplugs every night as there were constantly people getting back from disneyland that you could hear walking past talking and people next door having showers etc. Also the nightly fireworks from disneyland were quite noisy. Other than that I would definitely recommend. ART shuttle bus stops right outside and takes you to disneyland for $5 per day. Bus runs every 20-30 mins. You could walk but it would be around 15mins and after a day walking around disneyland that's the last thing you feel like doing trust me!

I have been to Disneyland many times and stayed with KnightsInnAnaheim hotel. The rooms in the hotel are luxurious and I love the meal served here too. KnightsInnAnaheim.com is the best place for finding hotels in Disneyland Anaheim, CA. I recommend it to everyone, who wishes to go to Disneyland.

My wife and I enjoy the two nights we stayed when we went to  Disney Park and California Adventures . We also like  the stay because of its cleaningness laminated flooring and they don't charge for parking.Great customer service :)

My son and I stayed here on our most recent trip to Disney.  In the past we have stayed at the Candy Cane Inn numerous times.  Needed to save some money this time, and Knights Inn seemed to fit the bill.  We got a room for about half the price of Candy Cane.  Lovely, VERY clean rooms with really great wood laminate flooring and wood window blinds.  Room was spacious with fridge, microwave and flat screen tv.  Keep in mind that if you walk to Disney you will have to walk over the highway (& on-ramp) and through a busy intersection. We chose to take the ART bus that stopped directly in front of the hotel (costs about $3-5 per person a day for unlimited riding).  It runs approx. every 20-30 minutes and was a great air-conditioned alternative to walking.  Fireworks are crazy loud on

My husband and I were on our way to Northern California and decided to stop at Disneyland along the way. We stayed at the Knights Inn for 2 nights and enjoyed our stay immensely. The room was very clean, love the laminate floors as they feel very clean. The owners were extremely polite and helpful. The ART bus comes to the front of the hotel and takes you too and fe Disney. Overall, great room for a great price. Would definitely stay hear again.

Very nice and clean hotels, I loved how it had wooden laminate floors and NO carpet. Very very clean and close to Disneyland, we walked and it took us about 10 minutes. The girl at the front desk was helpful. They have cheaper tickets here too. We will come back to this hotel when were in the Anaheim area for sure! Thank you.

I recently stayed at this hotel with my 8 yr old niece. We were going to Disneyland. This hotel was a great choice. There is a shuttle that you can catch literally right outside the hotel and you can purchase all day passes for cheap inside the lobby. I recommend this because it costs more paying on the shuttle and its not an unlimited pass then. The lady at the front desk was very nice and helpful! Anything I needed or asked she was able to provide me with. I definitely will be staying here again!

EXCELLENT!!! I came with my niece and her husband who're visiting from India. We planned to stay for two nights but extended one more night once we checked in. Everything from the day we checked in till we checked out were excellent. Rooms and bathrooms  are exceptionally clean. They had came and cleaned the room, replaced towels even we were spending three nights. It is walking distant to Disneyland but the motel provides multiple trip bus pass $5.00/ person is so convenient with little kids. SInce have lots of little nieces and nephews, I will highly encourage to stay this place this place and YES!! we'll def go back.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel at a good price
Summary: Our room at this hotel was incredibly clean and very roomy, with beautiful laminate flooring. I chose this location because of its proximity to Disneyland, and that worked out very well. I had planned for my group to walk to the park, but the hotel asked us to move our car earlier than we had intended to leave, as they were painting the parking lot that day. They credited our bill for what we paid at the Disneyland parking lot, which was very nice.The front desk staff were lovely. The hotel has a small outdoor swimming pool, open from 9:00 Am to 9:00 PM. My young grandson loved it, although we did not see anyone else using it. My one negative note would be that the towels were very cheap, thin and scratchy...but I usually bring along one of my own.

My family of 7 spent three nights at Knights Inn/Anaheim.  We had two rooms that were right next to each other.  I requested the top floor, back of the property, and rooms near each other.  The staff was very accommodating and met all of my requests.  They were friendly and helpful.    The rooms were clean and we loved the laminate floors.  It was 104 degrees while we were at Disneyland and the A/C unit kept both rooms nice and cool.  The pool was cold, but it didn't matter because it was so hot outside.    We have stayed in many hotels near Disneyland.  The quality of the Knights Inn was comparable to hotels directly across from the Disneyland entrance.  We drove and paid for Disneyland parking each day.  This worked out well for us.  We took a break in the pool every afternoon

The room was very clean, not a single bug anywhere to be seen. No mold in bathroom. It looks like they just renovated the place, everything looked brand new.  It's right around the corner from Disneyland. It also has a shuttle stop in front of the hotel. They do ask for a $50 deposit. I absolutely loved that there is a Walmart about a block down plus a Starbucks/ Chevron/Taco Bell next door. The people at the front desk were very courteous and helpful. I would definitely be staying at this hotel the next time I come to Anaheim!

Room was nicely remodeled and so very clean. The standards here far exceed what I have ever found in this price range property. Good location with many things to do in walking distance. Wonderful, helpful  customer service at check in and check out. Made for a very pleasant, relaxing stay.Definitely will be back and highly recommend.

to start with I was a little skeptical I haven't been in this town in 28 years but I was pleasantly surprised the hotel was clean the front desk was helpful and the price was right I will return..and it's only about 10 minutes away from restaurants Walmart and Disneyland walking distance, very very convenient..

I really didn't like the $50 deposit they add to your bill. The clerk said it would be refunded upon checkout after the room was inspected. 4 days later, still no return on our deposit. Were we supposed to leave the beds made or something? Otherwise, the room was fine, there are no black out curtains though, so when the sun comes up you're up too. Checkout was at 10am which is a little early. But close to Disneyland and eaterys.  Rooms were decent, but found hair in the tub, soaps and shampoo's are in dispensers bolted to the walls. Beds were too soft for my liking, but all in all its a ok place to stay. You can't expect high quailty for the price you pay.  I always take my own sheets, pillows, toiletries and disinfectants to clean up myself before getting comfortable.  Thats

Overall the room was good. The room was just a little small but it was very clean, it looked like it had recently had been renovated. The location was also good about a 20 min walk from Disneyland but just a 5 min drive.  It was also nice that they offered shuttle service. The front desk was also very helpful gave us information that helped us out.

My customer service expectations are always set high. From the moment I contacted the Knights Inn via phone the service was exceptional. Upon our arrival the front desk lady was welcoming and kind. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and good size. The only con was that the beds were a little hard. It was about a 6 min drive to Disneyland and they have the option to take a shuttle bus. Great value for the price even during a very busy week in spring break! We are so pleased with our stay and definitely will be revisiting again!!!

I was pleasantly surprised at how wonderful our stay was here. The front desk lady was my favorite part!! Friendly, professional, and truly cared about a situation we had with a completely unrelated company.  I would stay here before going anywhere else!!

Summary Heading: The best accommodation we had while vacationing in California.
Summary: The girl @ front desk, Alyssa, could not have been sweeter or more helpful. The room was exceptionally clean and well appointed. I highly recommend The Knights Inn in Anaheim, especially if you are visiting Disneyland and do not want to pay an arm and a leg. Great stay that was too short. Thank you Alyssa!
About 20-minute walk from Disney. Not many rooms and parking spots but nice enough for a night's stay.

We stayed here for two nights. Beds clean and very comfortable bathroom clean, shower hot. The shampoo was so good strangers came up to me and commented how shiny my hair was. It was a short walk to Disneyland and right near a bus stop. The staff were lovely, friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay here on my next visit to Disneyland.  Helen Melbourne Australia

This was a nice little place to stay at housekeeping came everyday. Ice machine was close to room parking was great. Pool was clean but freezing at this time of year. Overall good experience. Checking in was simple and they let you pick what time you check in although we choose the I don't know option because we were driving. Good pricing for this time of year.

Our stay there last month was very pleasant.  Cleanrooms,  great rates and perfect location for family on budget.  We got great advice and help from the lady at the front desk.  She was very sweet to my boys and very helpful with directions and ideas to all the locations nearby.  I strongly recommend Knights Inn in Anaheim for your next stay.  We will be definitely staying there next year when we come back

Summary Heading: The best most helpful people specially a worker named kiran
Summary: very helpful answered all my questions offered me many more answers very nice people I will go back again they were so inviting and had very nice rooms and clean.I enjoyed Disneyland a lot and I was super excited the motel was right across the street so convenient the employees there were very nice a tall man name Kiran help me with all my questions very very helpful nice man and as well all of the other staff

Can't ask for anything better. This place had it all. Clean room, good staff, parking and close to Disneyland and price was right. Will stay there again without a doubt. Have been going to Disneyland for the past 235 years and have stayed at many hotels/motels on Harbor Blvd. This gem is located just off Harbor but within walking distance of Disney/California Dreaming. If tired bus service is available door to door.

Summary Heading: Low price and a great value
Summary: I was hear for 2 nights with my family and had a lot of fun in Disney land.Really a best and a calm place to live in Room#127.They provided a free parking and a free internet.The room has a mini fridge,micro oven.The help front staff were good and friendly.

Excellent value!  We arrived early and the house keeper kindly cleaned a room for us on the ground floor.  Front office staff was helpful, friendly , knowledgeable and saw to it that our every need was seen to. Bed was comfortable as were the pillows.  Amenities were outstanding.  Let me just say that I am a retired travel agent who has booked and stayed at many Good Neighbor hotels surrounding Disneyland and I definitely recommend Knights Inn.

Happy to stay hear will be visiting again.The house maid was superb in service great quality room and perfect to stay to visit Disney land.Parking and Internet is free walking distance to Disney land and there is a Starbucks and the gas station near the street.Friendly staff......,

I LOVED this place.  I took my 6 year old to Disneyland for two days.  We stayed two nights here.  I scoured the internet for two weeks trying to find the best deal for our trip.  This place was the cleanest, quietest most affordable place I could find.  I reserved their package deal, for tickets to Disneyland and two nights stay.  Best price I could find. The room was super quiet, clean and comfortable.  It had everything we needed.  The front desk was kind and helpful.  I also bought the shuttle tickets through the hotel, which made our trip easy.  The pick up for the shuttle is right there.  I have been recommending this place to everyone I know. I will certainly come back!

I stayed there for 3 days. At the time of check in I also bought Shuttle pass for Disneyland, it was $ 5.00 a day. Front desk guy he was very nice, he gave all information for shuttle route, nearby restaurant, and Disney park opening and closing time. They were also selling discounted rates Disney tickets, but I didn't know and I already bought it online. Rooms were very nice and clean. At night time you can see fireworks of Disney park from the hotel parking lot.

This place has all the amenities but they are shabby.  The beds were like sleeping on planks.  The real issue is the way disabled guests are treated.  The real issue is the way I was treated.  I mentioned to the manager that a car was blocking the disabled access to the office that had caused me some inconvenience.  He ignored the comment completely.  When I said something to the people who had parked that way, he ran out of the office yelling at me that I was not to say anything to the other guests but take my complaint to him because he had given them permission to park there.  Note, I had told him and he ignored me.  The fact that he RAN out to YELL at me across the parking lot was the most astonishing part.  He had also been very uncomfortable with my wanting to charge my
Manager Response: Dear guest, I was sincerely sorry to hear that you felt you did not receive the type of service it is our mission to provide to our all our guests. I personally looked into your situation and noticed that your did not book one of our 2 accessible rooms which are located downstairs adjacent to the disabled parking spots. Although we were completely sold out that weekend and we could not change your accommodations, the desk clerk did offer to charge your scooter in our laundry facilities. There are sometimes last-minute circumstances which cannot be controlled on our part and we do try our best to accommodate all our guests' needs.

Summary: We checked in early around 1 pm. The rooms are very nice and clean. We checked out after 2 days. We have to catch a flight , so after check out they allow us to put our bags in their storage room until 5 pm. Customer service was very good.

Summary Heading: Perfect for Disneyland on a budget!
Summary: Together with my wife we decided to give my 6 year old the thrill of her life and take her to Disneyland for her first time. We only had 3 weeks to get everything together. I did long exhaustive search for the right accommodations. I tried to balance location, neighborhood, cleanliness,and most importantly PRICE. Sure you could spend more on a nicer room outside that you won't see much of or the incredibly expensive Disneyland hotels, but we were trying to put together a last minute, unbudgeted family trip. We chose the Knights Inn because it fit what we needed perfectly. Free parking, Disney good neighbor motel, great rate, clean and comfortable. Also make sure you buy your Disneyland tickets at the front desk.

Summary Heading: Nice to stay and the staff was helpful
Summary: I came around 12:30am in the night and being late night for check in the male front desk treated me with a good welcome and helped me very much.The room was clean and neat with a good smell and the room has microwave, mini-fridge, and flat-screen TV along the Wast room very neat which has a hair dryer and the bath soap.They provided a free wifi and a free parking.

This hotel has to be the best bargain in Anaheim!  The room (119) was quite large and comfortable, and included a microwave, mini-fridge, and flat-screen TV.  Paint seemed fresh, and all furnishings (bedding, desk, nightstands, dresser, bathroom counter) looked new and pretty upscale for the price/brand.  The lack of carpet in the room was startling at first, but very welcome upon further thought; who knows what lurks in hotel room carpets?!    Parking was free and plentiful, and there's a very inexpensive public shuttle available right in front of the hotel that drops you at the Disneyland transportation hub; it couldn't be more convenient!  The staff here was among the nicest, most accommodating I've dealt with anywhere - for any price.  My daughter was delighted with her

Summary Heading: The only thing good was the maid!!
Summary: The room was clean and the maid was friendly and accommodating. They say the hotel is a non smoking hotel. WHEN I TURNED ON THE AC THE ROOM SMELLED LIKE WET, STAGNATE, CIGARETTE SMOKE!  When I went to the office to ask a question and tell them, it was the man who was beyond rude!  He was no help and he rolled his eyes at me to my 13 year old.  The lady was a little less rude, but not accommodating, and not friendly at all!  How is it that these people haven't been fired?  They spend all night and day back in their apartment, (behind the front desk) you would think they would immediately come out to help people, but one has to open the door so they can ring the bell again, and again, once they do come out they act put out, short and rude! In a nut shell do not stay at this hotel,
Manager Response: Dear Guest, I am so sorry for the behavior you encountered.  There is absolutely no excuse for any rude attitude by any member of our staff.  I would like to assure you that we are indeed transitioning to new staff.  I completely understand that we are in a customer service business and our guest deserve the best service. I have also personally looked into and addressed the room air conditioner issue you mentioned.

Summary Heading: Super-clean room! Fridge, microwave! Nice staff
Summary: $93 a night but it was Thanksgiving week and I should have made my reservation when my daughter got her room for $63 a night.  I stayed in room 129 (upstairs and only stairs, no elevator) for six nights during Thanksgiving week 2013. The room was super clean with wood floors, not carpet, which I love because I have allergies. Clean bathroom and fridge and microwave and bed. Plenty of hot water. They were generous with the towels, too.   I asked for a quiet room and they gave me room 129, which was upstairs and at the back. It was quiet except for the Disneyland fireworks which seemed to start around 815 p.m. The hotel guests were quiet and courteous to each other. Disneyland, however, was not quiet on three of the nights. After D-land closes, and it empties out, then you will

The rooms werent cleaned right smelled like cigerrate smoke and plus they require a deposit of 100.00 per night refundable after you check out. Make sure your room is clean before you get into your room I will never stay here again when I got back to my home state I spent hours there because my daughter has asthma and the smell of smoke in our room just flared it up....
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write about your stay at our hotel.  Please be assured that all our rooms are 100% non-smoking.  The $100 deposit is to insure guests do not smoke in the room. We know our guests appreciate cleanliness so we try extremely hard to make sure the rooms are fresh and clean for all our guests..

Summary Heading: Perfect for Disneyland on a budget
Summary: Stayed here for 15 nights in September 2013.  THis was my second visit.  Hotel is located a brisk 15 minutes from Disneyland Resort.  There is a Starbucks and gas station around the corner and Walmart Neighborhood Market is only 5 minutes walk away (which is great).  The room was clean comfortable.  Fridge and microwave were great additions too.  I had a slight problem not getting the coffee replenished every morning however I ended up just leaving a note for the cleaning staff and leaving the tray out so they remembered.  Lady working on desk (which I assume are the owners) was polite and friendly although the gentleman was rather sullen.  I enjoyed my stay here and will be back.  I even had a package shipped to the hotel from Amazon.

I stayed here with two other friends while visiting the Disneyland Resort and was pleased with our stay. Every day we came back from the park, the room was clean and ready. Only about a 15 minute walk from the parks. Definitely recommend for anyone on a budget.

My friend and I spent 5 nights in this Inn which was recently renamed as America's Knights' Inn.  Our room had a microwave oven, coffee maker, hair dryer, ironing board and iron, toiletries and complimentary beverages.  I highly recommend this inn as they really pride themselves in providing clean rooms.  I had such a pleasant stay and it is only a 15 minutes walk to Disneyland.

THE perfect place to stay.The staff was friendly and helpful. the room was clean and quiet. We loved our two day stay and will stay here every time we come to calif. We highly recommend this place to all who come to anaheim.  ENJOYED OUR TWO DAYS AT AMERICA'S BEST ANAHEIM. TOU WERE WONDERFUL.!!! JC

The room was clean. That is the only positive thing I can say about this motel. The customer service was appalling. The website says they have direct tv; most of the channels are fuzzy, and when we called front desk, we were told they had antenna. They claim to be a family friendly establishment, but with no way to give a small child a bath after spending a day at Disneyland, that is completely untrue. The lady behind the counter, although completely unwilling to do anything for you, was at least, nice. The man, is a total, unprofessional, jerk. If you see him, just turn around. Stay elsewhere. The aggravation with this place isn't worth the lower price.

Summary Heading: Not safe; checked out early, and still charged
Summary: We stayed at this motel for one night during what was supposed to be a six night stay for a Disney trip.  As we tried to settle in, my girlfriend and I both came to the same conclusion.  We looked at each other and simply hated the room.  Something about it was just wasn't right.  The list of minor issues/oddities included: leaky refrigerator, wood laminate flooring, the pictures were too high on the wall - we joked that someone extremely tall must have done the interior decorating, bulk dispensers in the shower for soap/shampoo (ie individually packaged soap/shampoo was not provided), a large empty section past the bathroom at the rear of the apartment; all that was in this area was an old heater/AC unit built into the wall.  Above the heater on an adjacent walls was a bright
Manager Response: Dear Matthew, I appreciate you taking time to let us know about your stay. We sincerely value our guests' safety and comfort so i was very sorry to hear your stay wasn't pleasant.  Most of our guests rave about the laminate flooring and how clean the room feels because of it.  The rooms also have extra open space for our international guests or large families who require the space for luggage and children. I wanted to clarify that the 'red on/off' sign on the wall is only to point out the power for the air and heat unit. Please be assured that the electronic locks do indeed have a deadbolt on them and they are not accessible from outside if engaged. Thank you again for letting us know your thoughts.

Summary: Room is outdated, grainy TV reception. Wifi is not accessible from the room further from the front desk. Thin wall,  I can hear people slamming the doors upstairs as well as fire works from disneyland. Front desk was closed in the morning when I need to take the free coffee.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you so much for sharing your thoughts with us. We sincerely appreciate it when guests let us know how to improve our service. We do warn our guests that the fireworks can be quite a shock at first but our proximity to Disneyland does make it hard to block out all the noise from the fireworks show. We also just upgraded all our television sets to LED flat panels and also to a digital cable service so I will definitely look into why your tv image  was grainy. We also know that guests like to get an early start so our office does open at 7:30 every morning for fresh coffee. As another option, some guests walk around the corner to either Starbucks or McDonalds for an even earlier start. We hope you give us another try.

Summary: The hotel is clean, excellently located close to Disneyland and just a block away from a convenience store. Is perfect if what you are looking is something functional, clean and simple. The front desk personnel is polite and helpful.

Summary Heading: Good value for a Disney stay
Summary: We spent 4 nights here whilst visiting the Disney resort in Anaheim. There was a shuttle service to the parks but we didn't use it once, it was an approximately 20mins walk to Disney itself. The room was a nice size and clean, we had no problems during our stay. It is no 5* hotel but perfect for a stay like ours

The rooms was very good in size and very clean. Everything remodeled and CLEAN. WE liked the refrigerator, microwave, and coffee pot. The best thing we enjoyed while being in the room was FREE INTERNET!!!!!!!!!!

We were in a bit of a hurry 2 reserve our room. 2 quickly unload and meet someone at Disneyland.
