The lady at the front desk called the maid who then got  me a room right quick so we could b on our way. This room was my first experience with hard wood laminate. I liked that. The room was very nice, clean and even had soap dispensers along with shampoo dispensers. Altho, cleaning service will have 2 remember 2 check it 4 our soap was empty. But those things happen. Parking was convenient, but very limited. We pulled in late and there was only 1 more spot. Id hate 2 not find a spot. The overall experience was good. Clean. I'd recommend this place 2 my friends.

We stayed here for two nights and had a pleasant experience. Check in isn't until 2pm. Fortunately, they allowed us to pick up our Disneyland passes early, and even provided us our room key, although the room wasnt ready until after 2pm. The motel has convenient parking, friendly staff, clean room (we booked "Surprise Me" and got the 1 king, non-smoking), mini fridge, A/C, TV, soap & shampoo/conditioner dispensers, hair dryers, iron etc.. Basically, you have everything you need besides the glitz and glamour. There were no extra amenities like candy, coffee, water, etc. but who needs that if you're only there to sleep? For the price, which wasn't expensive, I'd say its worth it. It's literally a 5 minute drive to Disneyland, which we spent the majority of our time. My only

We stayed here whilst visiting LA and Disneyland.  The location is fine, right near disney and about 40 min drive into LA.  It was very easy to find and plenty of parking etc.  The room we got was on the ground floor but that was ok - it felt safe. (until the fireworks from Disney started and we thought we were under attack - wow they are LOUD)  The room was comfortable and quite clean.  The fixtures and fittings were all a bit old but there was a fridge in the room which came in handy for keeping our cheescake (from the cheescake factory) and water bottles.  The bed was comfy and the aircon was working which was nice.   I think there was a pool but we didnt use it.  There were no safes or coffee making facilities in the room.    The bathroom was clean but again a bit dated -

Summary Heading: Second time I've used this hotel and we'll come back again!
Summary: This hotel is awesome! The rooms are very clean, there is shampoo and soap in dispensers in the shower, a microwave and a fridge in each room and the beds are comfortable! We came over from Australia in 2011 and loved this hotel so much we came back! It is close to Disneyland, you could walk there in ~15 mintues or catch the bus out the front for $3 a day pass. The hotel is close to a supermarket, takeaway shops (KFC, McDonalds, Subway, Pizza) and there is a resturant just around the corner. We actually had food delivered to our room! You get a great view of the fireworks and the pool is really good. Great hotel for families or couples and the  lady at the front desk is very nice and friendly. She always goes out of her way to make your stay more enjoyable. We are going back to

The Hotel was fine. The room was very nice. The walk to Disneyland is a little over a 1/2 mile and over the freeway. After walking all day at the parks a bit much for me to walk back. If you happen to be at the hotel during the fireworks, don't freak out when the windows shake. Remember to bring your own shampoo and such for the shower, none provided. The room was cleaned very well every day. For the price and location this was a good stay. Caution: If you get a call in your room about lost reservation information it is a SCAM, DO NOT give them any information over the phone. Spoke to the front desk and they are unable to change the room phone numbers so this will probably continue to happen.

The rooms were very spacious and very clean!  We enjoyed our stay here very much with its close proximity to Disneyland Resort.  We were about a 15 minute walk from Disneyland, and used the ART transportation system the 2nd day.  The bus stop was right outside the hotel, and so convenient.  Thank you for a wonderful stay.  We enjoyed using both the microwave and fridge on a daily basis.

Summary Heading: Very clean, big rooms, big bathroom
Summary: Well, this Americas best inn is certainly deserving this name. The rooms are very clean, not carpeted but clean laminate (fake wood) flooring. The beds are solid and the mattrass is very comfortable if you like European style. (it's stirdy, not hammocking soft) The bed and bathroom are kept very clean each day and the bedding looks to be new and really fresh. There's quit a big space for suitcases, strollers or other stuff in the room as well and not in sight if you're watching TV. The Disneyshuttle stops in front of the hotel. Costs $ 5,00 per person for the whole day. Only negative, there's no breakfast not even a muffin or fruit.

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay near Disneyland..!
Summary: Recently we enjoyed to stay in "Americas Best Inn" with my family. Rooms were really very specias nice and clean with all amenities in affordable price. Its walk able distance to Disneyland (less then 1/2 mile.) We really enjoyed our vacation. Thanks to all staff of Americas Best Inn.

Just completed another great stay here. Always very clean & comfortable. The housekeepers are very nice & always do a very thorough job of daily cleaning. Never have to worry about my possessions. Swati & everyone else at this inn couldn't be nicer or more helpful. Fridge & micro are great to have in each room.  The ART bus picks you up out front for your trip to Disneyland. It is a small, quiet, well kept motel with free parking. This is a hidden treasure.

Our family stayed here for five nights in late Apirl. The room is large and clean. A big king bed is very comfortable. Sheet and covers are very clean and new. The staff clean the room everyday. On top of that, the rate is reasonable.   It takes 10 munites to the Disneyland by walking, but just a few minutes by driving.

Me and husband stayed here May 31 til June 2..everything was nice and clean. costumer service was great..loved that it was close to Disneyland and shopping..we will for sure stay here again in  October

My husband & I stayed from May18-24. This was a clean, safe place to stay.Yes the bldg. is a little older, but that just means the walls are thicker and it's quiet. The staff was friendly and accomodating, it helped that I speak a little spanish.  The location was wonderful, close to many attractions (Disneyland), shopping, bank, gas, interstate, etc. We didn't use the pool, but it looked clean and well kept, just a little small. The beds were very firm, I prefer a softer mattress, but this was not something that would spoil my trip. I brought my own toiletries as I prefer my brands, but soap, & shampoo were in dispensers in the bathroom. The only real complaint was the bathroom did not have a vent fan so the space stayed humid even with the window open, and the towels were a

First off, the pictures must be of a different, much better kept and remodeled location. The rooms abd grounds are horrible. I called the front desk because I only had shampoo in my room and asked if they had conditioner and lotion and was told they had lotion but I had to go to the loby to get it. (Poor customer service, in my opinion) When I rang the bell outside the front desk (since the door was locked) the man behind the counter handed me conditioning shampoo and told me that was all they had.  The air conditioners being used in other rooms sound like an airplane is landing next door too. In short, I definitely realize, in this case, you get what you pay for. I will never stay here again and would not recommend it.
Manager Response: Dear Loucille56, Thank you so much for taking time to share your opinion with us. I can assure you that the photos are current and reflect the cleanliness and comfort of our rooms. We recently installed shampoo and soap dispensers in all our rooms and guests tell us they love our efforts to be 'green.'  Guests also tell us they love the small sample products available at the front desk as a convenience to guests who forget to bring them.  Thank you again for sharing and please know that we are always working hard to provide a good value for our guests.

Summary: This is a great hotel to stay in budget wise.  ART bus picks up and is great to jump on after a day at Disneyland.  Rooms are serviced daily and staff friendly and helpful.  Starbucks is just a block away along with a food-mart and Walmart in the opposite direction.   Was a bit noisy with some barking dogs next door to the hotel.  This isn't the hotels fault.  Walls were a bit thin, but this is a budget hotel in a good location so can't complain. Would suggest upper floors.

Summary Heading: Great value, clean rooms, wonderful service.
Summary: We just stayed four nights and loved it. We are Disneyland season pass holders and have stayed just about everywhere within walking distance of the park. This is by far the best value.  It was recently renovated with quality laminate floors (so nice!), granite counters, and no popcorn ceiling. The walk is a little longer but you pass a Starbucks along the way (cheaper than in the park)!! Also no hidden parking fees like the close hotels.  The staff was friendly and helpful to meet our individual needs as they arose throughout our stay.  We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

wonderful Location, Price And Value defentlY Our Favorite Place To stay. It's Right Across The Street FromThe  EnTrance To Disney Land Wit Plenty Of Restaurants Near By. Easy To Go Back To Room For nap For You Or Kids. Pool Is Nice. Easy Walk To Downtown Disney.

Room and toilet was clean. I like the non-carpet floor. Location is alright, walkable to disneyland and a few fast food and a walmart within 10min walk. Not as convenient as disneyland area but i like it as it is very peaceful, not so busy. There is a fridge and microwave in the room. Good for guest who might face jetlag, waking up in the middle of the night feeling hungry. We bought a few frozen ready food from walmart and heat up with microwave when we are hungry. Would be good if tissue can be included in the toilet/room.

Hotel was very clean. Bathrooms were very clean and staff was very friendly. Great place to stay. Nice and quiet so ya don't have to worry about any loud noise. Only negative was that the beds are hard as rocks!!

Summary Heading: They saved my girls Disney Land Trip
Summary: We showed up in Aneheim and We were caught in a bind, it was Friday and my card wasnt working and bank was closed till monday. My girls were looking forward to this trip, as they wanted to get out of the Canadian Cold. So I got some funds via western union but no hotels would accept the check from western union and the only hotel that did saved our trip. I cashed the check the next day and payed them and stayed longer only because of their hospitality.  My youngest daughter really liked the pool and the rooms were very clean and the staff were really nice.

My stay at this spotless hotel was excellent.  The owners were so gracious upon our arrival. This is a basic motel, but so clean and the bed was comfy.  I love the fact that the floors were not carpeted.  The towels were thirsty, too!  I highly recommend this motel!  It's close to Disneyland, but not horrendously priced.  And it's close to many eateries!

Clean, We liked the the floor especially. Very well-mopped. Room has microwave and fridge Toilet well maintained and feels good  Some areas they could improve on: Two lamps spoilt. No ceiling light. No in room safe Concierge closes at 10pm. We wanted to leave our bags there and check in at night but they wouldn't let us do it cus they close at 10pm. In the end we had to come back from Disneyland at 2pm just to do a simple check in. No tissue/napkins Some power sockets do not work

I would definitely recommend this hotel. The room was clean, neat and well furnished. Nothing was old or shoddy. The staff were helpful. Wish more places at this price level were up to this standard. There is a starbucks 2 minutes away which is convenient.

My assistant booked this room through Prixeline and accidentally cancelled it. She called and explained to the hotel and booked the room again at a higher price. At check-in rhe clerk recounted the events and though she understood the situation at the time and understood I only needed one room, she made me pay for two rooms. The.hotel was only half full. This is cheating the customer as far as I'm concerned so buyer beware.
Manager Response: Dear Entrejos,    I'm sincerely sorry to hear about the mix up regarding the cancellation made by your assistant. I have looked into the double charge and see that the you were in fact only charged for one room. Given that we are small property with a limited number of rooms, we attempt to fill rooms once we receive a cancellation. We have a strong reputation for customer service and I can assure you that we strive very hard to maintain it.

Summary: I stayed here with my children for three nights and was very pleased.  The room had vinyl flooring which I loved with kids, no more black feet from old dirty carpet! There was not a breakfast included, but our room had a fridge and microwave and there was a market just two blocks away. The room,  beds and bathroom were clean and the staff was friendly.  I recommend staying here!

We stayed here for four nights on route from the UK to NZ.  We were looking for a budget hotel close to Disneyland as we figured we would only be sleeping there and this hotel more than exceeded our expectations.  The rooms were spacious and clean, the beds lovely and comfortable and an easy 15 min walk to Disney.  The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, we were always greeted with a smile and they were even able to book a trip to Universal Studios for us.  The breakfast of coffee and doughnuts/pastries was more than enough for us and our two growing boys.    My only suggestion would be to have a kettle and tea/coffee facilities in the room, it would have been nice to be able to make a cup of tea or something first thing in the morning or late at night.    Thank you so

Stayed here for a week while on vacation at Disneyland. No complaints about the room -- the laminate floors are nice, and the room was large and very clean. It is ideally located near the Disneyland Resort, as well as near several restaurants and Walmart. The family that runs this hotel is very friendly and polite. My only complaint is that this hotel claims to offer a free breakfast, when in reality, they offer only store-bought doughnuts and coffee. When contrasted with other comparably-priced establishments in the area that offer a *real* breakfast (something that is important when you're trying to save money by avoiding pricey resort food), this was a real disappointment. Also, beware that if you plan on retiring early, you will be woken up by extremely loud nightly

i really trust my fellow friends here before selected this place .. it was for 3 nights and we went there purely for disneyland ...  i have nothing to comment .. everything just nice ... after 14 hours in disneyland .. went back around 1am, park the car infront of the door and went to sleep .. very close to disneyland .. less than 5 mins drive ...  highly recommended ..

Summary Heading: Comfortable and super clean home away from home
Summary: I always anticipate an exceptionally clean room with great beds. Step outside and you are conveniently right on the bus line ten minutes away from disneyland. For a fee of ten dollars one can take the bus back and forth all day and night, if a little one needs a nap, etc. The staff is excellent and always make us feel welcome. "Swati" even remembered our family from TWO years ago! Recent upgrades were appreciated (like removing carpet for a cleaner environment) by those of us who have allergies, etc. Staying st this hotel ALWAYS a pleasure. Btw, there is a fridge and microwave for your convenience and my favorite restaurant pollo loco just down the street.

Summary Heading: Good Disney location and value but not quite up to scratch.
Summary: We have stayed in all sorts of hotels around the world. We felt this hotel would be a good budget option for close-to disneyland accomodation. The rooms were fine and as described - fairly plain but comfortable. Fridge and microwave were important for us. We like to take our shoes off in the places we stay (and leave them at the door) and expect the floor to be clean when we arrive. Our bare feet got a bit dirty on arrival walking on the floors! Who wants to get into bed with dirty feet?  There was another issue: We suggested to the manager (male middle aged) that perhaps there shouldn't be blood stains on our sheets (our bed had also been made with the bottom sheet 2 feet short of the bottom end of the mattress!). His response (to the blood stains) was that it was the fault of
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, I sincerely appreciate you taking time to write about the hotel.  Thank you so much for letting other guest know that the hotel is a 'fantastic budget option' ! And I am so sorry your experience was not what we strive to achieve. I apologize for the poor customer service you received and have taken step to insure it will not happen again.  Our concerns about the sheets have also been addressed. We really do like to hear what our guests have to say about the hotel so we can make future guests' stay a wonderful one.

Summary: When we first arrived the front desk was helpful and welcoming. The room was clean and had everything we could need. Just a short walk from fast food and service stations. 10 minute walk to Disneyland or just a 5 minute shuttle. Had a nice pool for those hot days. Also  When we couldn't connect to the wifi I called the front desk and they fixed it right away.  When we checked out the front desk offered to hold our bags as we were not leaving till later at night, which was very helpful as we could spend more time out and about. After reading the reviews I wasn't to sure about this hotel, but it was great service and I would most deffinatly stay here again.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfy rooms and good price
Summary: Our stay here was good; the motel is farily easy to find (close to freeway), close to some eateries (McDonalds, 7-11, KFC), and the rooms are a good size and clean. They look recently rennovated with laminate floor and fairly comfy beds, and a clean bathroom with natural light.  I don't rate the breakfast (donuts and coffee?!), but with the price it was acceptable - however, I just wouldn't advertise the breakfast, it's more of an added bonus, as opposed to a feature.  Not sure about the neighbourhood - but I think that's LA on a whole, there were several hotels in the same area as I understand it is close to Disneyland. Another downside to the neighbourhood is that a nearby house felt it acceptable to play loud music until approx 3am; however the air conditioners are loud

Summary Heading: Great location and well worth the price!
Summary: This was a great place to stay and close to Disneyland. Do not come here expecting a 5 Star hotel. This is a motel, but way better than any motel I've ever stayed at. Rooms were large, clean, and nicely appointed - seemed to be recently renovated. Laminate flooring - no nasty carpet. Fridge and microwave in each room. Beds were kind of hard, but after a full day at Disneyland we didn't care! Small, but clean and nice pool. We used it twice and had it all to ourselves. It is two stories and there is no elevator, so if you need a bottom floor ask ahead of time. Two blocks to McDonald's, Subway, 7-eleven, Starbucks. Three blocks to Walmart grocery store - take advantage of this to buy some breakfast to put in the fridge as the continental breakfast is donuts, coffee, juice. The

Summary Heading: Worse place to stay by disneyland!!
Summary: The people were rude and the rooms were filthy.. Couldnt get service the breakfast was a joke. Donuts from walmart and hot oj.. Do not stay here.  Had to call expedia to get the room rate fixed. It was a great location and the cost was lower then most area hotels but i guess you get what uou pay for.. My recommendation is to stay at best western not here.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am sincerely sorry to hear you were dissatisfied with your stay at the Inn.  We strive to make customer service a top priority.  One of the reasons our guest love our hotel is our cleanliness so your concern will be addressed immediately. We do serve coffee in the morning and have refreshments available also.  Being a small property, we are not able to serve a full breakfast. But, as you also agree, we are a great value for guests visiting Anaheim. Thank you for taking time to let us know your concerns. We always appreciate customer feedback.

Summary: To start out the front desk employes are very friendly and helpful. They helped guide me and my family to places to visit in California. The rooms were very clean. Disneyland is only 15 minutes walking and if we do not want to walk there is a shuttle right outside of the motel. Also, my children loved to play in the pool on the side of the motel. There is also a continental breakfast every morning so we did not have to worry about breakfast. So over all my trip was very nice and i would recommend it for everyone.

This hotel was clean, breakfast was OK... I don't know who eats doughnuts for breakfast, and to call it continental? I never ate that on the continent, and didn't eat it here either. The people were not really over friendly, I felt a bit awkward like I was an annoyance rather than a paying custormer. However it was close to Disneyland and easy to find, reasonable value with a clean, deep and refreshing pool after our 300 mile drive. Not bad, would recommend it to friends and family as it was reasonable value, good location and clean, it also had wi-fi, good tv, clean microwave and iron etc. Thumbs up.

Stayed here for 5 nights, very nice hotel. Staff are very helpful, and can also point you in the right direction of discount attraction tickets. Had a good nights sleep here. Very clean, Breakfast is also served, very good doughnuts. Is within walking distance of Disneyland, and also a good source of nightlife. Very good restaurant located near, Fire & Ice, serves exceptional food in a unique way.

I chose this hotel based on the reviews here on Trip Advisor. After I can back, I can’t understand why they have such a high rating, until I saw many of the high ratings come from reviews with this being their only review. It makes me very suspicious that maybe someone is padding their rating.  The good: The Mickey & Friends parking structure is less than a half mile away. I have an Annual Pass with parking, so this was nice; we were at the tram stop within 5 minutes.  Also, the rooms were cleaner than many of the other motel type hotels close to Disneyland. The laminate flooring was a nice change from dirty carpet. The bad: There was no “Do Not Disturb” sign to hang on the door. Our phone was very static-y when we tried to call the front desk.  I had to physically go to the
Manager Response: Dear Wendebird,  I am sincerely sorry to hear that your stay was not as you had hoped. I have read your comments with great concern and will definitely look into them.  Our goal is to provide a clean, safe and comfortable stay for all our guests.  I hope you give us another opportunity to earn your business.

Summary: A great inn located 15-20 minutes away from Disneyland resort! The service was nice and friendly, the price was great, clean rooms, the housekeeper was nice, the shuttle to get to Disneyland was in front. Conveniently located to some restaurants, a supermarket, and a gas station/Starbucks.
Awesome hotel!! Super comfortable beds!! Like I said...the breakfast was the best!! Next time I'm in Disney World I will come back to this ADFORDABLE hotel!!! :)

Me and my fiancee stayed here for 4 nights last month when we went to Disneyland for my 26th birthday. The location was perfect cause the shuttle stops right in front. The rooms were very very clean and newly remodeled and my fav thing was they had name brand toiletries. I would 100% stay here again.

The room was clean the bathroom was clean the floors were clean!  The wood floors were ideal and made the room very comfy . At the price it was a great choice. No complaints the bed was comfortable and the comforter was a great accent to the rest of the room.  :)  Will be returning next trip to Disney !!!

Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights on a Disneyland trip with my family.  Price was great and the location is perfect.  It is close to the freeway and there are many restaurants around.  While checking in on Sunday, the man at the desk seemed annoyed to be there. He may have been asleep and was woken up when I came in.  The rooms are OK. I really liked the wood flooring.  It is much nicer that dirty carpet that turns your feet/socks black.  No dirty feet here!!!  My main complaint is the bed.  Perhaps I was given the only room with bad beds, but they were VERY uncomfortable.  The were so hard.  Like sleeping on a concrete floor with nothing but a thin pad below me.  It was rough for 2 of the 3 nights.  The night after disneyland, I was so exhausted that I didn't care where I was
The staff is so courteous and always willing to help. Clean rooms, great parking and close to local attractions. So much to do here. I love California. Yeauhh!!

Summary Heading: Great place for vacation & affordable close to disneyland
Summary: Wow a nice place to stay aw some i love the staff very friendly they help us like friends plus very reasonable price too This place is sooo clean rooms are just like home i would definitely recommend to family and friends.

This place was a gem. All the rooms were spotless, and recently renovated. All staff was exceptionally helpful and nice. Prices were affordable, location was AMAZING! Right next to Disneyland, you can ask for much more. Would definitely recommend this hotel to ALL.

Our room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was always helpful and friendly. The owners went above and beyond with helping us buy Disney Tickets and driving directions to places around California. I did not have the issue with the male owner that a previous post had mentioned. He was really friendly and helpful, maybe he was just having a bad day when she/he had that experience. There are many food locations really close and Disneyland is a 2 minute drive 10-15 min. walk and shuttles come all the time. For what we could afford this met and exceeded our expectations. My kids and I really enjoyed having the pool available to cool off. I would stay again in a heart beat.

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay plus Affordable!!=D
Summary: This is our second time staying at this place and it was great!=D Just right for what we need it for. They updated, clean and decent sized rooms..=D This place never disappointed us. Great location because the bus that goes to Disneyland stops right in front of the hotel..=D Till our next stay again..=D

Summary Heading: Great hotel, clean, spacious and close to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel was better than expected for the price. My son and I stayed there from Mar 22/12 to Mar 27/12 and was very happy with our room.  It was only about a 10 min walk to Disneyland and if you didn't want to walk the ART Shuttle stopped right outside the hotel. The shuttle came by every 20 minutes and the drivers were very friendy.  There is a Starbucks, convenience store and a fast food Taco place about 2 min walk from the hotel.  McDonalds, kentucky Fried Chicken, Burger King and Subway are about a 5 - 7 min walk from the hotel.  The hotel room was very spacious and clean.  Fridge and microwave in the room were brand new and very convenient.  The staff (ladies) were very friendly and helpful.  I have to say, the gentlemen that was there during the weekend (not sure if he

This hotel was perfect for what we needed.  We stayed two nights on a disneyland trip.  The walk was only 15 minutes and the hotel staff was wonderfull.  Everything was clean and in working order.  I really appreciated the flooring, a nice laminate wood.  None of that nasty carpet that a million people have trampled.  The hotel staff was wonderful and very helpfull with all our touristy questions.  Nice bathrrom with plenty of hot water. Would definetly stay there again!!

This hotel exceeded expectations, it was very spacious and clean. It is a 10 min walk to Disneyland, however a shuttle is available also for $4 per person return which you can purchase from the reception desk.   The only downfall was the breakfast. Donuts (which was all that was on offer) is not exactly the first thing we want to eat in the morning and not sure who exactly actually classifies this a breakfast?

Summary Heading: Way more than I expected... Got a whole lot more then I paid for!!
Summary: Paid 57.00 total w/ taxes and fees on Priceline. room had brand new wood floors, furniture was all up to date, new, clean and matched! Free TRAVEL SIZED name brand toothpaste and lotion. Inside shower was shampoo and body wash dispensers... Again name brand. Shower fixtures all brand new, hot water never ran out! Towels need improvement... weren't large enough. Room had 1 cup coffee maker, microwave and mini fridge, directv, iron and ironing board. Beds were comfy, we had heater and air conditioning both worked as they should. Area felt safe, long 15 minute walk to Disneyland! But they do have a shuttle that comes ever 20 minutes, I don't know if it's free or not. We will definitely be staying here again!!

Summary Heading: A very nice motel,great price, clean and close to Disneyland. February is a great month for Disneyland, less crowds.
Summary: My adult son and I stayed here for a 3 day Disneyland trip the week of Valentine's. We had two rooms. Both rooms were large and nicely furnished, modern and clean. You could easily ask for a roll a way bed and still have lots of room. Both rooms had a refrigerator, microwave, hair dryer, iron and board and shampoo and body soap dispensers in the shower. The beds are comfortable. I always bring my own pillow. The are lots of places to eat close by. The walls of the motel are thin, but I kept the fan on at night and wore cheap earplugs, as I always do when I travel.

Summary Heading: Perfect for vacationing... When you'd rather spend money on other things!!
Summary: We picked this hotel as part of an Expedia package, SO glad we did. We had DLand tickets, plus a full schedule of other things, and really just needed a place to sleep and shower. This place is very clean, the front desk is very helpful, there is a fridge and microwave if you're buying food to make instead of eating out, not much of a continental breakfast but we just bought a bag of cereal, milk and some throw away bowls and spoons. It's not a super fancy resort hotel, I would not plan on using the pool... No lights or chairs (could just be a winter time thing?) but for families on a budget it is awesome.

Summary Heading: Great accomodation, cheap price, friendly staff, conveniently located.
Summary: We were visitng USA from Australia and emailed to arrange the booking. Snhel the manager was friendly and extremley helpful. We weren't expecting much for $40 bucks a night but boy were we pleasently surprised. The room was big, the beds and pillows were comfy and breakfast was provided(selection of donuts and juices). The staff are FANTASTIC! They booked all our tickets for tours, called our taxi's and were always willing to help no matter the time of day/night. The cleaning staff are friendly and efficent and the hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to a laundromat, food outlets and Disneyland. There is also a shuttle bus that picks u up from the front of the hotel to take u to Disneyland for 3 bucks a day. At night we stood outside our hotel room and watched

We stayed at this hotel from Jan 25 to Feb 1 - family of 4 (including a 4 year old and an almost 2 year old).  First of all the hotel doesnt have layaway beds or cribs so if you require one of these you should consider bringing your own playpen for your little one.  We found the place to be clean and recently renovated both from inside and outside. This is a small family owned place. It is very clean. The outside of the hotel has been recently renovated. It does NOT have an elevator so if you require one, good advise would be to request a room on the first floor so you dont have to go up the stairs. We had a double stroller so i had requested a room on the first floor well in advance and we had a room on the first floor when we arrived. The inside of the room is clean as well. I

Summary Heading: Good value, but powdered doughnuts are not breakfast.
Summary: On the outset this hotel is fantastic for what you pay (for us was $40 a night). The beds are comfy and the rooms are a good size and clean. But it's not a fancy hotel. The location is good, you can walk to disneyland in 10 minutes and there is a shuttle right outside the door. The staff are a little strange, and we were asked not once but 3 times to "leave a 10/10 review on tripadvisor and booking.com" which we thought was very unprofessional. This place is great as a place to crash after a full day at disneyland. As many people have said don't rely on this breakfast, chocolate coated doughnuts and dodgy danishes make not a breakfast - there is a starbucks around the corner though.  All in all a good value place to stay in a good location near disneyland.
Room was very clean,the price was good.We will stay here when we will visit Disneyland again.
Stayed here for 3 nights during my visit to disneyland. Front desk staff was very helpful! Rooms were clean and perfect for a place to sleep after a long day at disney.

The service here was great. I cant complain about the kindness and the helpfulness of the front desk.  The location was great too. Close to convenient stores and restaurants and walking distance to Disneyland. I cant complain about the price either. We did not wake up early enough for the complimentary breakfast, but regardless of the quality, we believe its hard to complain about any type of FREE breakfast. We loved that there was free wifi and the rooms were decent size and the washroom was quite clean. However, there were some problems we encountered which, unless it changes, we probably wont return.   First, the walls were thin. We could hear everything that went on outside so it was very hard to sleep in when people are talking outside. We heard a lot from the room next to
Manager Response: Dear Candizz,  Thank you so much for taking time to review the property.  I am happy to hear that you enjoyed some of the complimentary amenities we offer.  We try hard to make guests' experience at the property a positive and a memorable one. I was very concerned to hear about the rash you developed. Please be assured that I will immediately address your concerns so that future guests will also have a good experience.

Summary: Comfortable & clean rooms. Staff is very helpful & accommodating. Room prices are very good, esp if you book in advance. I had some physical issues at one time and they were concerned and helpful. Close to the Disney parks with the city bus directly outside. I have stayed here several times & will continue to do so as I have no complaints and do enjoy my stays here. I would recommend ABI Anaheim to anyone who enjoys a smaller hotel, with plenty of parking, great location, clean rooms, and a wonderful staff.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to review us.  We hope our future guests will see what a great value we are after reading your words.

Summary: We booked in april with an amazing 50% offer from booking.com, we thought it would be just a cheap place to sleep but turned out to be much better than that. Room was cleaned everyday, the reception was managed by a friendly couple and WiFi coverage was perfect and fast. We had fridge and microwave in the room, plus TV (HBO included). Breakfast was just coffee, juices and donuts/danish as I already read in previous comments but it was more than enough for us. We could park our rented car there without any extra charge and if the weather would have been better we would have used the pool for sure. It was simply an amazing deal! :)

My son and I came to visit Disneyland for 3 days, and could not have found a better location to stage our trip from without paying over $100/night.  The hotel is a short walk from the park, the maid service was flawless, we felt safe the entire time, had free WiFi and a refrigerator, and saved a good $150 on accommodations compared to almost any other property so close to DLand.  Anyway, we'll definitely stay there again the next time we come.

The area that this motel is located is not the best . Our car was broken into and  tons of stuff was stolen. The first girl we talked to at the front desk treated us like we are lying. She said that the security camera didn't pick up any activity just to call us back later that day to let us know the area we were parked in (right in the front of the motel) had no camera but if it made us feel any better the were going to install some. Well great for the mote,l were is all of our stuff. When we talked to the manager she said she would call us back when we did not hear from her and called her back a few hour later we were told that she had gone home early and was on vacation Worst experience ever we will never go back to that motel.
Manager Response: Dear Tami S,  Thank you for taking time to write about your stay.  I take customer feedback very seriously, especially when it comes to the safety of our guests.  Although we are in the Resort District of Anaheim and the area is family-friendly, we never take hotel security for granted.  Please know that a new security camera system has since been installed to ensure the safety of our guests.  I hope you choose to give us one more opportunity to earn your trust and business.   Sincerely,  Sandy Patel General Manager

Summary: Had an awesome stay, staff were more than helpful with helping us to get tickets for nearly all the attractions that we wanted to attend & also called us cab's everytime we needed them. Nice & close to Disneyland & if you wanted you could see the fireworks from there as well. Rooms are clean & tidy & we also had TV a fridge & microwave & coffee machine as well. Wifi was great & didn't cost us anything to use. Rooms can be a bit stuffy but there is airconditioning for you to use. The pool was great after a long day walking around Disneyland. Shops, laundry mat & take awayfood places are all a short walking distance away. I would stay here again if I went back to the USA & would recomend it for a good cheap & clean place to stay.

The first day we came back at 2 and they hadn't cleaned our room at all. The second day we came back at 430 and they had not made 1 of the beds, and they turned the air conditioning off. So we came back from 8 hours at disneyland in 100 degree weather to a steamy room. And I should mention the a/c was not on when we checked in either. It took over 3 hours to cool down. Also their shuttle service costs four dollars a person, so unless you have three people or less it is more expensive than parking at disneyland. The free breakfast consists of doughnuts and orange juice, not even cold cereal. And the manager comes out to count how many people are eating. I will never stay at one of these places again.
Manager Response: Dear Colietaylor,   I appreciate you taking time to post a review of the hotel and I am sincerely sorry to hear that your stay was unpleasant.   We aim to provide a clean and comfortable place for our guests,  yet remain environmentally responsible by reducing energy consumption while guests visit the Park during the day.  I apologize personally for the discomfort you experienced upon returning to your room.   Sincerely,  Sandy Patel General Manager

Summary Heading: There would be better places to stay in the area
Summary: PROS:  Air conditioning, which is good because the rooms are hot and stuffy  Pool, in Septmeber the weather was still quite hot so the pool was a blessing and no one was in it!  Location, it's a 10 min walk to Disneyland. We were too tired to go back in the night to watch the fireworks but we walked to the end of the street (which conveniently has a 24 hr service station!) and saw the fireworks from there.  Wi Fi Connection was reliable and the TV had cable (HBO etc.)   CONS:  Room was hot and stuffy, the air conditoner was there but it was a very noisy unit and you could hear other rooms air con quite clearly so you need to have yours on to drown theirs out. The hot water is set to a temperature, which is bordering on the cold side, you couldn't adjust it to your liking. This

I arrived on the wrong date! Made a mistake with the travel advisor. However, staff were helpful, gave us the room without any fuss, room was clean, everything worked, bed comfy. About 5minutes from Disney. It is no palace, but satisfied our needs completely. Would recommend if like us you are out at the park all day.

We stayed here while we went to disneyland.  We caught the shuttle to and from hotel (which I recommend if you have little ones who need to nap, because you can catch it whenever on a day pass (3 day passes available), with parking once you leave you have to pay again when you get back).  The hotel smelled clean (big deal for me).  It is not the hilton, but if you are looking for a hotel that is affordable and comfortable, clean and convenient this is it.  We loved the location. Parking is free so when we got back to the hotel we just went out to eat.  Staff could be a little more friendly, but we only talked to them to check in and check out. So no big deal.

Summary Heading: Great Location. Lovely staff, would recommend & return
Summary: We stayed for 11 nights at Americas Best Inn. Great location, very helpful staff. Had the use of safety deposit box in reception during the stay. Provided complimentary breakfast, although I did not take advantage of this. It's unusual to find this in USA. Appreciated free WIFI and free parking. Both of these are quite important during our stays as can be a large sum from holiday spends.  We went in pool, wouldve been nice to have couple of sun loungers to use but there is a few chairs I would've liked larger towels as I'm a big girl. :-) but I realise they're standard as each hotel we stayed in provided similar.  Would definitely recommend this hotel and hopefully will get the chance to return. I was sad not to see the lovely lady on reception on day we checked out. Hope msg of

Stayed here actually a couple years ago.  might have paid about $30-$40 for the night.  It was extremely cheap and worth it.  It wasn't horrible.  Just convenient, easy, and worth it.  If you're looking for something fancy, i wouldn't recommend staying here just because its cheap and would be in your budget.  I, however, was a poor college student, so it worked out perfectly.
Rooms were very clean, staff friendly.  Breakfast was as advertised, sweet rolls , orange juice and coffee.  Easy walk to Disneyland for adults and older kids.  Exceptionally good value for the area.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay after visiting Disneyland
Summary: My hubby and I stayed here from December 26 to December 29, 2010. Cheap hotel since it was $54/night. With tax, it was $62/night.  Room had a mini fridge, microwave, free wifi, and a clean bathroom. It looked like the rooms were remodeled since there was granite in the bathroom and on the nightstand. The bathroom comes with face soap and conditioning shampoo. Bring your own toiletries if you need lotion and better shampoos or soaps. Otherwise, the bed and bathrooms were clean.  We didn't have any problems with the flooding in the shower tub. Just do the following: 1) Pull the shower tub faucet tab up. Pull as high as necessary. 2) Turn on the hot water, and the water should come from the shower head.  There was continental breakfast in the main lobby. The choices are juice,

Summary Heading: Worst Hotel Ever Stayed In Dont Waste Your Money
Summary: The worst ever dont stay here . Motel 6 would be better. Door to bathroom stick, my son got stuck in there. Toilet over flowed or wouldnt flush most of the time. We stayed in a room with 2 queens and they gave us 4 pillows we asked for more they said they had no more. We found trash under our beds from last guests so GROSS. Shower was only hot for about 15 minutes so only 2 people could take a shower per day. We stayed for a week with small children it was hell. Suppose to be a dream vacation not a hell vacation this hotel ruined our vacation for sure. When I originally called the hotel they said the pool was heated and they serve breakfast. What a joke is that. Pool is ice cold and breakfast? Plasic cup with orange juice or coffee and stale danish. Front desk not helpful at all
Manager Response: Dear mwlitjer,  I am so sorry your experience at the property was not pleasant.  I will definitely make every effort to address the concerns you pointed out.  I sincerely appreciate guests' concerns and try very hard to fix any areas in which we need improvement.

Summary: Hotel was very well kept up and clean room. Was with my Husband for a Disneyland trip and wanted to stay somewhere close and affordable. Was pleasently surprised at how clean the rooms were and how friendly the staff was. Left my car parked at hotel and shuttle picked us up right outside and took us on a less then 10 minute drive to Disneyland. Even let me park there an extra day after i checked out,since it was not too crowded, to take advantage of my park hopper tickets!  I would definatley stay again and refer this hotel to friends! A+++++!
Manager Response: Dear msrbrown,  I am delighted to hear that you were very happy with the property and our service. I know you have many choices for hotels in the area so I am especially pleased that you chose America's Best Inn Anaheim.  I hope to see you again next time you are visiting Anaheim.

Summary: My sister and I spent two nights at this motel and found it very clean and within wALKING DISTance to Disneyland. The office staff was very helpful and we would recommend this motel asd a place to stay when visiting Disneyland. The price od $41.00 per night made our trip very economical. Audrey Hamaliuk Cathedral City, CA
Manager Response: Dear AudreyCathedralCity,  Thank you so much for taking time to give us your thoughts! I'm glad you enjoyed your stay at America's Best Inn Anaheim.  We try to our best to make your stay a good one. We hope you choose to stay with us again.

Summary Heading: It COULD have been worse - at least we saved some cash
Summary: This was our first trip to the LA area so we found something basic and within our price range. We survived unscathed - but I'm 100% positive better options exist. We had a strange interaction with getting discount tickets...  Location-was very close to Disney, but not within comfortable walking distance. They do have a shuttle for $4 per person which we did not use since parking at Disney is only $15. It's on a fairly busy road and there was some traffic noise at night.  Rooms-were acceptable. Clean, relatively well maintained especially for the price. Our air did not work as well as we hoped, and TV channels were limited to say the least (did have HBO). The hotel does have a pool but unless you are desperate this is not going to be a pool worth using. Walls were PAPER THIN! We

Room was cleaned properly.  However, book early and get a motel across the street from maingate.  The location was not walkable with young children ( unsafe, high-traffic area, walk up a steep bridge) Not safe to walk at night or day.  They charge 4 dollars per person to use their shuttle, give you a danish and cheap drink for breakfast, and are not very friendly but standoffish.  We wound up paying 36 dollars more when we checked in "services taxes," and we wound up paying 30 dollars to park at the Disneyland parking lot for 2 days and then it took an hour just to get to the maingate.  Overall the location, breakfast, and area appear unsafe and their motel sign even has graffiti on it.  Plan early, book a room across the Disney maingate, eat at IHOP or MCD's or the 8.99 buffet,

Summary Heading: Basic motel, good rate, but hairs under pillow turned me off
Summary: Name somewhat is confusing because it is right next to another hotel with very similar name. I went to the other one first by mistake, and liked the looks of mine better when I walked next door. Two story basic motel. Definitely not walking distance to Disneyland, I would think, but $4-a-day shuttle stop is right out front.  Another nice feature was free wifi - got the userid and password from the front desk. It had A/C but you have to use a wall switch to turn it on - had to ask at the desk because I didn't notice the switch and thought the A/C was broken.   Overall it looked OK, but for one thing. When I came back late at night from Disneyland and pulled back the sheets and pillow on one of the beds, there were short black hairs under the pillow. Ugh!!! I slept in the other

This hotel is very close to Disney (in walking distance). It is simple but very OK. The rooms are clean and have everything you need. Don't expect much on the free breakfast though. Overall, a hotel I will go back

We stayed here for 3 nights.  It is your basic motel but well maintained. Our room looked like it had recently benn renovated. Everything looked new and fresh.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  We walked to Disneyland (probably too far for kids to walk) and the motel helped us get discounted tickets.  The only disappointment for us was the breakfast. It's just a danish with coffee and juice, but since the room was so cheap, we can't complain too much. There are lots of restaurants nearby.

I normally do not stay at smaller hotels because they are hit or miss.  America's Best Inns & Suites Anaheim-Disneyland North (ABISAD) pleasantly surprised us both!    The staff was well trained and friendly.  The room had all the amenities we needed while there and was exceptionally clean.  My wife always does an initial cleanliness inspection upon our arrival to a hotel and it even passed her over the top standards.  As an internet/email junkie the free WiFi was also a huge plus.  Why all hotels do not provide it is beyond me.  The location was also perfect as it is in walking distance to the park.   All in all, we would both stay here again - especially given the great value.

Summary Heading: Excellent value and lived up to its high reviews
Summary: This is a great value motel, very clean and well run.

Title says it all, this place was great. First, and most importantly, the hotel was walking distance from Disneyland. The rooms were clean and well furnished (had a microwave and fridge). The service was great, and breakfast was included. Additionally, there was FREE WIFI! (I've stayed in crummy motels and 5 star hotels where they didn't have WIFI or charged an arm and a leg to use it)  Overall, the you got the high end hotel experience without the cost. Would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Clean rooms, friendly staff, & great location!
Summary: Great location.  Staff working front desk was friendly and helpful.  Rooms were clean and quiet.  Cost of rooms were very reasonable.  Loved location.  Close to everything especially Disneyland.  Very safe area.  This is the only place I will stay when I am in the Anaheim area.

Okay, first let me say what was good....great location.  We walked to Disneyland and there is a new shopping mall right down the street with good restaurants (Cheesecake Factory, Roys, PF Changs, etc).  With that said, that is the only real good thing about this hotel.  When we first walked into the room, the smell was horrible.  I wouldn't even take my shoes off the entire time because the carpets were disgusting.  Our drain in the shower filled up so that by the time you got out, you were in 6 inches of water.  After they cleaned the bathroom, the floor still had hair on it.    Had this hotel been really cheap, I would not be complaining because it was a very low budget hotel.  However, after tax, the room ended up being close to $100 / night!  Definitely not worth that.  The

Summary Heading: Basic but comfortable and a great price. Close to Disney.
Summary: Another shopping trip to the States for us both and picked this hotel being close to the Highway and Disney and within easy access to some great shopping malls in CA.  It was bright, comfortable and clean, great solid bed and the shower was powerful. All that you really need in a motel without paying for the expense of the bigger places.   Walked every day to Disney, which was a great way to keep fit after consuming a hefty American portion of food.  The only downside to this place is the awful coffee they serve in the mornings along with the orange juice which seemed heavily watered down. The danish pastries were nice though.   They do need to consider putting tea/coffee making facilities in the room though, especially when they have a fridge and microwave. When asking for hot

Booked this hotel on Priceline for only $35, so I was definitely skeptical, but I was very pleasantly surprised. The room was very spacious, with brand new furniture and a remodeled bathroom. Very clean! The bed was soft and comfortable and clean. There was a fridge, microwave and a very powerful air conditioner.  The television had basic cable and HBO but there was no remote. This hotel also has FREE WI-FI!!! Very, very convenient and definitely a necessity for me. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is very close to Disneyland (you could see, hear and feel the fireworks) but a bit far to walk to the main entrance. But the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) has a stop right in front of the hotel. There is a continental breakfast, but it is very, very basic. There is a

Our shower had a VERY slow drain.  By the time you were done cleaning yourself off, the water would be to your calves.  The remote was missing to the TV and you couldn't turn it on without one.  We tried acquiring one from the front desk, but they didn't seem to understand much.  The "free" continental breakfast consisted of two pitchers with juice and coffee.   You really do get what you pay for here.

Summary Heading: Not Friendly, Good Price, but a Disappointment
Summary: My family and I stayed here for 2 nights. Got a suite (3 double beds) for $65/night., which was a great deal. But when i called to confirm the week before I arrived they said that it was a ridiculously low price and that the staff probably made a mistake and meant 2 double beds, not 3. When I showed them the e-mails with the price they quoted me, they had to give it to me, but i bet I got one of their employees in trouble. There seemed to be some miscommunication amongst the staff, and they were not very friendly.  The room was very spacious. One bed was in a separate connecting room, but before we got there they had not turned on the A/C, so it was soo stuffy and humid (literally unbearable - not even exaggerating). To ensure that didn't happen again, we left the a/c on low

Summary Heading: Sometimes, you get what you pay for.
Summary: The hotel staff was very friendly, which is a great plus. And I really thought the maid did a wonderful job, as far as tidying up the room. Also Disneyland was a walk away, and Universal Studios wasn't too far away either.  I only had a few problems:  1) The walls in room #33 are either paper thin, or some people need to turn their TV's down. The permanent resident next door was always blasting their TV from 11pm to 2-3 am, all week. We never saw them, but then from 7am-10am, they'd be back at it again. We called and complained finally to see if they'd turn it down, but I didn't notice a difference. And the next day they were doing it again.  2) When we got there, there was blood on the shower curtain. Ick.  3) The bottom metal frame to the door was busted and bent, and tried to
I will stay at Anaheim America's Best again. It is within walking distance of Disneyland. The room was neat and clean, well cared for. The people at the dest were very cordial and friendly.
